Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Haja.  She is married and has two children, ages 12 and nine. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because she needs them to help her with her domestic work while she is selling.

In 2005, Haja established her food items and household utensil business.  She began her business to generate enough income to support her husband and provide a livelihood for them so they can educate their children.  Her business is open seven days a week and 12 hours a day. Haja earns about 4,380,000 SLL every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy additional stock.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately 657,000 SLL.  

In the future, Haja plans to develop her business and to help her family live a comfortable life.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more household utensils for sale

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.ar: حمزه عمره 27 سنة  متزوج ولديه ولدان طموح يعمل في مجال تجارة السيارات منذ اكثر من 10 سنوات تاريخه الاقتراضي في المجموعة جيد جدا ملتزم  يحب عائلته ويريد لها التطور يهدف من خلال طلب  قرض من المجموعة  توسيع مصلحته وشراء سيارات جديدة  للمصلحة وهو محبوب جدا من محيطه واكثر زبائنه هم  اقاربه وجيرانه واصدقائه لأنه ملتزم بالعمل يواجه صعوبة في السيولة وقد اتيحت له فرصة الى جعل المصلحة خاصة له.

loans.use: purchase a new vehicle for the busniess

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya, and has been doing dairy farming for 4 years.  He has a family of 3.

He has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says the loan and purchase of a dairy cow will make his dairy business more profitable.  He adds that the milk will also be consumed by the family as well as sold to pay for the education of the children.  He wants to venture into the wholesale dairy business.

He says his challenge remains animal diseases.  He appreciates the partnership with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ai

texts.en: Ai C. is a 29-year-old woman who has been living in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. To earn of living, Ai C. is employed in a garment factory since 2008. She has a formal salary every month in order to support her family’s expenses. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a building worker. This couple has give birth to three children, all of whom are single and still living under their roof.  Ai C. is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling to her workplace. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Ai C. has requested a loan of $300 to be used to buy a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita E., from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Iligan City, is 44 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Charita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Charita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory, she is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more products to sell, including beverages and biscuits. This will be Charita's third loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vicente Martín

texts.es:
Vicente Martín R. L. tiene 30 años de edad, Es casado vive con su esposa y junto a sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Vicente Martín se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño seria  mejorar la calidad de vida.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Vicente Martín R. L. is 30 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 4 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Vicente Marín is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and makes his sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his rice, banana, corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve his quality of life.  He enjoys going out for walks with his family.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: The Amna Muhammad Altaf Group

texts.en:
Amna is married and the mother of three sons and two daughters. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in an area named Kot nihal singh in Okara, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. Amna sews clothes for her neighbors and works as a housewife to provide for her family and share the family’s financial burden with her husband. All of her children are attending school, except for the youngest who is still too young. Amna is literate and she teaches students in her home to earn extra income.

Amna’s husband is M. A.. He is involved in a dairy business and has a buffalo at home that provides milk to sell. He has a number of customers in the neighborhood and earns a good monthly income. Amna is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to purchase another buffalo to increase the family’s ability to sell milk and serve more clients. Amna is hopeful that, with this loan investment, her husband will be able to increase his business profit.

Amna is a regular Asasah loan recipient and this will be her third loan. She has a good repayment record and has never missed a loan group meeting.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Lisbeth Maria

texts.es: Lisbeth tiene 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar  ella se dedica al comercio aproximadamente dos años actualmente tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio adicionalmente el padre de sus hijas le pasa una pensión mensual,el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para sacar su0 licencia de conducir, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is 37 years old.  She is a single mother who lives in her own home together with her four school-age daughters.  Lisbeth has been in the sales business for approximately two years.  She currently has a grocery store located in her home and her daughters' father provides her with a monthly allowance.

Lisbeth will use her loan money to get her drivers license.  She is being given this loan because she has good references and both the desire and ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Drivers license

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito P. is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Pablito is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Pablito owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Pablito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pablito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pablito has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Pablito is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Pablito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Gueume Sa Bopp 2 Group

texts.fr: Gueume sa Bopp  2 est un sous groupe complémentaire  de la cellule APEC  Al Ouma Gueume Sa Bopp de la localité de Yoff. C’est un groupement mixte de 21 personnes qui habitent  presque dans le même  quartier. Ils sont représentés par madame Sokhna D.  qui est l’adjointe a la présidente. Madame D. s’active depuis plus de 30 ans dans le commerce de tissus, de chaussures, d’huile de palme et d’autres produits divers. Elle s’active aussi dans la petite restauration. Elle  a choisi son activité par passion mais  aussi par soucis de se procurer des revenus  qui peuvent servir pour la satisfaction de besoins personnels. Elle sollicite un crédit de 2 250 000 frs pour le groupe. Ce montant est prévu pour l’achat de produits destines a renforcer et a diversifier  leur stock. Leur principal objectif est d’accroitre leur revenu et  d’améliorer  les conditions de vie socio-économiques de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
Gueme sa Bopp 2 is a group belonging to the branch APEC Al Ouma Gueueme Sa Bopp in the village of Yoff. This is a mixed group of 21 individuals living near each other. They are represented by Mrs. Sokhna D., who is the Vice-President. Mrs. D. has been working for over 30 years selling fabrics, shoes, palm oil and miscellaneous items. She also prepares food for sale. She has chosen this work because she was attracted to it but also in the desire to earn an income allowing her to provide for her personal needs. She is seeking a loan of 2,250,000 West African Francs for her group. This loan is destined for purchasing various goods to increase the members’ stock. The main objective of the group members is to increase their income and to improve the socioeconomic conditions of their respective families. 

About this loan:
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 

Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas),  Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children.   They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week.  Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: Bolstering business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new tires & paint his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Tashpulat

texts.ru: Казиев Ташпулат проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование-среднее. Уже год как занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Tashpulat K. lives in J.Rumy.  His is 50 years old, married, and has two children.  He has a high school education.  He has been working in animal husbandry for a year.  He is raising his flock so he might later sell them. He is taking out a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Monica tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande,una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Monica vive en la parte céntrica de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida como salchipapas, salchipollos y gaseosas. Vende su comida y bebidas por las noches durante las horas de cenar. Tiene 2 años desarrollando su negocio. Monica es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela ya establecida.  Cuenta con una refrigeradora, mesas, sillas y un carrito sanguchero, una unidad móvil no motorizada que viene equipada con todas las herramientas para preparar su comida. Monica solicita un crédito para comprar un nuevo refrigerador para mejor guardar sus productos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Monica  es conocida para Edpyme Alternativa, siendo éste su segundo crédito con la institución. Monico manejó bien su primer préstamo y tiene un buen historial creditico.
texts.en:
Monica is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in her mother-in-law's home, with her husband and children, in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Monica lives in the central part of this district and has access to the basic services of water and electricity.

Monica's business is making and selling food such as salchipapas (a fast food made from thinly-sliced, pan-fried sausage or hot dog, french fries and condiments), salchipollos (a similar fast food but made with chicken) and sodas.  She sells her food and drinks in the evenings at dinner time.  Monica has been in her business for two years.  She is very well known in her area and has an established customer base.  She has a refrigerator, tables, chairs and a sandwich cart (a non-motorized vehicle which comes equipped with all the tools necessary for preparing her meals).

Monica is requesting this loan to buy a new refrigerator so that she can keep her products fresh.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Monica is already known to Edpyme Alternativa as this is her second loan with the institution.  She managed her first loan well and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator to keep the meals that she prepares and sells fresh

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-four-year-old divorced  man with four children and  he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the wholesale business for four years. He started with a "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business and saved to start a shop. His hardship is loss of goods during transportation from Kampala and his vision is bigger business and a permanent residential house, plus educating the children. Joseph intends to use the credit facility to buy sodas and books for resale.

loans.use: To buy sodas and books for sale.

loans.name: Samson Mwangi

texts.en:
Samson has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He is 37 years old and single.

Samson was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and cultivate the land for planting season. In the future, Samson hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to cultivate the land for planting season

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema sells fish. She is 32 years old and married with four children. One of them goes to school. Neema requested a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou is a 44-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. She sells fresh fish in the Baray market and makes around $2 in profits each day. 

She has a life partner in her husband who works on their farm. When he has time to spare from his farming business, he goes fishing in the local lake.

Nou is asking for a loan of $800 to rent a machine to plow her existing farmland, and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds.

Nou has four children: two are employed as sewing workers in a factory, and two are married and live in their own houses.

loans.use: to rent a machine to plow her farmland, and to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Necitas has a retail shop that sells biscuits, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Necitas is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Necitas hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Nieves is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home and send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Jane has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for two years. To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and buy herself new clothes. In the future, Jane hopes to own a vehicle.

Jane is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital. Jane's group is comprised of seven hardworking women.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Graciela Maria

texts.es:
Graciela de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, contando con los servicios de agua y luz,  está ubicada en el distrito de Pimentel que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica a la pesca y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Graciela es la venta de productos de primera necesidad (venta de arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc.), en su domicilio desde hace unos 3 años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos diarios de su hogar.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.  El sueño de Graciela es tener más adelante una tienda más grande que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y lo logrará con su trabajo y empeño.
texts.en:
Graciela, 34, lives with her husband and three children in her own house which has running water and electricity.  It is located in Pimentel which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  This area is known for its fishing and tourism.

Graciela sells basic need groceries (rice, milk, oil, sugar, etc.) out of her house, where she has been in business for three years.  Since the store is in her home she can attend to customers at any hour of the day, which gives her a competitive edge over other stores.  This allows her to increase her income and cover household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy more merchandise and expand her business with other products to increase sales.  Graciela's goal for the future is to have a large store that will generate more income so she can give her family a better lifestyle, through her hard work and efforts.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to expand her store.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 26 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorelie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Lorelie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  Lorelie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lorelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Flora; tiene 65 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 6 hijos todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica al comercio  minorista, la socia  desea invertir el crédito en la compra de ganados y animales menores, como cuyes, aves de corral, la socia se dedica a la venta de carne, compra y venta de ganados, ovejas, compra y venta de animales menores como cuyes, aves de corral;  la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca,  cuyes y aves de corral pollos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "FUENTE DE VIDA” (Fountain of Life). It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Flora, ia 65 years old. She is married and has 6 children, all of them self-reliant. The member is engaged in the retail trade. She wants to invest the loan in buying poultry and small animals such as guinea pigs and poultry. The member sells meat, buys and sells cattle and sheep as well as small animals such as guinea pigs and poultry. The member is asking for the loan in order to buy a cow, guinea pigs and poultry.

The member is grateful for the support given her and likewise agrees to make the repayments of her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy a cow, guinea pigs and poultry

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo, es un pequeños agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es brindarle una mejor condición de vida , don Reynaldo desde hace varios años de dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta so n las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ya que está plantación  presenta malezas , la planta no tiene un buen color y sus hijos de piña no crecen los suficiente para ser sembrados , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que sin estos programas de ayuda para personas humilde y es muy escasos recursos no fuese posible darle mantenimiento a diversos tipo de cultivos .
texts.en:
Reynaldo, is a small-scale farmer  in the Ticuantepe area.  His plan is to provide his family with a better standard of living.  

Reynaldo has grown pineapples for several years. The biggest issue that arises is pests that invade his crop. Since his plantation has weeds, the plant doesn't have a good color, and the side shoots don't grow enough to be planted.  

He appreciates the support that Afodenic offers through Kiva funding, as without these assistance programs for poor people, and given his scarce resources, it wouldn't be possible for him to maintain the different types of crops he has.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
Wilhelmina is single with no children. She is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Wilhelmina is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice . 
Wilhelmina has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Wilhelmina hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Don Silvio lleva años desempeñandose como guarda de seguridad, tambien su esposa administra una pequeña pulperia y palmea trotillas en su casa y ah si cubrir todos los gastos.
Con el credito anterior logro comenzar un cuarto el cual no termino, y que continuara  y que espera terminar. Ya que con este credito comenzara su muro de su vivienda, ya que se han dado muchos robos en el barrio, y quiere dar mejor seguridad a su familia como  reguardar  su propiedad.
Sus cuatro hijos siguen estudiando, y que espera poder seguir apoyando para que logren mejores condiciones de oportunidad en la vida.
texts.en:
Silvio has been working as a security guard for years. His wife runs a small general store and makes tortillas to sell to help cover all their expenses.
Silvio used his previous loan to start building a bedroom for his house. It is not finished yet, but he plans to keep building and finish it. With this loan, he will start building a wall around his home, as there have been a lot of robberies in his neighborhood and he wants to keep his family safe and protect his property.
His four children are still in school, and he hopes to continue being able to support them to give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to build a wall to protect his property.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers and bitter ball (a vegetable) for her business.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Oeun is 54 years old with 7 children. She is a farmer and she also catches fish for additional income. She has been a farmer for 29 years. This is her second loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to plant rice paddy on it. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income for family expenses and some savings and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to plant rice paddy on her farmland and buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a 52-year-old single woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the hog-raising business for 5 years. Aurea works hard to improve her business. She extends support in sending her nephews and nieces to school.

Aurea has requested a loan to purchase feeds and piglets. She hopes to have a stable business and improved living conditions. She also hopes for her nephews and nieces to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and piglets

loans.name: Nidia Elena

texts.es: Doña Nidia Elena trabaja en la alcaldía, desempeña el cargo de obrera de servicios generales. Ella está interesada en realizar este crédito con el fin de  realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y poder comprar zinc, clavos, cemento, arena y bloques. Ella tiene que encontrar las formas de pagar las cuentas de su hogar y pagar la cuota del crédito. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación sabe que puede lograrlo, pues sus aspiraciones son de seguir proporcionándole mejoras a su hogar.
texts.en: Nidia Elena works in city hall, office of general services, and she holds the office of general services worker. She is interested in using this loan to make improvements to her house and to be able to buy zinc, nails, cement, sand and blocks. She has to find a way to pay for her home expenses to afford the terms of the loan. With much effort and dedication she knows that she can succeed, since it’s her dream to continue making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy zinc, nails, cement, sand, and blocks.

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.ru: Нуруло предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он три года. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. Уже три года как предоставляет услугу. Он развозит пассажиров по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Nurulo provides a taxi service.  He has been in this business for three years.  Nurulo is 40 years old and married.  He has been providing this service for three years and transports passengers along the Vahdat - Dushanbe route.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба молодая женщина, замужем и  мать троих детей. До замужества отучилась на ювелира и сейчас занимается  тонким ювелирным делом. Мастерит женские  национальные украшения из золота необычных узоров. Свой готовый товар продает на рынке и в основном делает эти изделия на заказ. Имеет большой каталог образцов на любой вкус. Пока у неё нет своих учеников, так как у неё маленький ребёнок и на учеников почти нет свободного времени, но в будущем планирует открыть свою мастерскую и обучать девушек своему делу. Сотрудничает с нами с 2010г. И брала кредит на покупку лома для своих изделий. Сейчас уже кредитуется во второй раз  и очередной кредит использует на хозяйственные постройки. Так как муж Насибы сейчас на заработках за пределами города и у них началась стройка дома,Насибе необходим наш кредит.
texts.en: Nasiba is a young married woman and a mother of three children.  Prior to the marriage, she was studying to be a jewelry maker and is now involved in a fine jewelry business.  She makes women's national jewelry from gold with unusual designs.  Nasiba sells her goods at a market and primarily makes the jewelry to-order.  She has a large catalog of samples for every taste.  She does not yet have apprentices because she has a small child and would not have time for apprentices.  In the future, Nasiba plans to open her own shop and teach her trade to young women.  She has been partnering with us since 2010 and previously obtained a loan to purchase scrap to make her jewelry.  This is now her second time obtaining financing from us, and this is another loan to be used for household buildings.  Because Nasiba's husband is currently working outside the city limits, and their house construction has began, Nasiba needs our loan.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Gurgonia

texts.en:
Gurgonia is 64 years old and married with 8 children.

Gurgonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Gurgonia has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Gurgonia aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en: Arkadi is a teacher at the local school who lives with his wife and two children. Unfortunately, his salary is too low to make ends meet, so he is also engaged in cattle breeding. Arkadi has applied for a loan to increase his herd and to purchase forage for the cattle. Development of the farm will allow him to increase his income, which will help him finish renovating his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and forage

loans.name: Avidego Tchonvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVIDEGO TCHONVI est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marguerite Dovomè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marguerite Dovomè vit au Bénin et est mariée à Dieudonné. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et quatre sont à leur charge. Marguerite Dovomè  vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Marguerite Dovomè vend à domicile des céréales et des fagots de bois. De façon parallèle, Marguerite Dovomè vend aussi divers produits ; ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Marguerite Dovomè s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marguerite Dovomè ensemble avec les membres du groupe AVIDEGO TCHONVI, sollicite un second crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des céréales.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah, age 45, is hopeful and happy at the idea that she can change her future and that of her family. She resides in Nkubu, Kenya. She has been practicing farming for 15 years on her small plot, where she does dairy and crop farming. Norah enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. 

Norah has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. With the loan, Norah will be able to improve her income level and to take care of her family. Her projections are that, by the end of the first year, she will be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her 4 children and husband.
You can help this strong willed woman to do great things in her farming business and her life. A loan can do a lot for her.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old, a widow, living at Upper Bayao,Tukuran,Zamboanga del Sur. Her income derived from farming ,together with her children they plant different variety of rice.

Luzminda previous loans was already paid that's why she availed another loan to purchase fertilizer& pesticides for her rice production.

Her future plans will venture to corn production and to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers&pesticides for rice production.

loans.name: Petranka

texts.en: Petranka D. is 63 years old with high school education in economics and has more than 20-year practice as an accountant. Her husband Stoyan Dimitrov has 30-year practice as a choreographer in a folk dance ensemble in Silistra town. In October 2000 they retired and in order to support financially their family at the end of 2001 they set up “STOJER IS” Company. The main activity of the company is choreography and accounting services. Stoian Dimitrov is dealing with the choreography and his wife – Petranka D. is in charge of the accounting services. The family has two daughters that are married and live in Varna.

loans.use: Purchase of a new computer and Business Navigator Accounting Program

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy maize and beans

loans.name: Armando Amade

texts.en:
Armindo Amade W. is 43 years old, he was born and raised in Inhassunge, a Zambezia Province. He studied until the 6th grade. In 1981, Armindo was recruited to the military service and was discharged in 1986. He had 5 children with his wife who passed away in 2003 from an illness.

Since 1999 he has been providing for his family through his small commercial establishment in the Boane Market. In 2006 he was referred to HLUVUKU—ADSEMA by a friend. Armindo’s business is in good condition. It provides employment for Armindo and one of his sons, as well as supporting the family.

With the 19.000,00 MT loan Armindo will expand his business in order to keep a flowing stock to meet his clients needs. Armindo’s store has a positive impact in his community because it makes basic products available to his clients, especially in the Neghborhood 6. With his savings Armindo has been investing in improving his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 6 - Boane Cliente: Armindo Amade W. Sector de actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 19.000,00 MT (760.00US$) Aplicação do montante: Compra de produtos . Inicio: 09/05/2007 Final: 30/04/2008 Armindo Amade W., de 43 anos de idade, natural de Inhassunge, Província de Zambezia, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos seus Pais. Estudou até 6ª classe. Em 1981 foi recrutado para o serviço militar e teve a sua desmobilização em 1986 e conheceu a sua parceira pelo qual teve 5 cinco filhos e depois ela veio a falecer em 2003 por motivo de doença.

Desde 1999 vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial nas redondezas do mercado do Boane. No ano 2006 por indicação de um amigo que foi cliente da Hluvuku teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU—ADSEMA.

Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego a um dos filhos e com o rendimento do negocio suporta encargos familiares. Com o empréstimo de 19.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de negocio de forma a evitar ruptura do stock. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque coloca o produto mas perto do cliente com particular destaque para todos residentes do Bairro 6 e com as poupanças tem investido na ampliação da sua residência.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
In the past 15 years, Tarcila has become an expert on aluminum and glass products. She was born in Ayacucho, Peru, where she now owns a reputable shop in the center of town. Her clients are not only friends and neighbors, but also people who come from all over the area who have heard of her services. Most of her business comes from individuals who want custom frames for paintings and photos, often to give as gifts. She is especially busy around Christmas time. Other services incluD. replacing broken windows or cutting custom glass pieces for house doors.

Tarcila is married and has 4 children, all of whom live away from home. She runs the administrative and customer service siD. of the business, and her husband does most of the manual labor, which includes measuring, cutting, and filing glass to customer’s specific orders. He says all their work is custom maD., and sometimes requires ordering specialty glass.

Tarcila hopes to receive a loan for $700 dollars. She explains this money would be used to knock down on of the walls in the shop to expand the space and reduce clutter. She has been dreaming of this project ever since moving to the large storefront several years ago. As her clientele continues to expand, she says the space is much needed.

loans.use: Tarcila hopes to receive a loan for $700 dollars. She explains this money would be used to knock down on of the walls in the shop to expand the space and reduce clutter. She has been dreaming of this project ever since moving to the large storefront several years ago. As her clientele continues to expand, she says the space is much needed.

loans.name: Okakah

texts.en: Okakah L. is 41 years old and has been a trader for nine years. He is married with four children and has a shop where he sells kitchen utensils to people in his area. He is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan US $550 to buy more kitchen utensils for his business.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for sale

loans.name: Dipu

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipu M. is a 35 year old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Mangal M. and their two sons. Her older son is in grade 8 and her younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. M. and her husband opened their kitchenware shop five years ago. In their shop they sell different types of steel items like dinner plates, glasses, jugs, spoons, cups, cooking pots and much more. The revenue from the shop meets the basic needs of the family. Now they are requesting their fifth loan to buy more steel goods and expand the shop.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware items

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a dedicated entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. She supports herself and her 16year old daughter with a small grocery sales business located at a busy market in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. Rosa started her business about 10 years ago at the suggestion of a friend. With dedication and hard-work, her business has prospered and now provides a good income for Rosa and her daughter.

Rosa has requested a six-month loan of $1000 to purchase a new refrigerator unit for her kiosk. This loan will help her to continue offering good service and a variety of food items to her customers, increasing her sales and income as a result.

loans.use: To purchase a new fridge unit

loans.name: Domitila Del Carmen

texts.es:
The sale of food is a very competitive business because of the fact that many people dedicate themselves to this activity and the client’s decision is based in all moments on buying from whoever prepares the best food. Because of these motives, Ms. Domitila Levya is an excellent cook and dedicates herself to the business of selling food in the Mayoreo de Managua market. 12 years ago she began this activity in the outskirts of the market without having her own store, however as the months passed and the necessity of caring for her two small children grew, she looked for a way to solicit for her own place in the market and it was granted adequately. Today thanks to the support that Ceprodel offered her for half the loans, she has been able to amplify her business in the purchase of materials such as plates utensils and place settings. Her necessity these days is to invest in the infrastructure because her store is small and therefore doesn’t present good conditions for the patrons.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy competitivo por el hecho de que son muchas las personas que se dedican a esta actividad y la decisión del cliente se basa en todo momento en comprar a quien prepare mejor los alimentos. Por este motivo la señora Domitila L. es una excelente cocinera y se dedica al negocio de venta comida en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua.

Desde hace 12 años inició esta actividad en las afueras del mercado sin tener un local propio, sin embargo a medida que pasaron los meses y por la necesidad de mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos, buscó la manera de solicitar un local propio en el mercado siéndole otorgado satisfactoriamente.

Hoy en día gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los préstamos, ha logrado ampliar su negocio en la compra de materiales como platos, pailas y cubiertos. Su necesidad actualmente es invertir en infraestructura ya que su local es pequeño y además no presenta buenas condiciones para los clientes.

loans.use: The sale of food.

loans.name: Veselin

texts.en: Veselin V. is registered as a private agricultural producer in the village of Rogozen near Vratza. He breeds 4 cows in his own cowshed. His wife works in Spain, and each month she sends him some money, but he still needs to buy a new cow for his farming business.

loans.use: To buy a new cow for his farming business

loans.name: Len

texts.en: Mrs. Len H., 38, is a mother of three children and works selling grocery products in front of her house. She normally, earns around $3 a day in revenue. Her husband supports the family income by working as a farmer on his rice field. He normally earns around $3 a day. One of their children is married and lives away from home. She requests a loan from Kiva to purchase grocery products in bulk to save money. The leftover money will be used to buy a cow to assist her husband’s farming which will give the family further income.

loans.use: Purchase grocery products and a cow.

loans.name: Bakogma

texts.fr:
Mrs. Bakogma B. was born on July 23, 1973 in Lomé. She is married and has six children who are all enrolled in school. She has been managing to make ends meet since 2001 by selling used clothing. Her sources of income are so limited that she is not even able to pay rent. She has built herself a shelter out of sheet metal in the Agbalépédo neighborhood where she and her children live.

This first loan in the amount of US$ 250 will allow her to purchase a bale of used clothes so that she can improve her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame B. Bakogma est née le 23 juillet 1973 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et a six (6) enfants qui fréquentent tous. Elle se débrouille à travers la vente de friperies depuis 2001. Ses sources de revenus sont tellement limitées qu’elle n’arrive même pas à supporter les loyers ; Alors elle a fait un enclos avec des tôles au bord des rails dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo où elle réside avec ses enfants.

Le premier crédit d’un montant de 100.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter un ballot de friperie afin d’améliorer son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase of a bale of used clothing

Achat d'un ballot de friperies

loans.name: Neurn

texts.en: Mrs. Neurn E. is a farmer in Taing Russey Village in Kampong Speu Province. In the dry season she grows vegetables and during the monsoon season she grows rice. Last year she hired a cow to plough her field but it was very expensive, so she is now asking for a loan so that she can buy a cow for herself. She is 44 and married with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in state school. Her husband, Mr. Ron Chuon, is a farmer. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy a cow to plough her land.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
The desire to continue with her studies is Ruth's motivation to work hard at her business of selling cosmetic products. She started in this venture thanks to one of her relatives who invited her to enter into the business. Ruth offers her beauty products at her place of study, as well as to the general public. Thanks to her efforts, dedication, and persuasive nature with regard to sales this activity has turned into an important means of income which helps her cover her educational expenses. This smart, hard-working young woman wishes to obtain a loan and invest the funds to obtain better results. This would provide her also with more peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El empeño de seguir adelante con sus estudios superiores es el motivo que tiene Ruth para esforzarse en su negocio de venta de productos cosméticos, se inició en esta actividad gracias a uno de sus familiares que la invitó a incursionar en este negocio.Ruth ofrece sus cosméticos de belleza en su centro de estudios y al público en general, gracias a su empeño, dedicación y don persuasivo para las ventas esta actividad se ha convertido en una importante fuente de ingresos que le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su educación. Esta joven inteligente, dedicada y emprendedora desea obtener un préstamo, dinero que le permitirá obtener mejores resultados luego de su inversión para su tranquilidad.

loans.use: Increase of capital to grow the amount of merchandise she offers for sale.

loans.name: Fiataua

texts.en: Fiataua L., 30, is married with 5 children.  She has 6 months of experience in the cigarette business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately $145 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiataua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  This loan will be used for the business.  Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To buy cartons of cigarettes so that she can sell them loose.

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Mrs. Pok V., 50, and her husband Mr. Chin Khut, 60, married in 1979 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of their children are married and live outside the family home. The couple live with their grand-daughter along National Road Number Five about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pok V. has been in the business of selling food for many years. She sells beef soup in the village. Beef soup is one kind of famous food in Cambodia. We take the soup with beef and meat balls and put it in a hot pot until it boils; after that, we put vegetables into the pot and eat it.

Pok V.'s husband is a motor taxi driver. Now he wants to change from motor taxi to Motor Remorque taxi (a motorcycle with a trailer at the back) but lacks the money. Therefore, Pok V. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to buy a Motor Remorque taxi for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a Motor Remorque taxi for her husband

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón inició el negocio porque es una actividad que le gusta mucho y en la cual puedo tener más libertad que si estuviera como empleado en alguna empresa y puede llevar una vida menos agitada. Comenzó en el mes de Abril de 1998 cuando en su trabajo anterior como mensajero conoció a una persona que trabajaba la fibra de vidrio lo cual le interesó mucho y entonces el se ofreció a enseñarle el oficio en sus ratos libres. Por un tiempo trabajó con esta persona y después se independizó y logró instalar su propio taller en el patio trasero de su casa y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad ya cuenta con muchos clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar el material necesario para elaborar los pedidos que tiene por delante y que sus clientes reciban a tiempo los productos que le han solicitado.
texts.en:
Ramon started his business because it's something he really enjoys. It also allows him more freedom than if he were an employee at a company and makes his life less stressful. He started in April 1998 while he was still at his former job as a messenger. He met someone who works with fiberglass and became very interested in the trade, which that person offered to teach him in his spare time. He worked with him for some time and then started his own business. He set up a workshop on the patio behind his house and since then has done very well with his business. He currently has a large number of clients.

Ramon is seeking a US $400 loan, to be repaid in six months. He will use the loan to purchase the materials he needs to fill the orders he already has so that his clients can receive what they've ordered on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thi G. 51 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, gia đình chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ vay vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào kinh doanh dịch vụ cho thuê phông bạt, loa đài, bát đĩa phục vụ đám hiếu, hỷ trong địa phương, công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị rất phát triển bình quân mỗi đám gia đình chị thu từ 400.000đ đến 500.000đ, ngoài công việc kinh doanh cùng chồng chị vẫn chanh thủ thời gian đi chợ buốn bán nhỏ cho thu nhập hàng ngày 50.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ mua sắm đồ phục vụ kinh doanh. 
Thu nhâp bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. G. Thi Nguyen, 51 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. She has two children who are currently going to school. Since joining the Fund, the family has invested in a service which rents out audio equipment, tableware, and other equipment for use ceremonies and celebrations in the local town. The family's business is expanding quickly; for each event, her family collects 400,000 VND to 500,000 VND. Besides the family's main business, she and her husband also take advantage of their extra time to do some extra trading business with a daily income of 50,000 VND. In this round of funding, the family is borrowing 19,000,000 VND to buy more equipment to rent. Their average income is 6,000,000 VND/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more equipment to rent

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma S. sells food in the Kikwajuni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is able to earn a profit of approximately $125 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory for her food shop.

Fatma is 32 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 1 and 14.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalia tiene 40 años, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos quienes son su adoración. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, los cuales cría y vende en los mercados, esta actividad la realiza por más de 10 años. Siendo dentro de todo, la crianza, lo que más le agrada, con esta labor tiene grandes ganancias, todo depende de cómo estén alimentados  y cuidados  los animales, porque para que el precio del animal sea rentable, tiene  tratar de que logren un peso adecuado para su venta. Se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP, durante  el tiempo de permanencia  no tuvo problemas de pago. Rosalia comprará dos cerditos y dos cuyes de raza para aumentar su costo de venta en los mercados.
texts.en:
40-year old Rosalia is married and has four children whom she adores. She raises young animals and then sells them in the markets. She’s been doing this for more than 10 years. Seeing the animals grow is what pleases her the most about her work. She makes good profits from her hard work. Everything depends on how the animals are fed and cared for. She has to ensure that the animals reach a suitable weight so they can be sold. This is Rosalia’s fourth loan with MFP, and there have never been any problems with repayment. With this money she will buy two piglets and two guinea pigs to be used as breeding stock. These purchases will enable her to earn more money in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and guinea pigs

loans.name: Reth

texts.en:
Mr. Reth V. is a villager in Troeng village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He is 45 years old and the father of six children, two of whom are employed in garment factory. The other children attend the local school. 

His wife, Mrs. Hoer Thorn, is a duck breeder. Since her ducks are growing bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to support them. Mr. Reth V. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase duck food for his wife's breeding business. His wife is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase duck food for his wife's breeding business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia G. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a boy and two girls. She says all of her children are in school. She and her family live in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Lydia’s husband works with ATL (Akosombo Textiles Limited), one of the textiles factories in the country.

Lydia is an entrepreneur. She sells plantains. She buys her plantains from farmers in her community and nearby villages. At times Lydia travels all the way to the Western Region where plantains are cultivated on a large scale to procure her goods. She says she treks to Accra to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. She has been in business for over eight years. Lydia says she started this business with her mother while she was still in school. Lydia wants to buy plantains on large scale so that she can supply them to a number of customers. She desires to help her husband see their children through higher education.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun H., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chhunnat Khim, 39, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children are in school and the youngest one still stays home.

Since 1992, Savoeun has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her aunty. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Chhunnat has been a mason for 14 years. Savoeun is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
Икром 35 летний мужчина , бригадир в колхозе. Имеет земельный участок, с которого  имеет доход с посева урожая. Кроме этого он занимается  откормом и продажей скота.
Жена учительница в средней школе.  Икром решил в кредит увеличить оборотный капитал бизнеса животноводства. Для  чего и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Ikrom is a 35 year old man, a team leader in a collective farm. He has a plot of land which brings him profit from the harvest. Besides this he also raises and sells cattle. His wife is a teacher in a secondary school. Ikrom decided to use the loan to increase his working capital of his animal husbandry business. This is why he has come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sales of cattle

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort N. is thirty-five years old. She is married with five children, two males and three females. All of her children are in the junior high and the basic schools. Comfort’s husband is a farmer while she is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. 
 
Comfort prepares and sells Fante kenkey. It is produced from corn dough. She buys bags of maize from farmers in the nearby villages and sells the kenkey in the local market square. She distributes mostly to retailers. Comfort has been in this business for five years. She wants a loan to procure maize in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo vive en la Avenida Versalles de  la zona Bautista Saavedra en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Por circunstancias de la vida, su esposa lo abandonó,  dejándolo a cargo de sus cinco hijos con los cuales vive en  una habitación, la cual es en alquiler.

Trabaja en la elaboración de baúles de madera los cuales los distribuye a comerciantes de las ferias. 

El crédito lo destinará  para compra de madera y así incrementar su producción.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in the Versalles Avenue of the Bautista Saavedra Zone in El Alto city. For circumstances of life he was abandoned by his wife and was left in charge of his five children. They all live in a single rented bedroom. Ricardo manufactures wooden trunks for a living. He distributes these trunks to fair merchants. He will use this loan to purchase wood to increase his production. This is his first IMPRO credit and the evaluation performed by IMPRO qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to manufacture wooden trunks

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
KARINA D. E., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las innovadoras II” vive en el Jr Englinton Mz.A:Lt.13  Yarinacocha, tiene 35 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su pareja es contador.

Recibió un primer préstamo de S/ 300.00, con este dinero inició su negocio de servicio de alquiler de cuartos para viviendal.

Gracias a este negocio ha sabido progresar junto a su familia y el negocio ha mejorado, tanto que ahora necesita hacer una ampliación del local.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la ampliación de su local, comprará materiales y pagará la mano de obra.

“Manuela Ramos me permitió tener mi propia casa y a su vez tener la oportunidad de alquilar algunos cuartos para aumentar mis ingresos, todos los ambientes son de madera que la región produce y son muy frescos y los clientes se sienten cómodos”. Gracias Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Karina D. E. belongs to the “Las Innovadoras II” (“Innovative Women II”) Communal Bank. She lives on Englinton Street in Yarinacocha. She is 35 years old, has 2 children, and her husband works as an accountant. She used her first loan of 300 soles to start her business of renting out rooms to tenants. Thanks to her business she knows how to get ahead in life with her family. Her business has improved, so much so that she now needs to enlarge her premises. Karina will use the current loan of 3,000 soles to invest in enlarging her premises, purchasing materials, and paying for labor. “[Kiva partner] Manuela Ramos made it possible for me to have my own home and gave me the opportunity to increase my income by renting out rooms. All of the rooms are made of wood that comes from the region. The rooms stay cool and the tenants are comfortable.” Thank you, Manuela Ramos!

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for enlarging her commercial premises.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна - женщина 34 лет, учительница в политехническом институте по предмету модельера. Её заработная плата маленькая , не хватает на жизнь.Поэтому она занимается откормом и продажей скота.У неё трое детей, которые учатся в старших классах средней школы.Мавзуна на сегодня имеет шесть коров,которые дают в день по семь литров молока.Мавзуна договорившись с мороженым цехом оптом сдаёт им своё коровье, домашнее молоко.Мавзуна кредитуется уже второй год.Благодаря кредитам у Мавзуны постоянно обменивается скот и она имеет хороший дополнительный доход с продажи скота.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is a 34 year old woman, she is a professor of fashion design in a polytechnic college. Her salary is very small and is not enough for her life. This is why she feeds and sells cattle. She has three children who study in high school. At this time Mavzuna has six cows, which give seven liters of milk a day. Mavzuna has an agreement with an ice cream factory and sells the milk to them in wholesale. Mavzuna has been taking out loans for the second year. Thanks to the loans Mavzuna's cattle is regularly renewed and she has a good additional income from the sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and sales of cattle

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a las tareas de la agricultura, con las que ha sostenido, junto a su esposo, a su familia, durante todos estos años. Lo que principalmente cultiva es la papa y otro producto nativo de su zona, llamado oca. Clarisa y su esposo disfrutan de estas actividades, aunque son jornadas agotadoras bajo un sol intenso, pero han sido bien recompensados con las ganancias obtenidas. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias de su banco comunal que siempre promueve la unión del grupo, aun en tiempos de conflictos y circunstancias difíciles. El dinero que viene solicitando Clarisa es para la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima  campaña de siembra, para que obtenga una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 50 years old and lives with her husband at their own home. She has worked in the agricultural field for over 20 years. It has been the source of their income and the way how along side with her husband has supported their family all these years. Their main crop is potatoes and other product of the region, called oca. Clare and her husband enjoy these activities, although the exhausting days under intense sun. They have been well rewarded with the profits. This is the sixth time she has a loan with MFP.

She is one of the members of the community bank that always promotes the union of the group, even in times of conflict and difficult circumstances. The loan she requested is to buy sacks of fertilizer for next year, in order to obtain a good harvest

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  fertilizer

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Doña Alicia V. de 46 años de edad, originario del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, Tiene 9 hijos, desde muy corta edad ella se caracteriza como líder, e innovadora, se dedica a elaborar prendas de vestir del área, es una señora muy emprendedora, estuvo en proyecto, de invernadero con muchas socias, como enseñanza, logra tener mucha experiencia, inicia con su propio invernadero, haciendo prestamos pequeños, pero con sus gastos con sus hijos no le alcanza para invertir, para poder, obtener mas ganancia, ahora necesita comprar fertilizantes, fungicida, y otros, para mantener su invernadero de tomate, su sueño para sus hijos es lograr una cartera ya que ahora sus dos hijos mayores le ayudan y se graduaron de mecánica automotriz, su sueños es tener otro invernadero mas grande y apoyar siempre a sus hijos con mejor alimentación, construir unas habitaciones ya que solo tienen 3 para tantas personas.
texts.en:
Alicia V. is 46 and a native of the Tecpan municipality in Guatemala. She has nine children. Since a very young age she has been characterized as a leader and an innovator. She makes clothing that is typical in her area. She is a very enterprising woman. She was in a greenhouse project with many other members. It was a learning project, and she gained much experience. She set up her own greenhouse by making small loans. But, with the children’s expenses she does not have enough working capital. To earn more she needs to buy fertilizer, fungicide, and other things to keep her greenhouse of tomatoes. Her dream for her children is that they have careers. Her two older children help her now. They graduated as automobile mechanics. Her dreams are to have another, bigger greenhouse, to always support her children with the best food, and to build some bedrooms since they now only have three for so many people.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a native of Tambo Real, a rural community located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is forty-eight years old and married with two children.  

Lorenza makes cheeses with a laboratory system that she has at her home. During the high tourist season in the Sacred Valley, she travels to Aguas Calientes to sell her cheese to local restaurants that cater to people visiting Machu Picchu. She makes pizza cheese (which costs approx. $4 per unit), and also cheese that is used to make sandwiches.  During a typical week she sells between 70-80 units. With this loan Lorenza is planning to buy milk from outside sources so that she can produce more cheese during the high season.  

Lorenza is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of fourteen members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa.  They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members should anyone default.

loans.use: To purchase milk to make cheese

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: La señora Claudia Maria L. A. tiene 37 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en comarcas. Es madre de 2 hijos una niña de 16 años y un niño de 7 años de edad.  Su esposo trabaja en una finca ubicada en las afueras de la ciudad. Doña Claudia tiene 10 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a la gente del campo ya que ellos son sus principales clientes debido a que por falta de tiempo ellos no pueden venir a la ciudad a realizar sus compras. Claudia ha trabajado muy duro para mantener este negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas y ropa interior. Su mayor sueño es sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria is 37 years old and works as a regional street vendor selling clothing. She is the mother of a 16-year-old daughter and a 7-year-old son. Her husband works on a farm located on the outskirts of the city. Claudia has been selling clothing for 10 years to rural customers, who have become her primary clients due to the fact that because they don’t have time they are unable to come to the city to do their shopping. Claudia has worked very hard to maintain this business since it is her only source of income. She requests a loan for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, and underwear. Her greatest dream is for her children to successfully complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is the 45-year-old mother of five children who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her husband in taking care of the kids in school.

Beatrice trades in sewing accessories and has been doing this for the past five years. She sells items like lining material, sewing thread, school uniforms, lace and cloth. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing items like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. in bulk to hedge against price increases. She hopes to increase her savings to support the kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more sewing items like linen, thread and thimbles

loans.name: América Esperanza Ascensión

texts.es: América Esperanza Ascensión C. D. S.  D. 45 años D. edad resiD. en el municipio D. Cojutepeque en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. América  no tuvo la oportunidad D. prepararse académicamente curso hasta básica en la escuela, razón por la cual sus oportunidades profesionales se acortaron, pero desD. hace veintidós años ella ha logrado mantener su negocio el cual es, el único medio D. ingresos para su subsistencia. América posee una venta D. verduras y diferentes granos básicos; el destino del crédito que solicita América será utiliza para surtir su local con productos como cereales, frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
América Esperanza Ascensión C. D. S. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Cojutepeque in the department of Cucatlán. América did not have the opportunity to educate herself beyond primary school and for that reason her professional opportunities were limited. For the last twenty-two years, she has successfully run her own business, her sole means of support. América sells vegetables and basic staples. She will use the loan to purchase products like grains, fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una persona encantadora y muy dinámica de 31 años de edad, madre de dos menores, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza , ropa y accesorios, ella ofrece sus productos  en el mercado informal de Bellavista, cuenta con el apoyo de se esposo  que trabaja en una empresa de gas. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Siete Estrellas” desde hace dos años.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles lo invirtió en la compra de néctar y gaseosas, negocio que tenía antes. Actualemnte se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, ropa y accesorios por catálogo, para lo cual requiere un préstamo de 1800 soles.
texts.en:
Luz is a charming and dynamic person. She is 31 years old, mother of two young children, and works in the sales of beauty products, clothing and accessories. She offers her products in the informal market at Bellavista. She has the support of her husband who works at a gas company. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Siete Estrellas” for two years.

The first loan that she obtained was for 300 Soles ($100 USD) that she invested in the purchase of juices and sodas for her former business. Now she works in the sales of beauty products, clothes, and accessories by catalog, for which she needs a loan of 1,800 Soles.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products, lotions, creams, etc...

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 48 years old and married to Rex Dexter, a farmer. They have three children: John Rex Lester, 21 years old and a nursing graduate;  Mark, 15 years old and a fourth year high school student; and Pinky, 13 years old, and a 3rd year high school student. They are living in Salay, Angadanan, Isabela.

She has managed a typical retail store in their village for almost ten years and her weekly income is PHP300.00.  She plans to borrow a loan amount of PHP 11,000.00 from KIVA lenders for additional capital. One of their sources of income is hog-raising. She works hard for the education of their children and to support her husband financially. She said that "God provides all what we ask for, just have faith on Him, Nothing is impossible."

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail store

loans.name: Salaman

texts.en: Salaman is the son of G. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives in a family of five members. He wants to get married. Salaman needs money for wedding expenses. Since he spent more money, he requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani. He would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money.

loans.use: For wedding expenses

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 45 años, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos con los que vive en su casa.

Desde muy joven se dedica al tejido; tanto a palitos, como con aguja de crochet. Anteriormente, una vez que tenía varias prendas elaboradas las vendía a los mayoristas, pero ellos no le pagaban el precio real. Por esa razón buscaba tener un puesto en un centro comercial de artesanías muy conocido en la ciudad, pero no lo pudo conseguir.
Sin embargo, su perseverancia la llevó a encontrar una tienda frente al parque principal de su pueblo; desde entonces, hace 2 años, vende todos sus tejidos en su tienda, lo cual le resulta muy rentable, ya que puede cubrir el alquiler del local y otros gastos de su hogar. 
Adicionalmente, Hilda tiene unas tierras donde siembra avena (foto), la cual guarda para venderla posteriormente en tiempos de sequía. De ese modo Hilda alterna sus actividades, buscando el bienestar de su familia.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, donde todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de materiales para elaborar sus tejidos, así como en semillas de avena.
texts.en:
Hilda is a very hardworking woman. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children who live with her at home.

Since she was a young woman, Hilda has been making hand-woven fabrics. Previously she tried selling her handmade clothing to wholesale vendors, but they refused to pay her a good price. For this reason, she tried to secure a vending post at a well-known craft market in the city but was unable. However, her perseverance led her to find a shop across from the main city park. Hilda has been selling her products from that location for the past two years. Her business has proven to be very profitable, since she is able to cover her shop rent and her household expenses.

In addition, Hilda has farmland in which she grows oats (as seen in the photograph). She stores whatever she harvests so that she can sell in times of drought. Hilda successfully divides her time between both businesses in order to provide for her family’s welfare.

This is Hilda’s ninth loan with MFP. As a client, she has always made her payments on time. The money she is requesting will be used to buy materials for making her hand-woven products. She will also purchase seeds for her next crop of oats.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for weaving & seeds for her oat crop

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy, 32 years old, is a diligent farmer. He is married and has two children. His oldest child is only four years old. He plants rice on his farm and gives his best in doing so. He wants to save for his children’s future. He joined CEVI in 2008 to help with his lack of capital. Now he is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 to be used for seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs he needs. This loan will truly be a big help in Jimmy’s farming.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mr. Yan Y. and his wife, Mrs. Mot Prum, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1979 and have three children: two sons who are married and live outside the family home, and one daughter who is attending school. 

Yan and his wife have been growing rice since they were married. In addition to farming he rents out his rice threshing machine to his neighbors. 
Yan is requesting his second loan of $150 US to purchase fuel oil for his rice threshing machine.

loans.use: To buy fuel oil for rice thresher

loans.name: Benjamin
