texts.es: Benjamín tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa y sus  hijos en su casa propia.Desde muy niño ha estado ligado a las actividades tanto agrícolas como ganaderas, y cuando empezó  su vida independiente al lado de su esposa vio que lo mas  rentable para su economía era  la actividad ganadera , desde entonces cría vacas y toros que le sirven para la venta de leche,además vende algunos de estos animales después de tres meses de engordarlos;  también tiene una granja  apícola  de donde extrae miel de abeja cada tres meses para venderla a buen precio en el mercado  de la urbe cercano a su localidad . Su más grande anhelo es mejorar la raza  de su ganado vacuno.Es la décima vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP,  y es uno de los mejores miembros  de su banco comunal y lo demuestra siendo parte de la junta directiva de su  grupo.El dinero del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y abono para la siembra de alfalfa que comercializa y además  es  el alimento indispensable de sus animales.
texts.en:
Benjamin is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in their own home. Since he was a boy, he has been involved in agricultural activities such as raising livestock. When he became independent, he and his wife found cattle ranching to be financially profitable. Benjamin raises cows and bulls for dairy production. He also sells some of these animals after three months of fattening. In addition, he raises bees and collects honey every three months. Benjamin sells the honey at a nearby market and is able to command a good price. His greatest desire is to improve the breed of his cattle.

This is the tenth loan he has taken with MFP. He is one of the best members of his Communal Bank as demonstrated by his role as part of the group leadership. The money from his loan will be used to buy seeds and compost for planting alfalfa, which he sells and also uses as an essential food for his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase alfalfa seeds & compost

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo Group

texts.en:
Jose is the coordinator of his group Mi Fortaleza en Cristo (My Fortress in Christ), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago - DRs second largest city, and famous for its beef and tobacco production - where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and daughter.

Jose is excited to be taking out his first loan with Esperanza and views this as a great opportunity to grow his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his barber shop by purchasing a refrigerator so that he can sell cold drinks to his clients as they wait to be served, as they have their haircut or if they are just hanging around the barber shop. He plans to use the profits to invest in his business, purchase his own home and eventually save enough to send his daughter to school to be a nurse. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his barber shop

loans.name: Marlina's Group

texts.en: Marlina L. is from the village of Victoria, Alicia, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Marlina is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Marlina is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Marlina makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling frozen products, fish and tamarind fruits. Marlina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Marlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Marlina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es:
Yudy es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Yudy es conviviente y tiene 22 años, estudio prótesis dental, Yudy tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende zapatos variados, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Yudy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos.
Los sueños de Yudy son tener su consultorio de prótesis y  una tienda de zapatos.
texts.en:
Yudy is a member of the Tarpuy communal bank; Tarpuy means "To Plant or To Sow" in quechua. Yudy lives with her life partner and is 22 years old. She studied dental prosthetics. Yudy has a stand in the 12 de abril market where she sells assorted shoes every day. Yudy needs a 1200 sol loan to buy shoes. Yudy's dream is to have a dental prosthetics consulting office and a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 60 years old and married with six grown children, who are between the ages of 18 and 30. He is a dairy farmer near Litein in Western Kenya. He's been farming for 20 years and is able to employ two people. He sells his milk through the Kenya Cooperative Creameries and also earns income from small-scale farming of tea and coffee. He says that the main challenges to his business are lack of funds to expand his business and a lack of education on how to keep quality animals and prevent the diseases that affect them.

He requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the added dairy cow will mean more income for his family. He gives his thanks to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan and for teaching him more about dairy farming. In the future, he would like to produce up to sixty liters of milk a day and purchase more farm land on which to keep an extra dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Servando

texts.es: El señor Servando es casado con la señora Sara y son una familia muy estable y joven, ellos son propietarios de un negocio que establecieron hace 5 años de nombre “Los 4 Vientos” donde venden tacos, hamburguesas, lonches etc. Negocio que es preferido por sus clientes. Ellos anteriormente tuvieron un crédito con nosotros para la inversión en su negocio y sus pagos siempre se registraron puntualmente ahora nuevamente están tramitando para la inversión en compra de mas mercancía y mesas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Servando is married to Sara; they are a young, stable family. They have owned a fast-food sales business, called "Los 4 Vientos," where they sell tacos, hamburgers, lunches, etc. for the last 5 years. Their business is highly preferred by their customers. They had a previous loan with us that they used to invest in their business; they always repaid on time. Now, they are agin negotiating funds to invest in the purchase of more merchandise and tables for their business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and tables.

loans.name: Cleofel

texts.en:
Cleofel S. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 35 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, she has a business providing rice milling services to local community members. She has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 to 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cleofel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used for maintenance of the rice mill. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cleofel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: maintenance of the rice mill.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab, who is married to a policeman, has two daughters, 20 and 9 years old. With the ksh. 35,000 loan, Zainab wants to purchase a water tank and pay for the labor to set up the taps and pipes. She will then sell water for ksh. 3 per 20 liters. She also owns a retail shop where she sells juice, ice, ground nuts and water. In addition, Zainab rents out two shops and two kiosks to neighbors who sell vegetables and cereals. Zainab cites food, water and electricity as her greatest expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Ledie Claire

texts.en: Ledie Claire S. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Ledie Claire is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ledie Claire owns and operates an "Alacart" business, selling grilled pork products, barbecue and grilled hot dog in the local community. Ledie Claire has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ledie Claire joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ledie Claire has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was her working capital. Ledie Claire is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw meat and other ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ledie Claire from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw meat and other ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Parigull Amam Jan Group

texts.en: Amam J. is the group leader of Parigull Amam J. group. He is 45 years old and lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has four children. Amam J. owns a car parts shop. He needs some tools for his shop. He wants to make the shop larger and buy the required supplies. He would like to make his business much bigger. He is confident that, with his loan, he can increase his business.

loans.use: To purchase some tools for his shop

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Pablo tiene 40 años. el se dedicaba a la ganadería, negocio que fue heredado por mis padres pero cuando me case tuve la necesidad de un negocio que generara un ingreso mensual. ya que tenía una casa y una familia que me exigía gastos mensuales, pero como él tiene mucho tiempo de vivir aquí se dio cuenta que no existía ninguna panadería y con el dinero de la venta de algunos animales pudo iniciar operaciones en su negocio de panadería desde hace 10 años.  Negocio que responde a las necesidades de mi familia. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, queso, harina, huevo entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 40 years old. He used to raise livestock, a business that he inherited from his parents, but when he married, he needed to be able to generate a monthly income; having a home and a family generates monthly expenses. Since he had lived in the same neighborhood for a long time, he realized that there were no bakeries in the area, so with money he got from the sale of some of his animals, be started his bakery ten years ago. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies and ingredients, such as butter, cheese, flour, and eggs, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon S. is from the village of Kinangay Sur Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married and has a baby. To make a living, Solomon owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Solomon has been in business for more than two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Solomon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Solomon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Solomon is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Solomon from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Enh=Amgalan

texts.en:
Enh-Amgalan D. lives in Zavhan province in western Mongolia with his wife and two children. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His youngest child currently attends a local primary school while the elder son stays at home taking care of the family members. Enh-Amgalan operates a small sewing business in his town with the help of his younger sister. He repairs and produces a variety of clothing items and ger curtain covers for his customers at a small workspace. Enh-Amgalan started his sewing business in 2007 by himself, but is now partnered with his sister in the business.

His business is very important for him and his family as it is their only source of income. He has worked hard and found some success, but struggles to support both of his children and sick wife who has suffered from brucellosis. With his business earnings, he was able to build a new small house which is 30% in the process of construction while changing his own ger cover and curtain in full. For the future, Enh-Amgalan hopes to progress his business to provide local citizens with necessary ger materials and make permanent supplement at lowest prices. He says "I hope to one day own my own workspace and hire some people in order to expand my business." He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials for his sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for sewing business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos vive en el barrio la cuchilla zona 5to anillo la ciudad de Santa Cruz, cuenta con un anticretico que consta de 2 cuartos, en la cual vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposa la misma es ama de casa. El se dedica al servicio de transporte interprovincial, que su ruta comprende, de la parada de la zona del mercado los pozos a tres cruzes y otras comunidades de la zona, cuenta con un vehiculo propio el cual fue adquirido con su esfuerzo propio, ademas de esto tambien tiene conocimiento de mecanica automotriz, el fin del prestamo solicitado sera invertido para hacerle un buen mantenimiento a su vehiculo en la compra de llantas y hacer un buen chaperio, por los muchos viajes a las provincias el vehiculo presenta muchas fallas y esto no le permite brindar un buen servicio, es muy trabajador y siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the La Cuchilla neighborhood in Santa Cruz’s 5th Ring. He lives in a two-bedroom house under the anticrético modality (Anticrético is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you). He lives with his wife and five children; his wife is a housewife. He provides interprovincial transportation services. His route is from the stop at the Pozos Market to Tres Cruces and other communities in the area. He owns his own vehicle which he acquired through his own efforts. In addition to this, he is versed in auto mechanics. The loan will be used to provide his vehicle with service and repair. He will buy tires and do some body work. Because of all the trips to the provinces, the vehicle is starting to show some wear and have some mechanical problems that prevent him from providing the very best service. He is very hard working and is always thinking about his family’s wellbeing. He is very grateful for the opportunity he is being given.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and sheet metal.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian nació el departamento de Apuricma, es soltera y hace 15 años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco. 
 
Vivian utilizo sus ahorros para abrir una librería donde vende útiles escolares. La pueden encontrar en su tienda, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde de la noche.  Vivian desprende una imagen de experiencia y amabilidad. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su librería “MASTERCOM” que está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq cerca al centro Histórico del Cusco. Ella vende cuadernos, lapiceros, mochilas, etc.  
     
Con su próximo préstamo, Juana espera recibir $600 USD. Por el momento, su tienda esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar papelería, suministros de computadoras, suministros de impresoras como por ejemplo  tintas y tóner 

Vivian pertenece al banco comunal  “El Amanecer”. Ya son varios ciclos que participa en el banco comunal y le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.  El sueño de la socia es abrir otra tienda y en el centro histórico del Cusco.
texts.en:
Vivian was born in the department of Apuricma. She is single and has lived in the city of Cusco for fifteen years. With savings, Vivian opened a book store where she sells school supplies. You can find her in her store seven days a week, from very early until quite late at night. Vivian projects an image of experience and friendliness. A steady stream of regular customers visits her book store "Mastercom," which is located in the Wauchaq district, near the historic center of Cusco. She sells notebooks, pens, satchels, etc. With her next loan, Vivian hopes to receive $600. At the moment, her store is modestly supplied with basic necessities. She would like to use the loan proceeds to buy stationery, computer supplies, and printing supplies such as inks and toner. Vivian belongs to the communal bank "El Amanecer" (The Dawn). She has had previous loans and has reaffirmed her confidence in her ability to make her payments. The dream of this member is to open another store in the historic center of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stationery, computer supplies, and printing supplies such as ink and toner.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny N., who lives in Si Sla village in the Takeo province, is 54 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is also a pig breeder, while her husband, Mr. Thorng Khiev, is a rice-wine maker and also owns a mill in the local village. 

Her problem is that in her field, it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough rice seed to support it. So to improve her production, Mrs. Vanny N. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed and with rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. 

She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the other is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia, de 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Para tener su propia heladería, no fue tan fácil como ella lo esperaba, le fue difícil, ya que el primer mes de funcionamiento solo tuvo contados clientes que se acercaban a su heladería, y lo que percibía solo le alcanzaba para su canasta familiar. Dionisia hizo hincapié en mejorar en la elaboración de sus helados, en donde introdujo nuevos sabores con la finalidad de que sus clientes estén más que satisfechos, desde luego que lo consiguió, con el transcurrir de los años perfeccionó su producto. Hoy tiene un posicionamiento considerable en su localidad y reconoce que la clave de su éxito radicó en la innovación de sus sabores, además utilizó frutas netamente de su valle, es por ello que siente contenta con su negocio, sin embargo reconoce que el mundo cambia y requiere de creatividad continua, es por ello que trata de sacar nuevos productos lo mas que pueda. Dionisia anhela  ampliar su heladería, de esa manera pueda introducir maquinas para la elaboración de helados, con la finalidad de que pueda producir en cantidad. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo e hijos y juntos hacen un buen equipo, además tiene el apoyo de sus hijos y su punto de venta lo realiza en su propia localidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además está satisfecha por el buen trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo servirá para que compre frutas de toda variedad, como también insumos para su respectiva elaboración de helados típicos de su zona.
texts.en:
Dionisia, 52, is married and has two children under her care. They live in Santa Rosa located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry in their own home. Having her own ice cream shop wasn’t as easy as she thought it would be at first. It was very difficult and during her first month of operations she had just a few customers show up; she barely made enough to afford the most basic food items for her home. Dionisia concentrated on improving her ice cream introducing new flavors so that her customers would be more satisfied. As expected, this did the trick and she has continued to improve her product over the years. Today she is well positioned in the marketplace in her location and she considers that the key to her success lay in her innovative flavors using fruit strictly indigenous to her valley. For this reason she is very happy with her business. However, she is aware that the world changes and requires continuous creativity so she tries to bring out new products as much as possible. Dionisia wants to expand her ice cream shop and install new ice cream making machines in order to produce larger quantities. She usually works together with her husband and children and they make a good team. Besides, her children help out. Her sales point is in her own location. This is her 5th loan with MFP which she pledges to repay on time. She is satisfied with the good treatment she receives in her communal bank. The requested funds will be used to buy a large variety of fruit as well as other ingredients to make ice cream typical of her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and ingredients to make ice cream.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “HORMIGUITAS” está iniciando su segundo ciclo. Está conformada por 8 personas, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva esta constituida por la señora Lucy como presidenta, la señora Cinthia como tesorera y la señora Ruth como secretaria.

Para una mejor organización, la asociación conforma subgrupos para el proceso de pago, son llamados grupos solidarios y están dirigidos por la jefe de grupo. La señora Victoria es jefe de un grupo, constituye el primer control dentro del grupo y la persona que agiliza el proceso de repago en la reunión. Ella ya tiene experiencia de trabajo en Pro Mujer.  El negocio que desarrolla es la costura de ropa para bebé.  Antes trabajaba con micro talleres de América Textil, desde hace tres años trabaja independientemente.

Su crédito ha sido solicitado para comprar insumos: como por ejemplo hilo, tela.  Produce las pequeñas prendas en su domicilio y luego entrega su producción a sus clientes para la venta por menor.  De parte de la familia tiene el apoyo de una de sus hijas.
Con respecto a Pro Mujer, ella considera que el Consultorio de Salud es una ayuda y por eso es lo que más le gusta.

Las otras integrantes de la asociación también tienen sus propios negocios: venta de jugos y costura, venta de salchipapa, costura de ropa de bebe, peluches, conducción de transporte, artesanía de camas y venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “HORMIGUITAS” (Little Ants) communal bank is starting its second cycle. It has 8 members, seven women and one man. The governing board consists of Lucy, President, Cinthia, Treasurer and Ruth, Secretary. To improve organization the bank formed subgroups to process payment. They are called Solidarity Groups and are led by a Group Leader. Victoria is leader of a group. She is the first level of control within the group and the person who expedites the repayment process during the meeting. She has prior work experience in Pro Mujer. The business she’s in is manufacturing infant wear. She used to work in América Textil micro workshops but has worked independently for the last three years. She has requested funds to buy supplies like fabric and thread. She makes the tiny items of clothing in her home and delivers the finished products to her customers for subsequent retail sales. One of her daughters helps her. With respect to Pro Mujer she considers the Health Center to be a great help and that is what she likes best about it. The other group members have their own businesses: games sales, seamstress services, sale of salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausages), infant ware manufacturing, stuffed toy making, public transportation services and artisanal beds and cosmetics sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Aisalkyn's Group

texts.en:
Aisalkyn K. is the leader of the group. She is 61 years old and married.  She has raised two daughters and a son.  All the children are married. Aisalkyn and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. They started to breed cattle in 1992. Aisalkyn also sells about 15 liters of milk every day. In this way she makes approximately $65 per month.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase two calves in order to increase the number of cattle. 

Zainagul I. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 49 and married. She has a daughter and three sons. Zainagul is a schoolteacher and her husband is a farmer. He is also engaged in cattle breeding. With money received from the loan, Zainagul wants to purchase two calves for breeding. In the future she wants to see her youngest son get married and to start building a new house in Karakol.

Apal N., 55, is married. She has a daughter and three sons. Apal is engaged in cattle breeding and her husband works as a teacher. With money received from the loan, Apal wants to purchase two calves in order to increase the number of cattle.

Dohdurkan J., 48, is married. She has five children. Dohdurhan and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase three bull-calves for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en: Tabita T. is currently in the business of selling onions, bananas, and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Tabita is 23 years old and is married to a farmer. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Kimenyedde Women's Group-Kayunga

texts.en: For the last 13 years, 39-year-old N. John has  been running a farm supplies business in Mayangayanga-Kayunga.  He says to begin this business he got ideas and knowledge from an apprentice colleague and mobilized start-up capital.  John also operates a veterinary shop. John is married with six kids and in a week, his profits amount to shillings 100,000. With this loan he says he is going to purchase more manure, hoes, pangas (machetes), etc. to supply to farmers in his locality. John belongs to Kimenyedde Women’s group-Kayunga.

loans.use: The purchase of more manure, hoes and pangas (machetes)

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina N. is married and lives with her husband, 2 student children, and her in-laws. A teacher in the past, since 2002 Marina has been trading women’s clothing and underwear from a rented shop in one of the city’s markets. 

In the past, Marina used to travel to the neighbouring countries to purchase inventory. Now, Marina puts her orders through other traders so she can spend more time managing the shop.  Currently Marina requires new stock for the shop. With a good credit history behind her, to help her finance the inventory order, Marina has applied to SEF International for a loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothes inventory

loans.name: Carlina's Group

texts.en:
Carlina G. is from the village of Manaoag, Cauayan City, Isabela.  Carlina, who is 60 years old, is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Carlina is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carlina sells animal feed to local farmers. Carlina has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Carlina is requesting a new loan, her fifth from ASKI, for 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Greetings from Rwanda!  Athanase is 40 years old and is married, with two children who are 4 and 8 years old.  He owns a small general store and employs one person.

Athanase has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to help expand his business by purchasing a large quantity of sugar and rice, as they are in high demand. He has lots of plans for any profits that he makes from the business.  These include renovating his house, paying school fees for his two children, as well as building a secure future for his children.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity  of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en: Mubariz A. is a 59 year-old man, married, with four children. He is an internal refugee from Nagorno-Karabakh who fled to the Sabirabad district of Azerbaijan in 1993. Mubariz is the head of his large family and the hardship of being refugees made it difficult for him support them. That is why in 2004 he started his animal breeding and selling business with the little savings he had. He gradually expanded his business, which is the only source of income for his family. His sons, who are 24 and 28, actively help him in business. Now he has seven cows and a monthly income of 300 AZN. This is his second loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. After successfully repaying his previous loan he requested another loan of 1300 AZN to buy three cows. In the future Mubariz wants to expand his business and have a farm.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie D. C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years old. Virgie is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Virgie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling eggs, bananas and vegetables like squash in the local community. Virgie has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Virgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Virgie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products, like bananas, to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Virgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 33 años, vive con su hija en casa de sus familiares. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de jugos y frutas en un local de ventas que ha arrendado en una avenida central de su barrio, desde entonces atiende todos los días y con ayuda de su pequeña hija a sus clientes, generalmente por las mañanas y las tardes. La ventaja de su negocio es que se ubica cerca de un paradero de transportes que le permite tener una clientela fija que siempre consume y esto le genera rentas que favorecen a su economía. Sus planes es obtener nuevas herramientas para mejorar su negocio. Es el primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en frutas y también en gaseosas.
texts.en:
Victoria is 33 years old and lives with her daughter in the house of other family members. She has been selling juice and fruit in a small rented store for three years now. The store is located on one of the main streets in her neighborhood. She works there every day of the week and her young daughter typically helps out with customers in the mornings and afternoons. Her store has the advantage of being located close to a bus stop, which provides her with a steady stream of customers. Their frequent purchases allow her to earn income and build up her savings. She plans to buy new tools in order to make some improvements to her store.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is thankful for this financial support. Moreover, she is glad to be part of her community bank because all of the bank members are responsible, supportive individuals. She would like to thank those bank members who will manage the loan she is requesting because the loan will be very helpful for the development of her business. She plans to use this loan to buy merchandise such as fruit and carbonated beverages.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and carbonated beverages

loans.name: Maxwell

texts.en: Maxwell would like a loan to buy more crates of beer for resale. He has a wholesale shop and his dream is to have outlets in different towns. He started as an agriculturalist five years back and later set up a beer depot. He lives in Kyenjojo and his family dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: Buying crates of beers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
ESTE CLIENTE ES DE MANAGUA, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
EL ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: DOS BERJAS PARA LAS VENTANAS DE   SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA MEJORAR SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLES MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This client is from Managua. He is the father of a family with two school-age children who depend on him.

He went to CEPRODEL's office to request a loan for completing home improvements. He will use the loan for the purchase of construction materials, such as bars for two windows in his house. This would improve his home and offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa Aurora M. M. tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener ingresos estables.

Le gusta salir a las fiestas.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurora M. M. is 33 years old. She is married, she has 3 children, and she lives with her husband and their single children in Guaranda, a canton of the Bolívar province.

She is a member of the V.R.C. Grupo Enmanuel, a village bank located in San Juan, a precinct of the Guaranda canton. This bank has 17 members who work as farmers engaging in cultivating short cycle varieties of maize, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as in breeding of animals such as pigs and hens.

Rosa engages in agriculture, growing maize and breeding pigs and hens. She buys the products to feed his animals in the Comercial Silva every week-end, and he sells his animals every Thursday in the Guarada fair.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies. The loan will economically help her fulfilling her needs, facing challenges such as pests, plant illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of having a fixed income.

She likes going to parties.

loans.use: To sow maize, wheat and potatoes, to purchase animals, and to buy feeding and cropping supplies.

loans.name: Elvis Noel

texts.es: El señor Elvis Noel tiene 25 años, vive en la comunidad de Santa Rosa y se dedica a comprar ganado y cerdos. Todos los días se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para poder llevar a las vacas a las huertas en donde comen pasto y agua.  Este negocio lo inicio con esfuerzo propio, ya que su familia se dedicaba a este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido satisfactorio para él pues así puede proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Este crédito es para la compra de vacas, toros, terneros. Su meta es crecer con su negocio y tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y para su familia.
texts.en: Elvis Noel is 25 years old and lives in the community of Santa Rosa. He works in the livestock business, buying and selling cattle and pigs. Everyday, Elvis gets up at 4:00 a.m. to lead his cows to pasture for grazing. He started this business on his own, coming from a family that also works in livestock. He is happy with the work, as it allows him to provide his family with the income it needs. This loan will be used to buy cows, bulls, and calves. Elvis' goal is to expand his business and to create a better quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: To buy cows, bulls, and calves.

loans.name: Bashraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashraan is a widow who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She is a mother of two sons. Her elder son is married and operates a breakfast stall where he serves his customers "Nan chanay" (made with chick peas and served with bread) while her younger son sells "Daal chawal" (a dish made with lentils and served with rice and pickle)  which is a traditional Punjabi dish. 

Bashraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son who wants to improve his breakfast stall business. Thanks to the loan, he will purchase required ingredients such as spices, cooking oil, chick peas, etc. so that he can serve many more customers and enhance his monthly profits. He has been operating this business for the past 5 years and Bashraan is confident that he will successfully be able to improve his business after the loan investment. 

She belongs to Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bashraan.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients such as spices, cooking oil and chick peas, etc. for breakfast stall

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with three school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

He has operated a utensils sales business for the past three years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Mohamed faces a major challenge of transportation of his products as some are fragile. He dreams of incorporating other products like clothes and handbags in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase dozens of glasses, plates and basins. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of glasses, plates and basins.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Someone said that a person's success is not only measured by what he or she does in this lifetime, but by what that person imparts to the next generation. This is the reason that Yolanda G., 54, does well to improve her farm business--not just for herself but for her children as well. Yolanda's husband died a few years ago and, at present, she strives to raise their two children who are both in school. They currently reside in Silang, Cavite, south of the country capital, Manila.

Yolanda takes care of her own farm where she grows pineapples and bananas. When ripe, she sells these fruits to the community market and earns quite a lot. Also, she grows peanuts and sells them to business connections. This kind of business works as a lot of Filipinos love to eat steamed peanuts, fried peanuts and even peanuts turned into peanut butter. She also has a sari-sari (variety) store to cover whatever family needs remain. Yolanda earns around Php10,000 net income monthly.

To help her improve her peanut business, she decided to borrow Php30,000. She will use this loan in line with applying the entrepreneurial training she receives in CCT*. She will purchase necessary materials and acquire human resources to boost her peanut dealership. She says that the loan will largely support her business capital and enable her to make it grow.

At present, her difficulty is a low volume of product deliveries resulting is a low rate of sales. Nevertheless, Yolanda never gives up hope of making this business grow and continually strategizes for growth, because she knows this business will not only sustain her and her family now, but will be beneficial for her children in the future. She wants her eldest son to have a successful marriage someday. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to boost her peanut dealership

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Norma, la socia  tiene 27 años de edad y La socia es conviviente; La socia  tiene 1 hijo, de 3 años de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista la socia tiene en el mercado un stand en él la socia vende granos secos maíz de diferentes tipos, cereales, papa deshidratada, habas. Estas muchas veces sirven para semillas y los clientes compran para sembrar. La socia desea invertir el préstamo que le otorgaran en la compra de productos secos al por mayor para poder abastecerse. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Norma, 27, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District which is in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and a 3-year-old son.  She alternates her household activities with retail sales.  She has a stand in the market where she sells dry grains of different types: cereals, dehydrated potato, broad beans.  Often these are used as seeds and customers buy them to plant.  She wants to invest the loan she’s granted to buy dry products at wholesale to stock up.  She is asking for the loan to buy dry goods.

She values and is infinitely thankful for the loans she’ll be granted so that she can improve her quality of life.  She also commits to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy dry goods.

loans.name: Emalinda

texts.en: Emalinda  is 46 years old, single, and has one child.  They live in the Philippines. Emalinda  has a beauty shop that provides hair dying, pedicures, and manicures. She has had this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy materials needed for pedicures, manicures, and hair dying. Emalinda  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Emalinda  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for pedicures, manicures, and hair dying

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak is a 29-year-old, married woman who works as a salaried masseuse for a hotel in Siem Reap Province. She has another financial earner in her husband who has been planting crops on his fertile farm. This couple has three school-aged children. 

In order to address increasing expenses, Mrs. Prak’s husband wants to run a motor taxi service for additional income. Mrs. Prak hopes to encourage her husband with this, but she has no cash to make that possible. So she would like to request a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to begin a taxi service business.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to begin a taxi service business

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 31 years old and married to Boswell. They have two school-going children.

Lillian has a retail shop that she has been running for the past eight years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd and intends to use the money to buy more sugar, tea leaves, baking flour, soft drinks to build up her inventory. 

The anticipated profits will be used to cater to the family's needs, and also invest back into the business.

She hopes to be able to open her own wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, tea leaves, baking flour, soft drinks to add to her stock

loans.name: Batara

texts.en:
Batara is from the village Misaktsieli, East Georgia. He is 54 years old and lives with his wife Tina and three adult children.  He has two daughters who are 28 and 22 years old, and a son who is 27 years old. 

Batara and his wife earn a living with agricultural activities. In particular, they have five milk cows and eight calves. They sell dairy products at the local market. Also, the family owns a greenhouse with a total area of 600 sq. meters, where various vegetables are grown. Batara’s son works as a mechanical engineer in the village.  The total average monthly income of the family is 1600 Laris. 

With the requested loan Batara plans to construct a new cattle shed. He plans to increase the amount of cows in the farm, but doesn’t have enough space in the existing cattle shed building. He will purchase new cows as soon as the construction of the building is over. The income of the family will grow, which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a cattle shed

loans.name: Agbeko

texts.fr:
Agbeko est un homme âgé de 50 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse Il a 02 enfants.
Agbeko travaille comme revendeur de lames et friperie depuis 2008. Il vend à toutes personnes de façon ambulante. Il achète les produits au GHANA. 
Agbeko a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des lames et des friperies
texts.en: Agbeko is 50 years old. He is married to a merchant and is the father of two children. He has been selling blades and second-hand clothes since 2008. He hawks through the streets and sells to passers-by. He buys his supplies in Ghana. Agbeko came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for his second loan to buy blades and second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy blades and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Bunla

texts.en:
Bunla is 45 years old and is a fisherwoman. Her husband is a construction worker and their combined income is 7 USD per day. She has four children; three are studying and one is a company security guard who earns 4 USD daily. Every month, Bunla spends 25 USD on food, 6 USD on electricity, 10 USD on rent, 10 USD on school fees, and 20 USD on other expenses. 

Bunla is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy fishing equipment. In the future, she hopes that her children at least finish secondary school.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Albeiro

texts.es:
Desde hace varios años Albeiro tiene un negocios de venta de oxidad rápidas, específicamente chuzo de carne, con este negocio el ha podido ayudar a su familia y sostenerse el mismo, además de poder mejorar cada día su calidad de vida.

El quiere tener un negocio en un local para brindarle a sus clientes un mejor espacio para atenderlos.
texts.en:
For several years Albeiro has been selling fast food, especially meat chuzo (shish-kabob).  This business has allowed him to support his family and himself, while improving their quality of life on a daily basis.

His goal is to open an establishment where he can offer his customers more space.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase iron for his workshop.

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Joylyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale at her store.
Joylyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Joylyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for her store.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: La señora María, tiene 34 años, es residente de la comunidad de Las Flores, Naco, Santa Barbara, Su familia la integran 3 hijos,el mayor tiene 19 años, la siguiente niña de 14 años y el menor tiene 10 años, su esposo labora como jornalero en la extracción de arena y grava. Inicio su negocio hace un año y medio aproximadamente, en el cual ha logrado establecer una pulpería donde vende artículos de la canasta básica familiar, productos de aseo, golosinas y refrescos. Con la obtención de su primer crédito piensa surtir más su negocio lo cual le permitirá aumentar las ventas y mejorar sus ingresos familiares y lograr un desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
María, age 34, lives in the Las Flores de Naco community in the Santa Barbara department.  There are three children in her family.  The oldest is 19 years old, the middle child is a 14 year old daughter, and the youngest son is 10 years old.  Her husband is a day laborer, and he extracts sand and gravel.

She started her business approximately a year and a half ago.  She sells basic foodstuffs for the family, cleaning products, sweets, and soft drinks.

Upon getting her first loan she plans to stock her business more.  This will allow her to increase sales and improve the family income.  That way she will achieve financial growth.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with food like basic grains, dairy products, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Isata's Group

texts.en:
In the photo are teachers in one of the schools in Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan. Like their counterparts in other regions of the country, they have requested this loan for varied reasons – some to pay school fees for their children, buy house-building materials, invest in business, etc. At the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva lenders, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repaying SMT/Kiva lenders. 

Isatu is the leader of this group of teachers. The 42-year-old was born in a place called Koayima, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with 6 children – 1 in primary school and 5 in secondary school. Isatu has been a professional teacher for 10 years. She has requested this loan to pay school fees for her children and to invest the rest of the loan in a business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and invest the rest of the loan in a business

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, 39, is married with 3 school aged children who range between 5 and 11 years old. 

He requests a loan to buy construction supplies to increase his store's inventory.  He has been in business for seven years.

Felix expects to use the profits from his business to star another business.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies.

loans.name: Rodiyanto

texts.en:
Rodiyanto, a 29-year-old entrepreneur is married to Fransiska, a 29 -year-old lady. Rodiyanto and Fransiska have a daughter, named Chelsea, 1 year old. 

Rodiyanto owns an internet cafe business; it is located about one km from his residence. He has been running the business for three years. The business is operated from 8 am to 11 pm; it depends on the customers' needs. While running the business, Rodiyanto has been able to buy a photo printing machine to generate more money.  

Rodiyanto is a hard worker and has a passion to improve his business. Currently, he intends to purchase a used photocopy machine but doesn’t have money to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. Rodiyanto is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business through the loan assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a used photocopy machine.

loans.name: Gratien

texts.en:
Gratien is 33 years old and married, with two children who are between two and four years old. He owns a sewing business. This is his tenth year in this business and he works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day, except Saturday. Gratien currently employs one person to help him.

Gratien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more materials for his sewing. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for his sewing.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 30 year old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. She has a food stall business selling food in Buluk, South Sudan, which she has been doing for five years.

Hellen is requesting a loan from BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase tomatoes, onions, and cooking oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onion, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a single mother of five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member. She sells bananas at the market.  

Mwajuma has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for six years and works six days a week and sells on retail basis. Her business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Mwajuma aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and become a wholesale one. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her business.

She earns more income from the buying and selling of spices. Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 37 years old, married to Rose, and they have four children. He has been operating a retail shop for the last two years earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 20,000. He will use the loan to purchase stock of tea leaves, flour, cooking oil, bread and sugar. With the anticipated profits, he will save to recapitalize his shop.

His hope and dream is to own a wholesale store.

loans.use: To purchase stock of tea leaves, sugar, bread, and maize flour.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is very cooperative and supports her family by working as a farmer. She is still very efficient at the age of 43 and also performs her household duties very well. Her husband is a farmer and they help each other. Elisa is the mother of a son and a daughter. 

Elisa has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner for her farming business. With the loan investment, she will buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizers, which will allow her to get maximum output from her land and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed to grow her farming business

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors (in the photo) is 41 years old and her husband Sot is 48 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1987 and have three sons--one is a teacher, another studies pedagogy, and the other attends primary school. 

Samphors sells grocery items and sugarcane juice at her home, while her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her son who studies pedagogy to drive to school. He will become a teacher.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and is married to Franklin, a father who manages their transport motorcycle. Mercy and her family live in the village of San Antonio. To help her husband, Mercy engaged herself in her general store. She has been in her business for almost three years and earns about PHP 300 a day. 

Mercy wants to have more groceries to sell, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Mercy is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, and biscuits to sell. 

Mercy believes that, through her loan, she will be able to improve her business and increase her income to continuously secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Ifelodou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFELODOU est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Justine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Justine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Justine, âgée de 54 ans est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Théophile. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés dont quatre sont à leur charge. Justine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Justine vend des boissons et de l'eau minérale sur un parc. Justine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Justine ensemble avec les membres du  groupe IFELODOU, sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des boissons et de l'eau minérale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years, 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 6 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve his standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with five children  She lives at her own house that  has  no electricity but has  piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rebecca dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize
 flour, beans ,rice ,maize and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans ,rice ,maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Firudin

texts.en:
Firudin is refuge from Iran. He settled in Baku. He is married, has 2 children. He has his own repair shop. Firudin has been engaged in this business for 20 years. He installs operating systems  and repairs the electronic equipments: scaner, printer, fax,xerocopy and etc.
Firudin applies for the loan of $1000 to buy the HDD,RAM,mother board, monitors.

loans.use: To buy the HDD,RAM

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda, whose name means hope in Russian, owns a successful perfume and cosmetics business located in a busy market in Nikopol. She has operated her business for six years. Lively and full of energy, she works hard to make her business a success. By offering a wide selection of products at affordable prices, she has been able to broaden her available customer base and meet the needs of more clients. Nadezhda is requesting a loan for $1200 to allow her to re-supply her inventory and introduce new product lines. Her long term goal is to expand her business by opening additional vending kiosks and hiring staff to help her with sales. Currently, she and her husband are in the process of remodeling their apartment. Nadezhda would like to use part of her business income to help pay for the remodeling and to buy some new appliances for their home.

Надія – власниця успішного бізнесу з продажу парфумів та косметики на ринку в Нікополі. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже шість років. Надія – дуже жвава та енергійна. Вона наполегливо працює, щоб досягти успіху. Завдяки широкому вибору товарів за доступними цінами, Надія змогла розширити коло клієнтів та задовольнити попит з боку покупців. Надія просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів та закупити нові види парфумів й косметичних засобів. В майбутньому Надія хотіла б розширити бізнес, відкрити власну крамницю та взяти на роботу реалізаторів. Зараз вони з чоловіком роблять ремонт в квартирі. Надія планує витратити частину прибутку від бізнесу для того, щоб покрити витрати на ремонт приміщення та придбати нову побутову техніку для дому.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen has been working with her mother selling gas since she was ten years old. Her mother's separation from her father was Karen's main motive in helping her mother. She received help from her father to begin her business a year ago. She keeps her business open for 24 hours a day if there is demand for her product. She rents the locale where she has both her business and her home.

Karen will invest her credit in buying more cylinders, and she will take advantage of the low price she is being offered so that she will make a larger profit.

Karen is a 20 year old single mother. She has a daughter who is in school. Thanks to her job, her daughter is getting an education. Her mother helps her when she needs it. She hopes to save money to buy herself a plot of land and little by little build her home.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Karen desde la edad de 10 años ya trabaja junto a su mama en la venta de gas. Su mama se separo de su papa motivo que la hizo pensar en ayudar a su mama. Recibe la ayuda de su padre con la que inicia su actividad hace 1 año. Lo mantiene trabajando todos los días de la semana las 24 horas si la demanda lo amerita. Ella arrienda en este momento el local donde tiene su negocio y en el cual vive.

Karen el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas cilindros. Aprovechando que le están dejando cilindros a bajo precio. Con estos ella obtendrá una mejor ganancia.

Karen es madre soltera. Tiene 20 años. Una hija la cual estudia. Ella gracia ha su trabajo ha logrado darle educación. Recibe la ayuda de su mama cuando lo necesita. Su deseo es poder ahorrar y con ese dinero comprarse un solar. Donde poco a poco ir construyendo su casita.

loans.use: Invest in Gas cylinders

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is married, mother of 3 children who are in school. She is an active member of Muthiga United women group. She rears chickens which are the only source of her income. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. She rears the and sells them after 8 weeks for meat purpose. Emily would like to buy 50 chicks to boost the small stock she already have. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Emily would like to buy chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a 72 year old widow with 11 married, independent, working children; 4 of whom live in Argentina. Catalina recalls that it was not easy to raise 11 children, her effort and dedication to each one of them was based in the great love that parents have for their children. Also, teaching them about work and honor were important pillars for a good education. She says her husband dedicated himself to planting crops that once grown were sold to farmers. She saw her husband's great effort to save money, and with the help of some of the children that were working and earning an income, he bought a freezer and beverages to sell. This activity continued for 11 years, upon her husband's death she took over the business and became a woman that could now earn income and support herself. Catalina counts on the business, she feels useful and can take care of herself now that she is surrounded by her children who visit her frequently. The loan she seeks is to purchase additional merchandise inventory such as soda pop, beer, wine, whiskey and more.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Catalina tiene 72 años, es viuda, tiene 11 hijos, todos profesionales, casados y viven en forma independiente; de los cuales 4 viven en el país vecino de Argentina. La Sra. Catalina recuerda que no fue fácil la crianza de sus 11 hijos, su esfuerzo y dedicación a cada uno de ellos fueron basados en el gran amor que tenían los padres hacia ellos, así también las enseñanzas del trabajo y honradez fueron los pilares importantes para una buena educación ,comenta que su marido se dedicaba a la plantación de pastos que una vez crecidos los vendía a los viveros, viendo ella el gran esfuerzo que empleaba su esposo ahorro una suma de dinero y con la ayuda de algunos de sus hijos que ya tenían un trabajo y generaban ingreso para el núcleo familiar, adquirió un congelador y compro algunas bebidas para su venta. Esta actividad tiene una antigüedad de 11 años, al fallecer su esposo ella se convirtió en una mujer que ya podía generar ingresos y soportar por si sola los gastos de la casa. Doña Catalina cuenta que con su actividad se siente útil para sí misma ya que está rodeada de sus hijos que la visitan en forma frecuente. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar un poco de su inventario de mercaderías como: gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, whiskys y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as soda pop, beer, wine and others.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: I. Fumilayo is 32 years old, married with three children. A trained fashion designer. she said LAPO came to her aid in 2002 when she was in need of money to boast her fashion home. She has been a leader in a union under LAPO and lives in Ijaniki, a rural area of Lagos State. She needs a loan of $800 to buy more clothes and tailoring material for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring material

loans.name: Lanza 4 Group

texts.es:
Gloria is 34 and married with 2 children; her husband works in the fields. For the past 6 years, she has sold clothing from her house as well as on the streets. Flor de Maria also sells clothing both from home and on the streets. Julieta and Adregonia have put small grocery stores in their homes and supply products to persons in their communities. Gabriela is the only one of the group who sells soft drinks from home, to people in her neighborhood. Each of them, with their share of the loan, will replenish their business' supply of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

GLORIA TIENE 34 AÑOS , CASADA CON 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA AL TRABAJO DEL CAMPO, ELLA VENDE ROPA EN SU CASA Y ADEMAS SALE A VENDER EN LAS CALLES DE LA CIUDAD DESDE HACE COMO 6 AÑOS . AL IGUAL QUE DOÑA FLOR DE MARIA QUIEN TAMBIEN TIENE EN SU CASA VENTA DE ROPA . EN EL CASO DE JULIETA Y ADREGONIA ELLAS TIENEN EN SUS CASAS TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y ABASTECEN DE PRODUCTOS A LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD .SOLAMENTE GABRIELA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS DESDE SU CASA A LOS VECINOS DE SU SECTOR. TODAS ELLAS ABASTECERAN DE MAS MERCADERIA SUS LOCALES CON LA PARTE QUE LES CORRSPONDE DEL PRESTAMO.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to supply their respective businesses.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti A. is a 38-year-old widow who has two children. To provide day-to-day necessities for her family, she sells clothes, sheets, blankets, etc. on credit door-to-door, earning US$16 a day. As a member of MBK, Siti is asking for a loan of US$125 to expand her business in order to be able to pay for her children's education. She will repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Emil

texts.en: Emil K. has had a farming business for three years. He lives with his family in the village of Manastirishte neat Vratza. His wife is unemployed. Emil breeds 5 cows and needs to buy fodder for them.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his cows

loans.name: Ndifakulya West E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Ruth is 38 years old and is married, with a husband who is a peasant farmer for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Stella A., Rehema K., Betty M., and Annet N.. Stella A. has a business selling matooke and wants to boost business. Rehema K. is currently operating a carpentry business and wants a loan to purchase more timber. Betty M. operates a beauty salon business and wants to buy more chemicals and hair oils. Annet N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To stock large volumes of clothes

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana Maria is a hard working mother who actively contributes to the well being of her family by selling bread along a busy street in her city. She spends many hours at her small stand waiting for her customers. She realizes that with the excellent quality and customer service she gives, she can grow her business. She's decided to open a small shop where she can offer everyday grocery items as well as bread.

Ana María, es una trabajadora madre que contribuye de manera activa a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su amada familia a través de la venta de panes desde un establecimiento en la calle más concurrida de su ciudad.En este pequeño espacio permanece durante muchas horas en espera de sus clientes en todo momento. Se ha dado cuenta que con la excelente calidad de atención que brinda y a la acogida de sus clientes puede explotar aún más estas instalaciones y ha decidido implementar en el una bodega para además de ofertar panes vender artículos de primera necesidad.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN A SMALL SHOP WHERE SHE CAN EXPAND HER BUSINESS SELLING BREAD, TO INCLUDE EVERYDAY GROCERY ITEMS AS WELL.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon P. and her husband, Mr. Mot Ma, were married in 1978 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home.  Of their other four daughters, two work in a garment factory, one is in school, and one stays at home. Their son is a construction worker and helps his father raise cows. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mon has been selling corn for four years. She buys from farmers in her village for resale at Chba Ampov market in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows for resale.
