La socia pertenece al banco comunal "SUMAC PURIRISUN"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Santiago en Tica Tica, en el Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marleny, es nueva en el banco ella fue invitada a formar parte de este encantador grupo por su hermana mayor; la socia tiene 32 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 12, 10 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la elaboracion de gelatinas y de manera ambulatoria lleva  a vender a todos los clientes, ella tambien se dedica  a la elaboracion de comidas caseras para la venta tambien en forma independiente en su stand rotatorio; la socia solicita el prestamo para poder tener un capital de trabajo e invertir el prestamo en la compra de ingredientes como son gelatina para sus postres, arroz, azucar, aceite, fideos al por mayor para la realizacion de sus diferentes comidas caseras y la venta de estas. La socia soliciate l prestamo para invertir en la compra de sus ingredientes.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de manera responsable y trabjar mucho para prosperar.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the communal bank "Sumac Puririsun," located in Tica Tica in the Santiago district of the department of Cusco.

Marleny is new to the bank.  She was invited to join this delightful group by her older sister.  She is 32 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children aged 12 and 10.  She has a business making gelatin treats that she takes to sell to all of her customers.  In addition, she produces homemade meals that she also sells on her own from a rolling stand.  She requests a loan so that she can have working capital to invest in the purchase of ingredients, such as gelatin, for her desserts, and rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles at wholesale so she can make her various homemade meals and sell them.  She requests a loan to buy ingredients for her business.

Marleny pledges to make her payments in a responsible manner, and to work very hard in order to prosper.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make the various desserts and meals that she sells

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a hardworking businessman, aged 29. He is married and blessed with four children, all of whom are in school. 
Walter has been running a carpentry business for the last nine years to support his family. He employs two people to assist him in managing the business. He has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 
Walter is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy timber and paint. Thanks to Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. In the next five years, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy timber and paint.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of seven children. All of them go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a business selling bananas. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT - SACCO, which she wants to use to buy more bunches of bananas. Rose works from her home and works seven days a week. She sells on a retail basis and doesn’t have any other income-generating activities. Her business challenges include thieves and seasonality. Rose aspires to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only. She stays in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal   ”QORI ORCCO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra Norma;  La socia tiene 35 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 4 hijos de 16, 15, 9, 6 años de edad; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella compra y vende animales menores como cuyes, pollos, , gallinas, la socia lleva a vender a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado en cjas; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de un total de 80 al mes de gallinas, la socia compra por semanas ella compra 40 a 60 gallinas a la semana;  y comprara 160 cuyes. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes y gallinas.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the ”Qori Orcco" communal bank, located in the district of Urcos, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department. She is 35, and lives with her partner. She has 4 children, ages 16, 15, 9, and 6. 

She has a retail business, where she buys and sells small animals such as guinea pigs, roosters, and hens. She takes them to the city of Puerto Maldonado in crates to sell. 

On this occasion, she wishes to use the loan to buy a total of 80 hens a month. She buys weekly. She buys 40 to 60 hens a week. She will also buy 160 guinea pigs. She is applying for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and hens. 

She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her instalment payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single lady aged 27 years and has one child aged 5 years.  She owns a boutique in Kapsabet town. It has been in operation for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,000.

She is requesting her second loan of Kes 40,000 from KADET Ltd.  She intends to use the funds  to purchase more clothing for resale and the anticipated profit will be used to pay back the loan as well as provide for family upkeep.

She hopes to grow her business into a large-scale clothing store and live a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Sobresalientes De San José Group

texts.es:
13 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se han unido con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familias, que se esfuerzan día a día por poder darle el sustento a sus hijos y familiares. Son mu trabajadoras, emprendedoras y por sobre todo muy luchadoras. Ven en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso.
Una de estas laboriosas mujeres es Fulbia, quien trabaja en la costura, desde hace ya un buen tiempo. Ella ha trabajado en esto por un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le acerca muchos trabajos. Deseo poder seguir ampliando su negocio y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza al máximo, para poder lograr sus objetivos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cierres, botones, telas, gomas y demás insumos necesarios par poder abastecerse y tener materiales para poder cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
Thirteen women from Ciudad del Este have come together with the goal of working together to be able to help each other through that work.  The women are heads of household who make the effort every day to be able to support their children and families.  They are very hardworking and entrepreneurial, and above all they all are fighters.  They see the Fundación Paraguaya program as a great opportunity for progress.

One of these hardworking women is Fulbia, who has worked in sewing for a long time.  She has a good clientele that brings her a lot of work because she has worked in this for a long time.  She wants to be able to continue expanding her business, so she always makes the maximum effort to be able to achieve her goals.

She is requesting the loan to buy clasps, buttons, fabric, glue, and other supplies necessary to be able to stock up and have materials to be able to satisfy the customers' requests.

loans.use: to buy clasps, buttons, fabric, glue, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and a mother of three children; they are 8, 6 and 3 years old. To earn a living, Sandra is engaged in a direct-selling business where she sells RTW (ready to wear) products. Aside from this, she also raises pigs while her husband does carpenter. They work together to earn and sustain for a living. Sandra wants to improve her livelihood for her children’s education. To do this, she is requesting for a loan to buy goods such as shirts, skirts, pants, curtains and other apparels; she will also buy lotion, fragrances and beauty products. Aside from this, she needs to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, pants, curtains and other apparels; she will also buy lotion, fragrances and beauty products; feed

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya T. is married. She has a son and a daughter. She is a Technical school graduate. After the studies Nelya lacked work opportunities in her field since there was a problem with unemployment in Ukraine. She had to to sell homemade pastry at the markets to meet the needs of her family. In 2001 she got her first loan in Nadiya Ukraine and decided to start a small business selling coats and jackets. Nelya opened a kiosk at one of the local markets. She employed a lady who is currently working there selling clothing which provides a stable source of income for her family. Nelya also owns a kiosk and rents a store offering a great variety of food products at two different parts of the city. Nelya is very organized and full of energy. She always seeks to provide better service to her customers. She is very responsible and has been punctual with her past loans from Nadiya giving us confidence that she will repay this loan on time. Nelya needs $2,000 to improve her business and stock more clothing items. The loan will help her expand her business and clientele. Applying this additional capital to her business will have a positive impact not only on her trade profitability but will improve the economic and social situation of her employees and their families.

Товстоног Неля Іванівна – одружена. В неї є син і дочка. Неля Іванівна має середньо-технічну освіту. Закінчивши навчання, Неля Іванівна не могла влаштуватися на роботу за своєю спеціальністю, в країні на той час панувало безробіття. Вона була змушена продавати пиріжки на ринках міста для того, щоб задовольнити фінансові потреби родини. В 2001 році Неля Іванівна отримала першу позику в „Надії України” та відкрила власну справу, почавши продавати теплий зимній одяг, а саме, пальта та шуби. Неля Іванівна відкрила кіоск на одному з місцевих ринків. Вона взяла на роботу жінку, яка зараз працює реалізатором одягу, а отже, отримує стабільну зарплатню та забезпечує свою родину. Неля Іванівна є власницею продуктового кіоску, а також орендує приміщення для того, щоб продавати різноманітні продовольчі товари в іншій частині міста. Неля Іванівна – дуже організована, завжди сповнена енергії. Вона завжди намагається якомога краще обслуговувати своїх покупців. Вона – відповідальна, завжди дуже пунктуальна, особливо якщо це стосується сплати позик, які вона отримала в „Надії України”. Ці якості підтверджують, що вона спроможна сплатити позику вчасно. Неля Іванівна просить про суму в 2000 доларів для того, щоб покращити торгівлю та закупити більше одягу задля продажу. Позика сприятиме розвитку бізнесу та допоможе привабити більшу кількість клієнтів. Додатковий капітал позитивно впливатиме не тільки на прибутки з продажу товарів, але й підвищить економічне та соціальне становище її підлеглих та їхніх родин

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 3 sufurias (cooking pots), 2 plastic packing containers, & 1 jiko

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a mother of four who started her business in 2002. It includes buying cereals, especially maize, from the farmers during harvest seasons and selling in retail at the local trading centre. She is a trained tailor and dress maker. At first she used to make dresses to sell at the trading centre, but quit when she saw there was stiff competition and turned to selling cereals.  She says the business is doing well.  She also molds bricks and sells them at construction sites. Through her businesses, she has been able to educate her children and support her family. With a loan from PEMCI, she plans to increase on her cereals stock and also purchase some more brick molding tools.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals and buy brick-molding tools

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca sells breakfast to people in her neighborhood. She shares the establishment with someone else who serves at night.  She plans on using this loan to buy a freezer and more foodstuffs.  She has been working in this business for over one year.  She is married with 4 male children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver in the city of Santo Domingo. In her menu she serves spaghetti, bananas and eggs, among other things.  She buys the foodstuffs in the local market .

loans.use: To buy a freezer and more foodstuff

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha Alicia, who has lived all her life in Nuevo Leon, Monterrey, lives with her partner and has two children. Her partner is a bricklayer but his salary is very low. She and her family went through many difficult times, so in order to get ahead, Martha decided to open up her own business where she sells used clothing. One of her brother finds the clothing in traveling markets, and Martha's enthusiam and good service has allowed her business to grow since its inception 4 years ago.

Right now, Martha is requesting a loan of $250, which she would pay back in 3 months, and that will be used to buy additional merchandise to meet her customers' demands. She realizes that a good selling season is approaching and she would like to be prepared.

Martha is very grateful for the opportunity you offer which will help her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Alicia es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos, su pareja se desempeña como albañil pero su salario es muy bajo, ella y su familia pasaban por muchas necesidades y para poder salir adelante Martha decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada, uno de sus hermanos consigue la ropa que comercializan juntos en los mercados rodantes, el entusiasmo y el buen servicio que ofrecen les ha permitido hacer crecer su negocio desde hace cuatro años que iniciaron.

En estos momentos, Martha está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses y destinará a la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, ella sabe que se aproxima una buena temporada de ventas y quiere estar preparada. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Martha agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to help her business grow.

loans.name: Roda Luz

texts.es:
We find Roda Ramirez working diligently in her small store, in which she happily displays the diversity of her products, primarily those of basic needs (groceries, cleaning supplies, health products, etc.) She and her adored husband rent a their store space in a local commercial zone, and as the number of people near their own home is relatively low, it was not conducive to having a store in their own neighborhood. The rent for this store space has increased over time and has cut into their earnings considerably. And so, the family would like to increase the quantity of their products to increase their earnings. In this way, they could continue to pay rent for their store space and also save enough money to purchase their own store space in the future. Their ultimate goal is to give a better standard of life to their small son. Help us support this woman in her search for happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Encontramos a Roda Ramirez enfrascada diligentemente en su pequeña bodega, en el que expende animosamente diversidad de productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes, artículos de limpieza, de salud, etc.)Ella y su querido esposo alquilan el local de su bodega en una zona comercial, ya que la afluencia de público por su vivienda es relativamente baja, lo que no permitiría tener un negocio de estas características en su casa. El pago por este alquiler con el tiempo se ha incrementado poco a poco y muchas veces este pago merma considerablemente sus ingresos, por lo que esta familia desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos para aumentar sus ganancias.De esta manera podrán seguir pagando el alquiler de su local y ahorrar un poco de dinero para seguir proyectándose en el futuro a tener un local propio con el objetivo de seguir brindándole lo mejor a su pequeño niño.Ayudemos a esta mujer en la búsqueda de su felicidad.

loans.use: Investment to expand the quantity and variety of her products.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Mrs. Tho P., 56, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together in their farm growing rice crops and vegetables, earning about $2 each day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory in the city and the rest are unemployed. Mrs. Tho P. would like to apply for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for one of her unemployed child to run a recycling business. She believes this business will increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her unemployed child to run a recycling business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata J. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. She sells second-hand clothes in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone and has been doing this business for the past 4 years.

She is requesting a $700 loan to expand her business. She has been with the SMT program for 3 years and has experienced considerable progress in her business.

loans.use: Expand her clothing business by purchasing additional bales of clothing to resell

loans.name: Stefka

texts.en: Stefka Z. lives in the village of Mighailovo near Vratza. For more than 20 years, she has had a farming business. Now she breeds 8 cows and 15 goats. Her husband works in a construction company and her son is grown up and lives in the city of Vratza. Stefka Z. applies for a loan to supply enough fodder for her farm.

loans.use: To supply enough fodder for her farm

loans.name: Selminaz

texts.en: Selminaz I. is a livestock breeder in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She is married with three children and has been involved in this business for a number of years. She has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit in the amount of 600 AZN (~$700) thus proving herself to be a trustworthy customer. She is currently looking for funding of $1200 in order to increase the size of her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
One of Esther’s friends encouraged her to invest in a business selling beauty products. To decided to go ahead, because at that time there were problems at home and she was looking for new ways to generate income. For a while she had been cleaning houses, washing clothes and kitchens of her various customers. Today, she only does this for short periods, one or two days, or on the weekends. Everything she earns goes towards her five children; since despite the fact that her husband also works as a driver, they often need more income. This is why, until she finds a more stable job she is going to continue to put all her efforts into developing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Una amiga de Esther la animó a invertir en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Ella decidió aceptar, porque en aquel momento pasaba por algunos problemas en su casa y buscaba otras formas de generar ingresos al hogar. Muy aparte, desde hace un tiempo ella ofrece servicios de limpieza a casas, de lavado de ropa y de cocina a diversos clientes. Actualmente, solo lo hace por temporadas pequeñas, un día dos días o los fines de semana. Las ganancias que ella obtiene de su arduo trabajo van dirigidas a sus cinco hijos; ya que, a pesar, de que su esposo también trabaja siendo chofer, muchas veces se necesita más de un ingreso en la familia; por ello, hasta que encuentre un trabajo más estable seguirá poniendo todo su empeño para crecer en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: La Restauracion (Restoration) Group

texts.en:
Berty Cristóbal is a young woman who lives with her husband and three children, aged 14, 16 and 21 years old.  They all live in small farming town called Hato Mayor, and Berty has started a small business selling used and new clothing, as well as small home decorations.

She is asking for this loan so that she can increase the merchandise she is able to have on hand, and thus be able to sell more.  She would also like to buy some pots and pans to begin selling as well, for a little bit of variety.

Although life can often be challenging and difficult Berty is optimistic that this loan will help her improve her life and her family’s lives.  It is her goal to one day own her own home, and also have enough money to buy and build her own big store to sell her products from—and above all, it is her dream to have enough money to pay for her children to study at the local  university.

On behalf of the entire team at Esperanza International, as well as Berty and her entire group—we thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise,  and expand the variety of products she is able to offer.

loans.name: Ake's Group

texts.en:
This group from Faala Palauli is a new group in which the members work individually on their businesses but, when it comes to the time of payments, they are very kind to each other. Most of them work on plantations and vegetable gardens because their land is fertile. Their husbands weed the grasses and plant the taro (called "taamu" in Samoa), while the women are responsible for marketing and sales. This is their first loan and also the first time for them to run their own businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of equipments, tools, chemicals and fertilizers for the businesses

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.en: G. Bibniso is 23 years old. She has been running her own business for six years to support her parents. Bibiniso sells a variety of accessories and hair products for women in the local market. She would like to expand her business, and open her own store to establish contacts with constant supplies of well known producers. Bibiniso would like a loan of $1000 to increase the range of goods she sells, and increase her profits to support her family.

loans.use: Purchasing the goods for selling in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of M. T. D.. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 5 years. She is the mother of one daughter and one son. Her daughter is 3 months old and her son is one year old. Shazia baji completed her education until the 10th standard grade. She runs a boutique independently. Her husband makes decorative scarves and sells them in the market. This is a very profitable business because Multan City is famous for its handmade items. Shazia baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (thread, needles) to help expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy material for her decorative embroidery business. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy more supplies (lentils, cooking oil) for her grocery shop. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Hussan Bano baji wants a loan to buy material for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. (shown on the left in the photo with her group members) was selected to be the group leader by the five other members for a loan from Maxima.  The group participants live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Touch P., 39, was married in 1990 and has four daughters. She has been selling jasmine flowers for 18 years, while her husband works as a mason. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

2-Mrs. Sokunthea P., 28, married in 2000, has three children, one son and two daughters. She and her husband have been selling jasmine flowers and bananas since 2000, and now Sokunthea is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

3-Mrs. Dany S., 33, was married in 1999 and has three sons. Dany has been selling jasmine flowers since 1997, while her husband has worked in construction since 1999. Dany is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

4-Mrs. Vorn S., 42, was married in 1986 and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Vorn has been selling jasmine flowers for eight years, while her husband farms. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

5-Mrs. Voeun N., 49, is a widow with four children, two sons and two daughters. Voeun has been selling jasmine flowers since 1998 and is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

6-Mr. Phearin N., 21, was married in 2008. Phearin has been selling jasmine flowers since early this year, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Phearin is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers for resale.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride A. is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. She started her business because there was no other way to feed her family as she and her husband were unemployed. Now, she has been running her store for 10 years. She sells different kinds of goods, including kitchen equipment and accessories for girls. Feride is very dynamic and cares for her family. She tries to give her family as much money as possible to cover the school expenses of her children because she dreams that all of them will be well educated. Today, Feride wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. For this purpose, she requests a loan. She is borrowing money for the first time. Your help and support can make her closer to her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián tiene 44 años, es soltero y vive en casa de su hermana con su familia. Es un hombre muy carismático, esto le ha ayudado en su negocio de venta de productos Herbalife (productos alimenticios), donde se tiene que convencer a las personas para que le compren sus productos. Hasta ahora a Don Fabián le va muy bien, logrando buenos ingresos económicos, dedicándole gran parte de su tiempo al trabajo, pero no teniendo un horario fijo ya que trabaja por pedidos. Don Fabián quiere ayudar en la economía de su familia y colocar su granito de arena para lograr su bienestar. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más de sus productos Herbalife para distribuirlos a más personas y así lograr mejores ganancias.  En el futuro Don Fabián quiere subir en la escala de esta compañía, para lograr mejores ingresos económicos y asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Fabián is 44-years-old, single, and lives in his sister's house with her family. He is a very charismatic man, and this has helped him in his business of selling Herbalife products (nutritional products) when he has to convince people to purchase his products. Until now it has gone very well for Don Fabián, as he has made a good income. He dedicates a large part of his time to his work, but he doesn't have a fixed schedule since he works by taking orders.

Don Fabián wants to help with his family's expenses and do his part to achieve their well-being. With the money from this loan, he will purchase more Herbalife products to distribute to more people and therefore obtain more products. In the future, Don Fabián wants to increase the scale of this company to obtain more income and to secure his retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of the products he sells

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente con su esposo y tiene un hijo, vive en casa de su suegra. Hace tres años puso un locutorio de llamadas telefónicas en servicio de la comunidad, en vista que por su barrio no había ese tipo de servicio. Años anteriores trabajaba en el cafetín de una escuela, pero dice que el locutorio le es más rentable y le permite estar en casa para cuidar  a sus hijos menores. Su deseo es  incrementar más cabinas, para así poder generarse más ingresos, ella muestra gratitud por haberle facilitado ese préstamo y hacer realidad su sueño de crecer. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va incrementar más cabinas para su negocio y generarse mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rocio is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and son in her mother-in-law's house. Three years ago, she created a "telephone shop" ** to serve her community, because before, her neighborhood did not have this type of service available. In years past, Rocio worked in a school cafeteria, but she says that the phone shop is more profitable, and it allows her to stay at home and care for her child. She wants to add more telephone booths to increase her revenue, and so she is grateful for this loan and the ability to realize her dream. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the requested loan, she will add more phone booths to her business and increase her revenues. ** Translator's note: A "locutorio" is a "telephone shop," and it appears to be a place filled with telephone booths, sometimes offering cheaper calling rates than are available by other means.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add booths to her phone shop

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
The married father of two children who are presently in school as well as a renowned photographer with 10 years of experience, 31-year-old Solomon B. is a very dynamic, innovative, and hardworking young man who attends to his work with professionalism and customer care.

Solomon takes pictures in a wide variety of settings, going to places such as churches, wedding programs, etc. in order to solicit business. He says photography is a lucrative activity that he very much enjoys doing. Because digital photography has become so popular, Solomon is requesting a loan to purchase a digital camera, batteries, photo printer etc. He believes this will help him to remain in business and expand his clientele. In the future he plans to open a photo studio so that potential customers will be able to locate him easily.

Solomon is part of the ‘Holiness’ Trust group, whose members agree to guarantee each others’ loans.

loans.use: To buy camera film, tents, a digital camera and a photo printer.

loans.name: Pras

texts.en: Pras S. is a 27-year-old grocery vendor in Siem Reap province. She earns US$ 4/day selling various kinds items and lives with her 30-year-old husband and their 2 children. Two of her children are too young to be students. Pras S. will use this loan to help buy farmland to grow rice. In the future, she'd like to see her children graduate from university.

loans.use: To purchase farmland

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Anne Marie a 27 ans .Elle est mariée est mere de 2 enfants .Pour gagner sa vie et parciper aux charge de la maison ,elle fabrique des produits pour cheveux qu' elle vend aux filles .ces produits fait avec des produits naturels sont tres demandés par les filles.Pour renforcer son activité par une accroissement de sa production elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
Anne Marie, age 27, is married and the mother of two. To earn a living and to help with family expenses, she makes hair products that she sell to girls. These products, made from natural materials, are highly sought after by them. She is requesting a loan to enhancing her business by increasing her production.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.en:
I. Umarjon is a successful young father and a dedicated husband. He has a two-year-old child. Umarjon began a small grocery store two years ago with a small amount of savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular. He is asking for a loan of $1000 USD so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Umarjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.     
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes Elizabeth Y. B.  tiene 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella actualmente cursa el 3er ciclo de una carrera técnica.
Lourdes, se dedica a básicamente a sus estudios, establece una asociación con su pareja el cual se dedica a ser moto taxista.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Luis Alberto Sánchez II”, lo invirtió en la compra de piezas para la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (moto taxi) .
Con el crédito de 600 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra del motor y pago de las cuotas del alquiler / venta del moto taxi.
Lourdes tiene como sueño, concluir sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Lourdes Elizabeth Y. B. is 20 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province in the state of La Libertad. She is currently in her third level of coursework towards a technical career. Although Lourdes is primarily a student, she has also established a partnership with her husband, who drives a motorized rickshaw.

Lourdes is a member of the “Luis Alberto Sánchez II” Community Bank, and invested her first loan (for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in the purchase of parts to repair her rickshaw. The current loan (for 600 nuevos soles, to be repaid in four months) will be used to purchase a motor and to cover the lease payments on the rickshaw.

Lourdes's dream is to complete her higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor and to cover lease payments on her rickshaw

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 44 años, vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida, explotaba al máximo sus virtudes culinarias preparando alimentos con ausencia de condimentos fuertes, de tal forma que facilitaba la buena digestión de sus comensales; pero su dificultad fue que en algunos meses no podía cubrir el costo del pago por el alquiler de su local. Entonces, al terminar de construir su casa, pensó en implementar un negocio de abarrotes en ella, y con este negocio ya lleva cerca de 5 meses, en los cuales viene captando clientela, y eso le causa mucha alegría y le complace, además de apoyar con las tareas escolares de sus hijos pequeños. Su esposo trabaja de chofer haciendo trasporte entre las ciudades de Huancayo y Tarma (trayecto de más o menos 2 horas); y también la apoya en la carga de la mercadería para la tienda. Carmen quiere mantener muy surtido su negocio para captar a todos sus vecinos y empezar a hacer de su tienda una actividad rentable. Ella es la tesorera de su banquito comunal, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero que ahora solicita es para que incrementar los productos de su bodega.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her partner and their 4 children in her own home. She used to own a food sales business in which she made use of her culinary skills by preparing meals without the use of too much seasoning. Thus, her meals promoted good digestion for her patrons. However, her problem was that she was unable to pay rent for her business space. As a result, after finishing construction of her house, she got the idea of setting up a general store there. She has been in this business for almost 5 months now, during which time she has been drawing in customers, which makes her feel happy. She also supports her young children with their school work. Her husband works as a driver, going from Huancayo to Tarma, which takes about 2 hours. He also transports merchandise to stores. Carmen wants to keep her business well-stocked so that she can draw in all her neighbors and start to make her general store more profitable. She is the treasurer of her microfinance institute. This is her 8th loan with MFP, and she has paid her installments punctually this whole time. The money that she is now requesting will be used to increase her general store goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase goods

loans.name: Moulai Hassan

texts.fr: Monsieur Moulai Hassan D. est tailleur marié et a son propre atelier depuis plus de 15 ans. Il a l’âge de 39 ans. Il confectionne des habits pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Avec ce crédit il veut renforcer son activité par acheter des tissus qu’il confectionne pour les revendre.  Avec les bénéfices il compte rembourser son crédit et améliorer sa qualité de vivre.  Monsieur D. a reçu 4 crédits auprès de l’IMCEC et il les a bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mr. Moulai Hassan D. is a married tailor and has had his own workshop for over fifteen years. He is 39 years old. He makes clothing that he sells in the weekly marketplaces. With this loan, he wants to bolster his business by buying fabrics for making clothing for resale. With the profits, he intends to repay his loan and to improve his quality of life. Mr. D. has had four loans from IMCEC, and he has repaid them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia G. is the mother of four children, three of whom are in school. The family is living at Purok 1-B Del Carmen Iligan City.

At present, Cecelia’s only source of income is her fruit business but she has financial difficulties over the educational expenses of their children. But she is motivated to work for the betterment of their daily living. She want to expand her business through additional capital with a loan from HSPFI in the amount of PHP 5,000. This could be a good start for her to reach her ambition to have a fruit stand in their nearby villages.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for her business

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung T. Thị (3220000603) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nhung owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Nhung has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, Nhung joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nhung has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nhung is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Nhung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri G. is 37, and a single mother who has four daughters whose ages range from 1 to 18. Her family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land she owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. Her eldest daughter works as a waitress at the local restaurant and her next two daughters are attending a high school.

In 2006 Batsuuri started running a handicraft-making business. She buys sheep’s wool, processes it and then makes Mongolian traditional handicrafts. She or her children sells them mostly to tourists. When summer comes she makes more handicrafts to sell tourists as many tourists come to visit Mongolia.

When Batsuuri began running her business, her working capital was 50,000 tugrugs ($1 USD= 1450 MNT). As a result of her hard work, her business capital has increased 200,000 tugrugs. Besides running a handicraft business, to increase her family income, she plants vegetables on the land she owns. She requests a loan to buy raw material such as wool, wire and paint to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase wool, wire and paint for her handicrafts

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es: Don Manuel tiene la edad de 43 años, reside en una colonia Minuha en el municipio Villa del Carmen, casado, su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene dos hijos, uno trabaja el otro estudia, el señor Manuel se desempeña como audito interno, sus planes para sus hijos es apoyarlo para que culminen sus estudios. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de un porche para gozar junto con su familia las mejoras. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Don Manuel is 43 years old, and lives in the Minuha colony of Villa del Carmen municipality. He is married, and has 2 children. One of his children works, while the other studies. Manuel works as an internal auditor. His plans are to support his children so they can complete their studies. With this loan, Manuel will build a porch to enjoy with his family. He gives thanks to Afodenic for the opportunity to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a woman of vision, striving to remove her family from poverty. She is 47 years old and the mother of six children: four boys and two girls. She is married to Benito, 47 years old, and her business partner. She hails from the island village of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

Aspiring to rise up from poverty, Cornelia joined Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008 with the hope of accessing capital for her sari-sari store (general store). She notes that her store brings in good income since, in an island village, not everyone has the capacity to go to the mainland to buy items for their basic needs.

Just recently, she applied for a loan of 5,000 pesos as additional capital to pay for two sacks of rice, sugar and groceries for the store. She is looking forward to sending her children to school and to expanding her business.

loans.use: To pay for two sacks of rice, sugar and groceries for a store

loans.name: Triunfadoras De Los Andes Group

texts.es: “Triunfadoras de Los Andes” un grupo unido y alegre, se reúnen cada catorce días en el Centro Focal del mismo nombre, se agruparon hace 10 años aproximadamente y vienen trabajando con optimismo y responsabilidad, cumpliendo sus reglamentos y los de la institución, además hacen uso de los servicios de Pro Mujer como la capacitación y visitando al consultorio. Actualmente su presidenta es María   López,  de 44 años de edad y vende comida hace 20 años ingresó al  grupo porque necesitaba comprar herramientas de trabajo y ahora necesita el préstamo para la comprar al por mayor  insumos como la papa, arroz y fideo a un costo menor. Las demás integrantes también cuentan con sus actividades económicas como la costura de ropa (chamarras, vestidos, sacones) otras elaboran peluches y  algunas cuentan con una tienda de barrio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de materia prima y mercadería.

loans.use: COMPRA DE INSUMOS, MATERIA PRIMA Y MERCADERIA

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 38 years old he is married and father of three children. All his children are in school. He operates drinking spots where he sells all kinds of soft drinks such as  canned malts, Coke, Pepsi, tonic water, canned and bottle drinks etc. He is an achiever, very hard working and his focus is to save enough to provide for his business and the children with quality education. But he claims without adequate fund it can’t be possible to realize that dream. He is been running the drinking spots for ten years now. And he needs the loan to buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade his inventory. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe N. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 30 years old. Fe is married and has 2 school-aged children.

To make a living, Fe owns & operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from tricycle transport services. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to pay for registration, franchise and licenses.

Fe is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara L. is a new member of ASHI. Along with her four children, whose ages range is from 9 to 29 years old, and her 55-year-old husband, she lives in a municipality surrounded with wide verdant rice fields. The majority of people’s economic resources in their place comes through rice farming. This includes Baltazara’s husband and two eldest children who are farm laborers.

Poor people like Baltazara and her husband do not have their own rice field to farm. Instead, some of them opt to rent wealthy people’s farmland, a process which, in Antique province, is called “ariendo”. Ariendo is a system wherein poor people using wealthy people’s farmland give cavans (sacks) of rice to the owner every harvest in payment. The amount depends on the agreement between both parties.

Baltazara wishes to have her own land to farm someday on which her husband and her two sons will work. To start reaching that goal, she has no other choice for now but to continue to involve herself in the common practice of ariendo. The loan she is requesting will be used to start up this business for her family to be able to augment the income of her husband and two sons. With her loan assisting her farming business, someday she will be able to buy land of her own to farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs for her rice-farming business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 47 yrs old and married to Elena. They are blessed with four children, two sons and two daughters. He was introduced to Kadet through an existing client. He is applying for his second loan.

Joseph owns and operates a butcher shop. He will use his loan to expand his business and diversify the food he sells to ultimately increase his income. In the future, he intends to buy a car and a motorbike and open a green-grocery business with the extra profit he earns.

He dreams about purchasing a piece of land and and developing it into rental houses. He describes himself as a focused man and a hardworking business man.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase additional food to sell in his butcher shop

loans.name: Enemecia

texts.en: Selling vegetables is the business of Enemecia A.. She is married to Pablito and they have three children, namely: Jomar (19 years old, high school graduate), Jayvin (16 years old, in high school), and Jordan (9 years old, elementary pupil). Enemecia is a very generous mother to her three children. Though she wasn’t able to send her children to tertiary level, somehow she managed to send them to secondary level of education. Enemecia would like to improve her business so that she can continue meeting the needs of her children, with financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos for business development. She plans to buy more vegetables to sell so that her income will increase.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en:
A. Abdullo is a 42-year-old working man used to working the harvest from sunup to sundown. He lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan with his wife. She is very hard-working, characteristic of the women there, and they have five children. They grow corn and onions in their field. Their work supports the family. Now they need a loan of $2800 USD because it is a crucial time for their crops. They need to be maintained so that they are high quality at harvest time. With this loan, Abdullo will be able to purchase more seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants in order to grow more vegetables. With your help, this will be possible. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en: D. Bulgan is 34 years old and lives with her son, mother, and younger sister in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger." Her son is nine years old and attends a local secondary school. With the help of her sister, Bulgan operates a clothing business from a rented stall at a local market in her town. Bulgan spends most of her time importing her clothing products from China. Her sister run the market stall. Bulgan started her business in 2008 after having operating a small cafe with her friends. She is very focused on building a successful business and is currently taking courses at the Mongolian Trading and Manufacturing College to increase her business knowledge. She has used this knowledge and her past experience to expand her business over the last year. Bulgan has many plans for the future and hopes to rent a second stall soon where she will sell shoes. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ $1375 USD) loan to purchase clothing for her business and pay her school fees. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: Kiva Lending Team - XacBank-Mongolia. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click: Mongolian Borrowers on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Jory

texts.en:
Jory S. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Jory raises crops, mainly planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month. In 2007, Jory joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jory is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Gladys del Carmen T. tiene 61 años de edad es casada, con 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, es de la etnia Mestiza y tiene un tramo de venta en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields, desde hace mas de 3 años en donde vende verduras tales como: papas, cebolla, tomate, chiltoma, yuca, quequisques, chayote, naranjas, limones y otros

Señalamos que la señora T. es miembro de la iglesia Verbo desde hace algunos años en donde participa activamente en las actividades de la iglesia. La señora T. esta solicitando apoyo para que se le financie la suma de US 900 dólares para comprar verduras como las mencionadas en el párrafo anterior y poder ofertar a sus clientes más productos. 

La microempresaria T. agradece de antemano por el apoyo que se le dará con este préstamo y asume la responsabilidad de su pago en las cuotas que se acorden entre los prestamistas y ella.
texts.en:
This businesswoman is Gladys del Carmen T.. She is 61, married, and has five grown children. She is of Mestiza ethnicity. She has a sales stall in the municipal market in the city of Bluefields. For over three years she has been selling vegetables like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, sweet peppers, yucca, “quequisques” (a root vegetable), “chayote” (a plant from the gourd family), oranges, lemons, and others. Mrs. T. has been a member of the Verbo church for several years. She actively participates in church activities. Mrs. T. is asking for a loan for 900 US dollars to buy vegetables like the ones mentioned in the previous paragraph. Then she will be able to offer her customers more products. Businesswoman T. thanks you ahead of time for the support that the loan will give her. She assumes the responsibility for making her payments as agreed upon by the lenders and herself.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables like potatoes, onions, tomatoes, sweet peppers, yucca, “quequisques” (a root vegetable), “chayote” (a plant from the gourd family), oranges, lemons, and others

loans.name: Chroeng

texts.en:
Mr. Chroeng Y., 50, (pictured here) and his wife Mrs. Eang Um, 48, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have six children: five sons and one daughter, two of whom are garment factory workers.

Chroeng and his wife have been producing rice wine and raising pigs for 15 years. He is applying for his first loan of $800 in order to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business of producing rice wine and raising pigs

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Ysabel es casada, tiene 60 años y 12 hijos, Ysabel viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. ropa variada, y D. las ferias compra cereales, queso. Ysabel también tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general.
Ysabel necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pantalones, sombreros y blusas.
Los sueños D. Ysabel son ampliar su tienda habilitando otro ambiente mas.
texts.en:
Ysabel is member of the Communal Bank "Tarpuy," which in Quechua means "Harvest." Ysabel is married, is 60 years old, and has 12 children. Ysabel travels to different markets around the region where she sells clothes and buys cereal and cheese. She also operates a store from her home where she sells groceries. Ysabel needs a loan of PEN 2,000, which she will use to buy pants, hats, and blouses. Ysabel dreams of making her store bigger by adding another room to it.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip renders computer services and he also sells rechargeable phone cards at retail prices to his customers. With these combined businesses, he hopes to make his undertaking sustainable. He is a young, hard-working man and he is determined to excel in business. He loves his business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. 

Philip is 28 years old and single, without children. He hopes to get married and have children very soon. He is itching for expansion in his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Bc Abejitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bc Abejitas” esta representado por la señora Simona y compuesto por 11 miembros compuesta D. 10 mujeres y un varón. La señora Simona es propietaria D. un puesto D. ventas D. radios y aparatos electrónicos, ella es madre D. tres niños en edad escolar es casada y su esposo le ayuda con la venta D. los artefactos electrónicos y es comerciante D. productos  los cuales venD. en el mercado central, su mayor expectativa es poder obtener ingresos para poder terminar su casa y comprar una tienda para que su esposo tenga un puesto fijo, el destino del financiamiento es la compra D. mercadería nueva y para capital D. trabajo. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. edredones, frazadas, regalos, ropa, artesanías y coca. El mercado en el cual se desempeñan existe bastante competencia, sin embargo, ellas se valen D. la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir sus mercaderías para salir adelante y obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. sus familias. El presente crédito será utilizado para capital D. operaciones y para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y materiales para incrementar su ventas y mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia se pueD. mencionar que las socias trabajaron antes bajo la modalidad D. créditos solidarios en otras instituciones similares a la fundación por lo que saben administrar los fondos otorgados para el beneficio D. sus negocios y para el mejoramiento D. la calidad D. vida D. sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group "Bc Abejitas" is represented by Simona, and is maD. up of 11 members, including 10 women and 1 man. Simona owns a sales stand where she sells radios and other electronic devices. She is the mother of 3 children who are school-aged. She is married, and her husband helps her with the sales of the electronic items, and he is also a trader in the central market. Her main hope is to be able to have enough income to finish her house and to buy a store so that her husband could have a fixed place to sell. She will use this loan to buy new merchandise and for working capital. The other members sell a variety of products including: comforters, blankets, gifts, clothing, handicrafts and coca leaves. In the market where they sell there is quite a bit of competition, however, they rely on quickly changing and restocking their products so that they can get ahead and have the income necessary to support their families. This loan will be used for working capital and to buy merchandise, supplies and materials to increase their sales and improve the quality of life for their families. Insofar as experience, one might mention that these members worked previously with solidarity group loans from another institution similar to the Fundación, so they know how to administer granted funds for the benefit of their businesses and in a way so as to improve the quality of life in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao K. (pictured with her daughter) is age 58, is widowed, and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has five children.

K. is engaged in a business selling Cambodian traditional cakes, earning a gross income of 2.50 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. The business is also assisted by her daughter who always helps her mother in producing cakes, thus earning an income of 1.50 USD per day. Four of K.’s children are currently employed at different workplaces to earn their own living and to support the family as well.

The family’s standard of living has been improved since K. and her daughter have had this business. K. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike for one her children to use to commute to work at the factory. This is K.’s first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for one of her children to use for commuting

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa G. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos con los cuales a realizado mejorar a su negocio. 
Solicita nuevamente apoyo en este préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta algunos acabados del interior del local y comprar mercancía. 
Pero ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario poder llevar acabos la mejora e invertir en el negocio es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para este crédito.
Planea pagar con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa G. is very grateful for the cooperation she received through her previous loans, which were used to make improvements to her business.

She is requesting a new loan to help with making some interior finishes that are lacking in her shop and to buy merchandise. Maria does not have the money necessary to carry out these improvements and invest in her business, so she is requesting your cooperation with this loan.

She plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish remodeling her shop and acquire merchandise for her business

loans.name: Yaver

texts.en: Yaver Q. is 34 years old, married and has two children. He is a trader who sells different kinds of goods such as macaroni, candy, chocolate, tea and cigarettes. Yaver has ten years' experience in this business and now is a very successful entrepreneur who knows how to manage his business for a good turnover. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more foodstuffs to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhtar is a wife of A. M. and lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She owns a small, two-roomed house where she has been living for the past 20 years.
Naseem Akhtar has three daughters, all of whom are free and do household chores. Naseem wishes to send her daughters to school so that they get a good education and have a bright future. She operates a business sewing clothes. She does this work to save money so she might be able to enrol her daughters in school.
Naseem's husband is a tailor and runs a tailoring center in the community where he specifically sews gentlemen's clothes. He has been in this profession for ten years. Naseem has successfully repaid two loans to Kiva partner, Asasah. With the profits from her loans, she bought a color television and a fridge. Now she is applying for a new loan to purchase an electric sewing machine for her husband’s tailoring center so that he can sew more clothes and increase his profit.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for her husband's business

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna T. is from Barangay Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Donna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Donna owns & operates a business preparing and selling barbecue pork and chicken for sale. Donna has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Donna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Donna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Donna is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Donna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Foresighted and affable M. Godfrey has, for the last eight years, banked on his agricultural business in Rweibane Mazinga, Bushenyi, to get by. This married 30-year-old gentleman has, with the support of this business, brought forth a change for the better in the welfare of his family of three.

This business was handed down to Godfrey by his late father. Seeing the hard work the old man had put in was some sort of hard act to follow at the beginning but, with belief and with the support of family, he got into his stride. In a week, his business brings in 30,000 a week.

With this loan, Godfrey is upbeat. He says he is going to bring change to bear in his business by paying for the mulching of his gardens and also by buying manure for his banana plantations.

loans.use: To buy manure for his plantations and to pay for mulching

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza P. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Meliza is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Meliza owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling a variety of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Meliza has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Meliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meliza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Meliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: El Sr. Justo, vive en zona radial 26 y quinto anillo,  de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, cuenta con una vagoneta propia que trabaja prestando el servicio de taxi en el area urbana, vive como casero en las oficinas de la linea de micros 40, tiene un nucleo familar que esta constituido por su hijo de unos tres años de edad, su esposa realiza la actividad de limpieza en las mencionadas oficinas que recibe una sueldo que le ayuda a los gastos que su esposo realiza en el hogar, llego a nuestra oficina por promociones que se realizo en la zona y por recomendación de algunos clientes que se tiene por esa zona, El Sr. Justo tiene la nesecidad de hace que es la de mejorar  su vehiculo y lo mas importante de cambiar las llantas del mismo para brindar seguridad y eficiencia en su trabajo, por este motivo el solicita un credito para poder comprar llantas para su automovil y brindar un mejor servicio de transporte urbano, con los ingresos que cubre su deuda y para vivir y poder ahorrar para comprarse un lote, esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Justo lives in Santa Cruz’s Radial Zone 26, Fifth Ring. He owns a van with which he provides urban taxi services. He lives as a watchman in the Microbus Line 40 offices. His nuclear family is made up of a three-year-old son and his wife is employed in the above-mentioned offices as a cleaning woman; her salary helps her husband meet household expenses. He came to our office thanks to a promotional campaign in his area and recommended by some of the clients we have in that area. Justo needs to make some improvements on his vehicle; specifically he needs to replace the tires in order to offer enhanced safety and efficiency in his work. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy tires for his car and provide better urban transportation service. His earnings will be used to repay the loan and to cover household expenses and also to save in order to buy a lot. He is very grateful for the opportunity this opens up for him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel M. is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old and is married. Joel owns and operates a business providing mechanical services like motor repair to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people and is located in K’am Samnor Leu village, Kandal province. Mrs. Chantha S., a 25-year-old married woman, has been selected as group leader of the loan by its members. All members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Chantha S. and her husband, Mr. Chork Mom, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables for a living. Mrs. Chantha S. has requested a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice and vegetables. This couple works very hard on the farm to support their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Amelia L. es socia del banco comunal La Inmaculada, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, es de  clima frió típico de la región sierra, su población se dedican en su mayor parte a la cría de animales y a la agricultura y mucha de su gente también trabaja realizando varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Doña Rosa trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos, su horario es de ocho y media de la mañana hasta las cuatro y media de la tarde, de lunes a viernes laborando desde que tenía una muy corta edad ya que solo llego a cursar la escuela. También en su casa se dedica a la cría de animales pequeños como: cuyes, gallinas y chanchos los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

La Señora. Rosa tiene  33 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.
 
Nuestra socia está en su tercer crédito, el dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es ofrecerles a sus hijos la mejor educación para que puedan llegar lejos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Amelia L. is a member of the La Inmaculada (Immaculate Conception) communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca which is part of Santa Ana parish. Its climate is cold, typical of the mountains. Most of its population raises animals and are farmers. Many of its residents work at various jobs in the city of Cuenca. Rosa works as a domestic employee from 8:30am until 4:30pm, Monday through Friday. She has worked since a very young age because she only went to primary school. She also raises small farm animals, like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs at home that she sells when needs arise. Rosa is 33 years old and a single mother of four children who are 12, 10, 8 and 6 years of age; all are in school. She does not own her own house; she lives in her mother’s house. This is her 3rd loan. She will use it to buy chickens and feed for them. Her goal is to provide her children with an education so they can go far in life.
