Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena O. is a single woman who lives in Prk. Lupni, Brgy. Hilamonan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, rice farming and retailing, and general store businesses. Magdalena joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Magdalena has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 16,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her business activities – pig fattening, rice farming and general store – so that she is able to continue to save up for future family needs and business reasons. Magdalena O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva and joining our team.

loans.use: As additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion G. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 65 years old. Asuncion is widowed. To make a living, Asuncion runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Asuncion has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Asuncion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asuncion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Asuncion is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Asuncion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina tiene 25 años, su estado civil es casada. Maria tiene 1 hijo y esta a su cargo. La actividad económica de Maria es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica en su pulpería ofrece los productos como granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa, verduras y pan y otros productos de consumo diario, durante este tiempo ha incrementado su negocio gradualmente satisfaciendo la demanda de su cliente. Los propósitos de ella son de aumentar su inventario para mantener su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Este crédito es para comprar productos de consumo diario. Sus deseos son que sus hijo pueda administrar el negocio y puedan defenderse para el día de mañana.
texts.en: Maria Cristina is 25 years old and married. She has one child in her care. Maria's economic activity is a general store. She has operated this business for more than 3 years. In her general store, she offers products such as staple foods, cosmetics, clothing, vegetables, bread and other products of daily consumption. During this time, she has gradually expanded her business to satisfy customer demand. Her goals are to increase her inventory to maintain her business and thus satisfy the demand of her customers. This loan is to buy products of daily consumption. Her desires are that her children will be able to manage the business and get by in tomorrow's world.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo es casado, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, vive en alquiler durante mucho tiempo, en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
Eduardo trabaja en un grupo de radio taxi, como chofer propietario, realizando rutas entre la ciudad de La Paz y El Alto, su esposa le ayuda preparando comida para ser vendida en un puesto que tiene. Es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para el arreglo de su movilidad comprando una nueva caja de cambios y así poder continuar trabajando sin problemas y mantener sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has three school-age children.  He has lived for a long time in rented property in the Villa Nuevo Potosí district of the city of La Paz.

Eduardo works in a radio taxi firm as an owner-driver.  He works routes between the cities of La Paz and El Alto.  His wife helps by making food to sell in a stall which she has.  This is how they earn their household income.

The loan which he is requesting is to be used to repair his vehicle, buying a new gearbox so that he can continue working without problems and maintain his income.

This is Eduardo's first loan and the socioeconomic analysis which we have conducted qualifies him favorably for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a gearbox for his taxi

loans.name: Jorge Ovidio

texts.es:
Jorge Ovidio F. tiene 58 años. Es viudo  vive con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo. 
 
Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para dejar a los hijos que sigan trabajando.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas patronales del recinto y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Ovidio F. is 58 years old. He is a widower and lives with his children. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar province. He has 5 children. 

The members of the "Unidos Somos Mas" ["Together We Are More"] communal bank work in agriculture. This rural cooperative is located 45 minutes from San Miguel, in Ríos a la Costa. All of the members live in the same area. Most of them work growing corn, wheat and potatoes. The communal bank has about 10 members. 

Jorge works in agriculture, growing corn, beans, wheat and potatoes. He makes his purchases in San Pablo parish and sells his goods at the San Pablo market. 
 
He is requesting the loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The loan will help him economically so he can cover his needs. His dream is to buy land to leave to his children who will continue to work in this area. 

He enjoys celebrating at local religious festivals and spending time with his family.

loans.use: Buying supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: C7577  Abumvikanye Group

texts.en:
Augustin is 43 and is married with five children between the ages 3 and 10.  He is the president of a group which is called Abumvikanye.

Augustin grows rice and has been doing this for 5 years.  Augustin and his group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses and to buy organic fertilizer.  Augustin would like to buy a house with any profit he makes.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda S., 37, is from the village of Laligan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing, shoes, blankets and sandals in the local community. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts and blouses. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Nora Bertha

texts.en: This member belongs to the Pro Desarrollo cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac district of the province of Calca. Her name is Nora Bertha, and she is 69 years old. Nora Bertha is married and has eight children. She plans on investing her loan in her condiments business. During the week, she will sell condiments maD. from garlic, peanut and peppers in the market of Pisac. On Thursday and Friday, she takes her business to the Pisac fair. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in the condiment business

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem Y., 42, is widowed and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. He buys and sells motorbikes, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 58 on other necessary expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike to resell. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to resell

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
In the Tuol Tnaot village in Kandal Province there are five people seeking a group loan.

Mr Sum R. is 57 years old and he is the chosen group leader. He is a Khmer who sells cakes in local villages to support his family. He would like to ask for a loan to purchase rice, coconuts, and sugars to support his business and increase his income to improve his family's standard of living.

Mr. Sum R. is a widower with three children. One is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are laborers.

loans.use: To purchase rice, coconuts, and sugar

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne K. has a garment shop selling clothes, which she has had for 5 years. She is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central Region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.

To help expand her business, Anne has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of this loan, Anne hopes to generate greater profits and cover food and basic needs.  In the future, Anne hopes to build rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es:
La señora María Flor de luz Gómez F., vive en Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México, es casada, y tiene  una hija Jais Arleth de dos años.

          El préstamo lo invirtió en el mantenimiento  de sus maquinas, como también surtir su pequeña tiendita de dulces, en donde lleva  cinco años  y  está contenta porque gracias a esta actividad está logrando ahorrar.

           Comenzó con este tipo de trabajo para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa, así juntos trabajar para logra lo que desean tener.

            Con lo que obtiene lo invierte en el mantenimiento de sus juegos de videos que es con la que se poya para tener ingresos y con ello cubrir gastos pequeños en su hogar.

           Lo que desea es que con esta actividad logre sacar adelante a su familia que es  lo más  importante para ella, como  también  comprar materiales para comenzar a construir su casa.

     los integrantes del grupo son cinco y son las siguientes:

   María F. Jiménez: ella  invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar comidas.

     Silvia Juárez Juárez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de zapatos por catalogo de la marca Andrea.

     María Flor De luz Gómez F.: invierte el préstamo en el mantenimiento de las maquinas de juego.

    Consuelo Eugenia P. F.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos por catalogo de fuler y jafra.

   Sonia López Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ropas en puebla, para luego venderlo en las comunidades cercanas.
texts.en:
Maria Flor de Luz G. F. lives in Tecpatan in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. She is married and she has a 2-year old daughter, Jais Arleth. 

The loan will be invested in the maintenance of her machines, and to stock her small candy store. She has had the store for five years and she is happy to have it because thanks to this business she has been able to save money. 

She started this type of work to contribute with her husband to the household income. They work together to obtain what they want to have. 

She invests whatever she has in the maintenance of the video games. They are a source of income and it covers the smaller household expenses.

Her wish is to be able to provide for her family with this business which is the most important thing for her. She also wants to purchase materials to start building a house.

There are five members of the group and they are the following: 

Maria F. J.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to prepare foods.

Silvia J. J.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of Andrea brand shoes by catalogue.

Maria Flor de Luz G. F.: she will invest the loan in the maintenance of her video game consoles.

Consuelo Eugenia P. F.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of Fuler and Jafra brand products by catalogue. 

Sonia L. S.: she will invest in the purchase of clothing from Puebla, to later resell in near-by communities.

loans.use: To purchase video game consoles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a room for her daughter

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 6 Group

texts.en:
Mirita leads this five-person loan group, El Buen futuro 6 (Good Future). She lives in a simple home with her long-term partner and their five children. Some of the children help the family earn a living, and Mirita devotes the earnings she makes by selling clothes to help her children grow up and lead rewarding lives. She has been in this business for four years, and opened her small company after getting some financial help from her partner. 

This group, which is typical of many in Haiti and the Dominican Republic, is located in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural areas where the economy depends on agriculture. People who live here lack reliable electricity and running water, none of which is potable. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, underwear, blouses and other items of clothing to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer C., a 25-year-old married mother of two children who are still young, lives with her family in Waunifor, located on the outskirts of Eldoret. Her husband, Isaac Bitok, runs a retail business that contributes to the family's income, while Jennifer is a maize farmer who earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

Having repaid her previous loans, Jennifer is now requesting a new one from KADET LTD in order to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer. With the additional income that will arise from the loan, she plans to buy another piece of land to expand her farming business. In the future she wants to educate her children and buy a pick-up truck to more easily transport maize to her customers.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 43 years old and lives in the area of West Point. She’s married and has a junior high education. She has three children between the ages of 16 and 25 years old. Catherine has been selling ladies and gents wear for the past six years. Her worst experience is when there’s low turnout of customers so she ends up making little sales during that time.

Catherine is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of used clothes. She hopes and prays for God's divine favor upon the lives of her children, so that their dreams will come to reality.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: I

texts.fr: Revendeuse de nourriture à Lomé, Antoinette est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée a un joueur de tennis et mère d’un enfant. Pour joindre les deux bouts de la famille elle a débuté cette activité depuis 5 ans et le fait avec beaucoup de plaisir et d’assurance. Elle est appréciée de ses clients par son accueil, sa propreté  et  ses délicieux repas.
texts.en: Antoinette is 29 years old and sells food in Lomé. She is married to a tennis player with whom she has a child. In order to meet her family's needs she set up her business 5 years ago, and very much enjoys her work. Her customers like her for her welcoming personality, her food hygiene standards and the delicious meals that she serves.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods (corn and rice)

loans.name: Delsy

texts.es: Deisy vive en el barrio el Silencio donde tiene un negocio llamado “Peluquería Deisy Estilos” donde ofrece servicios de corte de cabello, peinado y todo lo relacionado con el realce de la belleza e imagen personal de adultos y niños. Su negocio lo inició hace 8 años durante los cuales ha logrado posicionarse; ella para ganarse el mercado de clientes inició haciendo domicilios y una vez construyó su clientela,  abrió un local donde solo tenía una silla y un espejo, a los que fue agregando toda la infraestructura que hoy posee,  como muebles, enseres, producto de su notable esmero en progresar hasta ser muy exitosa. Este es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a un credikiva  con el cual comprará insumos de peluquería,  como shampoo,  rinse, masajes, y herramientas de trabajo con las cuales mejorará el servicio a sus clientes.  Su sueño más anhelado es tener su propio local y generar puestos de trabajo con el crecimiento del negocio al que ella aspira.  Deisy es una buen miembro de familia que vive con su esposo y tienen un pequeño hijo de un año, por el que ambos sueñan construirle un futuro mejor,  para que crezca con salud y el bienestar económico y social que el merece.
texts.en:
Deisy lives in El Silencio neighborhood where she has a business called "Peluquería Deisy Estilos" (Hairdressing Salon Deisy Styles).  She offers haircutting and hairdressing services and all other services related to enhancing the beauty and personal image of adults and children.  She started her business eight years ago and, over the years, she has managed to position herself in the market.  In order to gain customers, she started out doing home visits and, once she had built up her customer base, she opened premises where she only had one chair and one mirror.  She gradually added all the infrastructure that she now owns such as furniture and supplies.  All of this is the result of the great care that Deisy has put into making progress and becoming very successful.

This is Deisy's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she is applying for a Kiva loan which she will use to buy hairdressing supplies such as shampoo, rinses, massage products and work tools, with which she will improve her service to her customers.  Deisy's greatest dream is to own her own premises and create employment with the business growth she is aspiring to.  Deisy is a good family member who lives with her husband.  They have a 1 year-old son for whom they both dream of building a better future so that he grows up healthy, with the financial and social security that he deserves.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies such as shampoo, rinses, massage products and work tools

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ester works hard to support her family. 

She has a fish selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food and personal products. Ester is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. 

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. She is 40 years old, married to James, and they have five school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. She will sell the crop locally and hopes to have a good harvest.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jouanis

texts.en:
Jouanis is 45 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school. She has a business of selling timber, which she has had for 5 years.         

To help expand her business, Jouanis has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase timber for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 56 years old. He supports seven members of the family. He is married to Catherine who assists in farming in order to produce more income for the family. His children are 22, 20, 19, 16 14 and 12 years old.

He does farming and he has been in business for 26 years. Right now, his monthly income from the business is KES 7,000. He is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000, which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer.

He plans to use the anticipated income to buy broilers and to plow his land next year. This is his second loan and he successfully paid his previous loan. His dreams and hopes are to continue with his farming and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mónica Tatiana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mónica es socia del banco comunal Fuerza Trabajadora, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, también tienen una gran variedad en su gastronomía.
 
La Señorita. Mónica tiene 22 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 2 años de edad. Vive con sus padres, su papá es comerciante y su mamá labora en un restaurante de su propiedad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia es estudiante de una universidad de la ciudad, en la cual cursa su primer año de enfermería y en sus tiempos libres ayuda a su mamá a trabajar en el negocio.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en víveres, vajilla y cubiertos para el restaurante de su mamá y así crecer en el negocio familiar.
 
Su meta es llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Monica, 22, is a member of the Fuerza Trabajadora community bank.  She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca, a city named a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its beautiful architecture.  Its people maintain the area's traditional culture and traditions and the local cuisine is known for its great variety.

Monica is a single mother with a 2-year old child.  She lives with her parents.  Her father is a retailer and her mother has a restaurant business.  The house where they live is rented.  

Monica is a first-year nursing student at a university in the city.  In her spare time, she works at her mother's restaurant.  

This is Monica's third loan as a member of the community bank.  She wants to invest in her mother's restaurant and she will use the loan to buy plates, dinnerware and other supplies for what is becoming the family business.

Monica's goal is a good career.

loans.use: to buy plates, dinnerware and other supplies for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is an active 32-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with a 9-year-old child who is going to school. For the last 4 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables so as to make ends meet. Previously she sold secondhand clothes. In the next 5 years, she wants to have expanded her business and started being a distributor. Her dream is to purchase a truck for easy transport of her products. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy paw paws and bananas. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy paw paws and bananas

loans.name: Julia Ludgarda

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Vallecito Vizcachani”, ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 D. ellos son independientes.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio venta D. verduras como zanahoria, repollo, etc.  DesD. hace un ciclo trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela R..
Con éste un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará un camión D. guano para el sembrío D. verduras como repollo, hortalizas, etc.  La socia nos cuenta que trabaja sola  en el negocio,  su esposo trabaja como profesor.
Su deseo es tener una tienda D. abarrotes y así mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "Vallecito Vizcachani" communal bank, located in Puno district, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 53, married with 4 children, 3 of whom are living on their own.  She has a primary school education.  

She used her her first loan of 300 nuevo soles for her business of selling vegetables, such as carrots, cabbages etc.  She has been working for one loan cycle with Movimiento Manuela R..  She will use this new loan of 300 nuevo soles to buy a truckload of guano manure for growing cabbages and other vegetables.  

She tells us that she works on her own in the business, as her husband is a teacher.  Her wish is to have a grocery store, and in this way improve her income. What she likes about the communal bank are the easy terms, paying on time and the responsibility.

loans.use: To buy a truckload of guano manure to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and married, with one child. Josephine works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items, such as sardines, spices, eggs, oils, noodles, etc.  In the future Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Raquel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Raquel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 28 years old, married and has a five-year-old child.  To earn a living, he operates a motorbike transport business.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed two people.  Additionally, he runs a retail shop to supplement his income.  He has been able to improve his business with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya.

Dennis' desire is to expand his business in five years.  He has requested 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
Agua Viva se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, el cual trabaja con la fundación desde julio de 2011, son  15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el cuarto ciclo, en forma coordinada y de mutua ayuda en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Una de las señoras es Maria, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas en plata, comenta que gracias a su amabilidad y habilidad para las ventas ha logrado formarse una clientela bien definida. Por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y a su hogar. Ya que le va muy bien quiere seguir con dicho negocio y por lo mismo solicita el crédito, para que mediante el pueda comprar más variedad de joyas, para que de esa forma pueda atraer a más clientes.
Ella al igual que sus amigas del comité, está muy contenta por la oportunidad que Kiva y la fundación les da.
texts.en:
“Agua Viva” is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Itá which has been working with the Fundación since July, 2011.  It’s a group of 15 women who are working in their fourth cycle already in a coordinated, mutually supportive fashion in the Fundación’s enterprising women program.

One of the women is María who sells silver jewelry.  She comments that thanks to her kindness and sales abilities she’s attained a well-defined clientele.  Through this work she’s been able to support her family and her household.  

Since she’s doing so well, she’d like to continue with the business so is asking for a loan to buy a larger variety of jewelry so that she can attract more customers this way.  She, as well as her other group members, is very happy for the opportunity Kiva and the Fundación gives them.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married woman and who is a responsible and hardworking mother of her kids. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community. 

Flordeliza is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy different products for her store such as such as soap, snack foods, shampoo, and spices. In the future, she wishes that her dreams come true to so that she can meet the needs of her family and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, shampoo, soap, and spices for her store

loans.name: Rawelgboudou Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA  est la représentante du groupe RAWELGBOUDOU. Elle est mariée  et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Tous vont à l’école. Elle a 08 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des gâteaux et bonbons  depuis 10ans. Elle est représentée sur la photo par la trésorière du groupe. Elle s’approvisionne à  Sankar yaar en ville .Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac  de farine de blé, 03kg de sucre, 01 paquet de levure, 01kg de bicarbonate, 01 bidon d’huile pour la fabrication du gâteau et 01 carton de bonbons.

 Avec ses bénéfices, elle assure la scolarité de ses enfants  et augmente son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique et arriver à épargner.
texts.en:
Rasmata is the representative of the group RAWELGBOUDOU. She is married and the mother of four children, ranging in age from 6 to 17 years old. All of her children attend school. She is responsible for 8 people. 

She has been selling cakes and candies for 10 years. She is represented in the photo by the treasurer of the group. She buys her supplies from the Sankar "yaar" [street market] in town. Her customers are both men and women. 

She would like to buy a sack of wheat flour, 3 kg of sugar, a packet of yeast, 1 kg of baking soda and 1 jug of oil to make cake along with a box of candies. 

With her earnings she provides schooling for her children and increases her business activity. She dreams of opening a store and being able to save money.

loans.use: to buy a sac of flour, 3 kg of sugar, a packet of yeast, 1 kg of baking soda, and 1 jug of oil for making cake and 1 box of candies

loans.name: Mbakara Group

texts.en:
Benard is the facilitator of the Mbakara group. Benard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benard takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Benard had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benard was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Benard will save for the future
.
In 2012, the members of Mbakara group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 47-year-old businessman who is married to Monica, a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been selling shoes for the past two years with a monthly income of 10,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. David will use the loan to buy new shoes to add to his shop and capitalize on the profits during the boom for the Christmas season. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future and get more profits which will take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy new shoes to add to his shop.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: La Sra. María, tiene 30 años y es soltera con 1 hijo de 11 años.  La señora se dedica al Servicio de Peluquería, que se encuentra en el Zona San José Obrero.  Trabaja de lunes a domingo. Este es su primer préstamo,  María va a usar este préstamo para compra de un sillón lava cabeza y otros enseres, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para hacer crecer su negocio. María demuestra ser responsable y muy trabajadora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de herramientas de trabajo, va a utilizar los beneficios en construcción de un cuarto, su sueño de la señora es instalar una sucursal  de su negocio y esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida mediante el crédito otorgado.
texts.en: Maria is 30 years old, single, and has an 11 year-old child.  She has a beauty salon that is located 	in the San Jose Obrero neighborhood where she works every day.  This is her first loan.  Maria will use this loan to buy a shampoo chair and other equipment.  She is requesting this loan because she wants to make her business grow.  Maria has proved to be responsible and very hardworking; she faces challenges in her business such as the lack of work tools.  She will use her profits to build a room.  Maria's dream is to open another salon.  She is very grateful to EMPRENDER for their trust in her, and for giving her the opportunity to improve her life through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a shampoo chair and other equipment for her salon

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda   is a 27-year-old business lady who owns a grocery store in Mshomoroni Mombasa. She is married. She has been doing this business for the last eight years and she is doing great. She was recently introduced to KADET and this marks her first loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase more potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes for sale. She will use the proceeds from the business to repay her loan and expand her business even further. 
She hopes to realize more profits as a result of  the business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is age 28 years. She is married and has three children between 10 months and 4 years old. None of her children attends school. 

Olive owns a boutique that she has been running for the past three years. 

With the loan she will buy more items such as sugar, salt and cooking oil. She expects to use the profits for savings. 

In the future, Olive dreams of owning a booming shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir is a married father of two young children, eight and one year old. The loan that he is requesting for the first time is an amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek; he wants to buy fodder for the animals with it. He and his family live in rural south central Albania and the only activity he has been involved in, has been livestock and a little bit of planting/selling veggies to the local market.

Fatmir’s income hasn’t been at the level where it should be, and being selected as a beneficiary of the integrated loans, he is thrilled. He hopes that their living conditions will improve and his children’s life will be better soon.

loans.use: To buy fodder for the animals

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen  is a widow woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nasreen  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 50000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.  She hopes to get increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is married with 5 children.

She joined SPBD in 2004 and used her first loan to make icy poles. With her subsequent loans she started a small general store which she has built from there. On her last loan she also started a BBQ which she carries out beside her shop on Fridays and Saturdays.

She is the leader of her village loan group and is known for being very tough in enforcing the group guarantee.

loans.use: Stock for the shop and home improvement

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Ramona. I run a small family hamburger restaurant called Paraiso de la Amburguesas (Hamburger Paradise). Thanks to this business, my husband and I have been able to improve the quality of life for our children. Our product is quite popular in, and because the demand is growing we need more capital to be able to satisfy our clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Ramona, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de hamburguesas llamado Paraiso de la Amburguesas, gracias a este negocio mi esposo y yo emos sacado adelanate a nuestros hijos ya que nuestro producto tiene mucha aceptación en esta ciudad, en vista que la demanda ha crecido necesitamos mayor capital para poder satisfacer a nuestros cliente.

loans.use: Buy ground beef, bread, mayonnaise, mustard, vegetables and various condiments.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth F. J. is a single mother who raises her daughter Elizabeth (7) and provides for her by selling traditional Dominican snacks from her store in Teson, Samana. She sells popular items like empanadas, sandwiches, fried plantains, juices and soda. Elizabeth F.’s store is right next to a discoteca one of many typical dancing clubs throughout the Dominican Republic that feature cultural music like Merengue and Bachata. Weekend nights are her peak hours for sales as locals flood the discoteca next door. With this loan she will be able to buy bread, meats, cheese, flour and fruit. Elizabeth has named her store Cafeteria de Amistad but is saving up for the paint and wood for a sign to make it official.

NOTE: Elizabeth is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group. She and her business represent four other microentrepreneurs who are members of the same solidarity group who will all receive a share of this $750 loan to develop their respective businesses. Elizabeth and the other members are accountable to each other to repay this loan together.

loans.use: Purchase fruit, bread, meats, cheese and flour

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nicolasa Giménez D. P. is 39. She is married and has 2 sons, 16 and 17. Her husband, Antonio Pintos, runs a convenience store from their home. He was forced to retire early because of a heart and lung condition he developed on the job at a Yerba Mate company (Indega). Seven years ago, he decided to use his retirement money to open a convenience store in his home. Their two sons, who are currently studying at a school nearby, come home in the afternoons and help out at the store.

Nicolasa works outsiD. the house in a busy section of the city. She sells lottery tickets, quiniela tickets (a very popular game of luck in Paraguay), bingo tickets, and so on. Her stand is in a key location next to 2 clinics, next to the city’s main park, and near the city’s municipal center.

Both the convenience store and her lottery stand have a loyal clientele, so business is good. The convenience store is the only one in the neighborhood and one of the biggest in the city.

They would use the loan to restock their store. Also, they would use part of money to build a new wall around their residence for increased security.

loans.use: To restock and build a wall in their residential convenience store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz E. is a 45 years-old mother of four children. She is a hard working woman and her dreams of having a better life made her start working when she was only 15 years old. She started working by selling the following: stuffed potatoes, hamburgers, fruits, and other products. Once she started her family, she decided eighteen years ago to start her own small store in order to generate a stable source of income that would support her family. Beatriz starts work at five in the morning and hopes for the loan to improve and to expand her store. The income her husband makes as a mechanic does not cover the tuition costs for the higher education of her children. In order to complete her objectives, she needs $500 dollars to invest into her store’s expansion. She promises that her business will pay back the loan in a six-month period. With your support and generosity Beatriz and her family improve their lives. Believe in her because she will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Beatriz E. de 45 años es madre de 4 hijos su capacidad emprendedora y sus inmensos deseos de superación hicieron que empezara a trabajar a los 15 años vendiendo papa rellena, hamburguesas, frutas, entre otros productos; con el tiempo y una vez formada su familia hace más de 18 años decidió abrir su bodeguita con el fin de generar ingresos económicos más estables y sustanciales para su hogar..Beatriz empieza a trabajar desde las 5:00 de la mañana y desea el préstamo para implementar y ampliar su pequeña bodeguita, puesto que los ingresos de su esposo como mecánico es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de estudios superiores de sus hijos.Para cumplir con sus objetivos solicita 500 dólares que podrá invertir en la bodega para ampliar e implementar su negocio ella promete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Con tu apoyo y generosidad Beatriz puede salir adelante confía en ella, no te defraudará

loans.use: To buy more merchandise so that each and every one of her customers will receive better service and have more options when shopping at her store.

loans.name: Luci Natalia

texts.es:
In Pichanaki you will find very beautiful and eye-catching handbags that have been in high demand among tourists in the city. They are the work of Lucila C., a woman that pours her creativity and effort into every work. These bags are so popular that selling them has become a huge business; for this reason, she has decided to try to export them. However, she knows that realizing this dream requires greater investment and production, as well as improved quality of her materials, and all of this has put her dream on hold in the past. Through hard work and ambition she would like to continue supporting her children after a terrible separation. This is why she is asking for kind people to fund her projects and dreams with a loan. She will use it to carry out her plans and reach her goal of continuing to proviD. for her family. Help this entrepreneur keep moving forward and begin exporting her products.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

En Pichanaki podemos encontrar unas bolsas muy llamativas y hermosas, que son muy apreciadas y demandadas por los turistas que constantemente visitan la ciudad, esta realidad es gracias a que Lucila C., pone en cada creación suya todo su arte y esfuerzo.Estos bolsos tan apreciados se han convertido en su gran negocio por lo que se ha propuesto la meta D. exportarlos, sin embargó para que este sueño se haga realidad requiere D. una mayor inversión y productividad; también una mejora en la calidad D. los materiales e insumos. Todo esto ha frenado muchas veces este anhelo en ella. Con su esfuerzo e ímpetu diario desea seguir apoyando a los pequeños que se quedaron con ella luego D. una terrible y penosa separación.Es por ello que solicita el apoyo D. corazones afables para financiar sus proyectos y sueños, a través D. un préstamo, con los que realizará esto planes con la meta D. seguir siendo el sostén D. su hogar.Ayudemos a una dama emprendedora y apoyémosla a seguir adelante y a exportar sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue making beautiful handbags.

loans.name: Zoharan

texts.en: I am a widow with nine children: seven sons and two daughters. My children had to quit their studies at very early ages due to the financial repercussions we had to face after their father’s death. But all of my sons did not lose heart and worked very hard to earn a better living for themselves.  My daughters are married and are happy with their families. Two of my sons together run a food stall in one of the more crowded markets of the city. They are able to make a profit of $400 a month. They posses a strong client base and now they want to add few more items to their restaurant for which they require a loan of $500

loans.use: Expand food stall

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 30 years old and married with 5 children. Fatmata’s business supports her family’s expenses. With her previous loans from SMT, Fatmata has expanded her business and established a selling space in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Before the loans, Fatmata used to hawk from village to village with only one or two dozen plastic sandals.

She would like to expand her business and also construct a better place for the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $525.

loans.use: She would like to expand her selection of plastic sandals for sale to generate additional revenue for her business

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Dilorom K. is a resident of Tursun-zoda. She is 28 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a high school degree. Dilorom is planing to use the loan to purchase a milk cow. This loan will allow her to provide cheap milk for her family and sell milk to the locals, thus improving the financial situation of the family. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Курбоналиева Дилором Жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 28 лет, замужем имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Планируемый кредит хочет использовать на приобретение дойной коровы для того чтобы получать молоко для своей семьи и на продажу, что поможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.Кредит планирует погасить в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a business owner from Kahovka, Ukraine, living in the central part of the country. She sells a selection of dry-goods grocery items at an outdoor market in Kahovka. Alla is an experienced entrepreneur having been in business for ten years. She enjoys her work and the opportunity to help provide for her family. Alla is married and has a fourteen year old daughter. Her typical monthly income is around $400.

Alla has requested a short term loan of $400 to help purchase some new inventory. She experiences high inventory turnover rates with her grocery business. This loan will help her purchase additional food items and allow her to continue earning a good income.

loans.use: Purchase new grocery inventory

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly and her husband started one year ago a business selling weight-management products from a well known brand. They grew little by little until they could open a store where to sell the products and where they also train new sellers.

This has become their full-time employment and they work hard everyday to improve their quality of life, especially for their 4 year old daughter.

They plan is to invest in more merchandise and later on open another store.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Magaly y sus esposo desde hace un año emprendieron el negocio de vender productos reductores de peso de una reconocida marca mundial. Ellos dedican todo su tiempo a esto. Poco a poco han ido creciendo hasta que lograron abrir un club de estos productos que funciona como tienda de estos productos y a la vez como capacitadores para nuevos vendedores. Ambos se esfuerzan día a día para poder surgir y llevar una mejor vida, no solo por ellos sino por su hija que tiene cuatro años. Sus planes para un futuro es invertir más en su mercadería y abrir más adelante otro club-tienda.

loans.use: To buy more weight-management products

loans.name: Norah

texts.es:
Norah and her two children live with her in-laws’. Norah sells clothing and has seven years of experience in the retail sector. Her husband works in the city of Cochabamba as a locksmith. The competition in the clothing market is high and Norah depends on the orders placed by her clients. Norah travels to different places in order to buy wholesale clothing articles, she sells to other smaller retailers who are her clients. The loan Norah is requesting is to purchase more clothes to increase her capital and merchandise. The price of the items she sells is between 70 to 85 Bolivians. Norah currently has another loan at a third financial institution and in Agrocapital she counts with 5 years of good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Norah es una señora que vive en la casa de sus suegros y vive con sus dos hijitos. Norah se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene una experiencia de 7 años en este negocio, por otra parte su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Cochabamba como cerrajero. La competencia en el mercado es elevada y depende mucho de los pedidos de la clientela por los diferentes productos que ofrece Norah, ella viaja a diferentes lugares donde la ropa llega al por mayor y posteriormente la vende a las minoristas por lo que no cuenta con un puesto fijo de venta, se rije exclusivamente a los pedidos de las mismas. Con el presente crédito comprará ropa para aumentar su capital y mercadería, el precio de las prendas que trae varían entre 70 a 85 Bolivianos. Norah tiene actualmente otro crédito en una tercera institución financiera y en Agrocapital cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años con un comportamiento crediticio bueno.

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif A. is a 52-year-old man who breeds sheep in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region and who has more than 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and has four children. Arif applied for $1200 US to purchase 20 sheep. This will help to improve his life condition because summer is a good time to increase his income. It is the high season for wedding parties in Azerbaijan and mutton as the main meal is very popular.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo H. and her husband are both farmers who live in Prasat Village in Kampong Thom Province. They have four children of which two of whom are married. One is currently single and working as a garment factory worker. Mrs. H. is asking for a loan to purchase a pump machine for her farming business. The loan will allow them improve their farming business and raise their family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a pump machine to use for farming business

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira A. is 25 years old and married with a two-year-old child. She has been a bread seller since 2006 and works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. She can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Subira has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bread for her business.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying more bread to sell

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya G. R. is a wife of G. R. and lives in Kasur city, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 17 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Suraiya baji's husband is a daily wage laborer, while she has a business selling clothing and bangles. She collects materials from various places and sells them in Kasur. She has been in this profession for the last four years and is applying for a loan to buy additional bangles and clothing to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zareena R. M. and Najma Z. A. each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Safia M. Umar wants a loan to buy mason tools for her husband. Zubaida M. Bota wants a loan to buy clothing to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and bangles to resell

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. She sells frozen foods and started this business in 2002. She and her family live in Lagos State, Nigeria. 

Bola opens her shop at 8:00am and closes by 6:00pm daily. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their kind hearts.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Rosa Nieves

texts.en:
Rosa Nieves R. F. is a member of community bank, Renacer, which means “rebirth” in Spanish. She has a stand at the market where she sells grains and dried goods.

She works daily at the market and will invest her loan of 2000 soles into her business by purchasing oatmeals, grains, flour and cereals. She is currently saving for the future when she finds herself unable to work because of old age.

loans.use: Purchase oatmeals, grains, flour and cereals.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Нурова Ханифа проживает в городе Вахдат. Домохозяйка , замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Имеет корову, молоко которой продает. Хочет получить кредит и купить еще одну дойную корову. Таким образом количество получаемого молока увеличится и она сможет получить больший доход от его продажи. Этьим  ее жизнь станет легче. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hanifa N. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is married, has three children and is a housewife. She has a secondary education. She practices animal husbandry, and sells the milk her cow gives. She would like to use a loan to buy another dairy cow. This will increase milk production so she can sell more and make a higher income. This will make her life easier. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Esam

texts.en:
Esam is a 21-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. He is a hairdresser, but he also owns a clothing shop. He notes that he decided to go into this line of business because of his experience in women's affairs.

Esam is now requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 via Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional beauty products

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn P. is a widow in Kdey Tnaut village in Takeo province. She makes Khmer cake and sells it for a little money in order to support her family. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. 

On her plantation, she faces an obstacle, because she has an ox that cannot plow her field. In order to plow the rice field, Mrs. Vorn P. decided to request a loan to buy an ox to use with to the old one for plowing.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing.

loans.name: Samuon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samuon P. is a 53-year-old widow. She sells firewood. She has two children, one of whom is a driver while the other is a firewood seller who helps her with her firewood selling business. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more firewood to earn more profits. In addition to this career, she is a Khmer noodle seller. Mrs. Samuon P. is the group leader of four members who live together in Anduong Preng village.

One member in this group is receiving an end-of-term loan while the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchasing more firewood to earn more profits.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy S. is thirty-seven years old. She is married with three children. Lucy is resourceful and enterprising. She has supported three children to graduate from high school through her business. She operates a restaurant and sells local dishes like “fufu” and “banku”. Fufu is prepared from cooked pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains (corn dough) and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. 

Lucy says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditure. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Lucy is a member of a group called “Miracle” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs: meat, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Isabel es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Isabel viaja a diferentes ferias en donde compra animales que luego beneficia  en el camal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, luego los comercializa por mayor. Isabel además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, y ganado porcino.
Isabel sueña con salir adelante con sus hijos y ahorrar lo suficiente para tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of Lirio ('Iris') community bank. She is 33-years old and married with three children. Isabel travels to different markets where she buys animals to take to the slaugherhouse in Ayacucho city. She then sells the meat wholesale. Isabel also runs a grocery store from her house. Isabel needs a loan of 2,000 PEN that will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, and pigs. Her dream is for her and her children to get ahead in life and save enough money to have their own resources.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, and pigs.

loans.name: Angela Vda De

texts.es: La familia de Ángela se compone de sus 6 hijos que tienen: 22, 18, 16, 10, 6 y 4 años de edad respectivamente, con domicilio propio en minero barrio oriental. Su negocio esta ubicado sobre la Av. Principal de la localidad donde vende comidas y cervezas, es competitivo a su entorno pero por los años de antigüedad y experiencia en la zona tiene mucha demanda en sus productos. El destino de crédito es para capital de operación (ampliación de su negocio),  tiene un excelente  comportamiento con nuestra institución. No tiene deudas directas con otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
Ángela’s family is comprised of her 6 children who are 22, 18, 16, 10, 6 and 4 years of age, respectively. She has her own home in the eastern mining neighborhood. Her business is located on a primary street where she sells food and beer. It is a competitive environment but, given her years in business and her experience in the area, she enjoys a great demand for her products. The loan funds will be destined for operating capital (expanding her business), and she has an excellent history with our institution. She doesn’t have any direct debt with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Winner Plus Group

texts.fr: Faty B. a été initiée dans son affaire par son mari depuis 1996. Elle vend des pièces de rechange auto qu’elle achète au port de Matadi dans la province du Bas-Congo au sud-ouest de la RDC. Elle a acquit une expérience solide en vente et en bonne gestion de son activité. Elle est connue par des chauffeurs et mécaniciens de Kinshasa qui lui font beaucoup de confiance à cause de la qualité de ses services et surtout des pièces d'une meilleure qualité qu’elle leur vend. Son affaire a connu une baisse en 1997 à cause de l’instabilité politique. Elle a reprit et prospéré de 2000 jusqu’à ce jour. Faty totalise aujourd’hui un capital propre de plus de $500. Elle vend à Matonge qui est le milieu le plus connu et fréquenté de Kinshasa. Elle aime son affaire car elle est rentable et lui donne l’occasion faire beaucoup de connaissances. Elle a 31 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants dont leurs âges varient de 4 à 8 ans et deux seulement vont à l’école. Faty rêve devenir un jour une importatrice des pièces d’auto directement de l’occident.
texts.en:
Faty B. was introduced to her work by her husband in 1996. She sells automobile parts that she buys as the Matadi port in the province of Bas-Congo in the southwest of the DRC. She acquired solid experience in sales and in the good managing of her business. She is known by drivers and mechanics of Kinshasa who trust her a great deal for quality service and especially for the better quality goods she sells them.

Faty experienced a drop in business in 1997 due to political instability. She began again in 2000 and has prospered through today. She now has capital amounting to over $500. She makes her sales in Matonge, which is the best known and busiest place in Kinshasa. She likes her business because it's profitable and provides the chance for her to meet a lot of people.

She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who vary in age from 4 to 8. Only two of them go to school. Faty dreams one day of becoming an importer of auto parts directly from the West.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy automobile parts

loans.name: Elen

texts.en:
Elen B., at 35, helps her husband through selling cellphone accessories. Elen saw the demand for these products so she wanted to pursue it and make it a profitable business. As for her current business status it’s quite improved but she doesn't have the resources to maximize profit.

With this in mind, she wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new designs and fashionable cellphone accessories. According to Elen, if given the chance to excel in this business, she desires to have not only a store for cellphone accessories but to have a cellphone repair shop as well.

loans.use: To purchase new designs and fashionable cellphone accessories

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu I. is a married Tanzanian woman and small business owner. She owns and operates two separate types of business in Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. First, she runs a beauty salon. Secondly, she sells both fried and fresh fish at Buguruni.

Tatu purchases her salon products from the beauty salon shops at the Kariakoo city shopping center. She buys her fish from the Ferry fish market, direct from the fishermen.

She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more goods for both her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more business goods for her salon and fish-selling businesses

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en:
Kheoun C. Serey, 40, has produced rice wine and raised pigs at her house since 1990. She makes about $9 per day. Kheoun and her husband have three school-aged children. He is employed as an officer of a government department involving water supplies in Battambong Province. He has an income of $4 per day.

To improve their standard of living, Kheoun needs a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike and pigs. The motorbike will help her transport her rice-wine directly to customers on time and fast.

loans.use: Buying motorbike and pigs.

loans.name: Gerardo Santiago

texts.es: Don Gerardo R. cuenta con 25 años de edad, es Casado de oficios en servicios, “Asesor de Créditos para vivienda” habita junto a su esposa y su hijo,  lleva 1 año laborando en la Asociación  su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,   por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de sufragar los gastos, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo R. is a 25-year-old married man who works as a mortgage loan officer. He has been working with the association for a year. He lives with his wife and son in the Xetinimit hamlet of the Nimasac village, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. He now turns to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan, intending to defray medical costs and hoping to be able to help his son get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos medicos

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita S. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 53 years old. Conchita is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr: Firmine est née le 10/10/1980 à Dangbo au Sud du Bénin. Firmine est mariée à Amigo François, un frigoriste. Firmine et François ont quatre enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Firmine et sa famille vivent depuis quinze ans à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Firmine supporte les charges de la famille ensemble avec son mari. Firmine n’est jamais allée à l’école. C’est des divers (boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons, les piles, les bougies, les produits pour le thé, des beurres, des papiers hygiéniques, des mayonnaises, des insecticides, de laits et crèmes corporels, des produits pour les cheveux, pâtes dentifrices, du riz en sac de cinq kilogrammes et des céréales, etc.) que Firmine vend chez elle à domicile depuis sept ans. Et c’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Firmine achète ses articles. Firmine est à son cinquième crédit avec ALIDé et Firmine est un bon client qui rembourse très bien. Les crédits d’ALIDé ont permis à Firmine d’améliorer le niveau de son activité ainsi que sa vie et celle de sa famille. Firmine sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Firmine was born on 10 October 1980 in Dangbo, in southern Benin. Firmine is married to Amigo François, a refrigeration technician. Firmine and François have four children in their care, all of whom are in school. Firmine and her family have lived in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin, for fifteen years. Firmine provides for her family together with her husband. Firmine never went to school. Firmine has been selling various products (cartons of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, food pastes, soap, batteries, candles, tea products, butter, toilet paper, mayonnaise, insecticides, body creams and lotions, hair products, toothpaste, 5-kg bags of rice, cereals, etc.) at home for seven years. And it is at Dantokpa, the grand international market in Benin, that Firmine buys these items. Firmine is seeking her fifth loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and she is a good client who repays her loans well. Her previous loans through ALIDÉ have allowed Firmine to improve the level of her business as well as her life and that of her family. Firmine is seeking this loan to strengthen her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans of tomatoes, sugar, food pastes, toilet paper, body creams and lotions, toothpaste, oil stove wicks, yarn for weaving, and bags of rice, beans and manioc flour.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa B. S. , tiene la edad de 48 años , habita en el barrio Los Martínez , ubicado en el municipio de La Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos ya todos independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar una pulpería que tiene y por ende las condiciones de vida , doña Rosa desde hace 26 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su papá , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es mejorar la producción . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder seguir adelante con el cultivo. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo en estos diez ciclo el cual ha logrado hacer mejoras en su casa y en sus siembras.
texts.en:
Rosa B. S. is 48 years old and lives in the Los Martínez neighborhood, located in the municipality of La Concepción. She lives with her husband, who works and helps with household activities. They have three children, all of which are now independent of them. Her plans for her family are to improve a grocery store that they have and, as a result, improve their living conditions. Rosa has worked in agriculture for the past 26 years. The biggest difficulty for her is the lack of financing. She began working in agriculture with the support of her father. Her future plan for her crops is to improve the yield. With this loan, Rosa will purchase fertilizers and supplies to be able to improve her crops. She thanks the lending institution for their support in these ten loan cycles, as it has helped her to make housing improvements and improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to be able to improve her crop yield

loans.name: Gila

texts.en:
Gila G. is currently in the business of selling maize and sorghum and is requesting a loan to purchase more maize to sell.

Gila is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business by purchasing fish, beans and many other items to sell in order to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase maize flour to sell

loans.name: Nasimkhon

texts.en:
F. Nasimkhon is 44 years old. He lives in Isfara town. He is married and has 4 children. Nasimkhon processes and sells dried apricots in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making dried apricots. He purchases dried fruits in the market and processes them together with the help of his wife and his sons.

Because he buys dried apricots wholesale, Nasimkhon's prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for customers of different means. All this allows Nasimkhon to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for the family.

Today Nasimkhon requests 1300 USD for purchasing dried apricots to process and sell. Nasimkhon expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchasing more dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. sells charcoal. She started her business in 2004 when she was just 19 years old. By then, she was already a wife and a mother. Her business is located in Manyatta, Kisumu, Kenya. It is doing well and she wants to expand it, because it’s a lucrative venture for a family income.
