She is currently a mother of four and her future plan is to go into rental business. Her charcoal business is her first step. She says the rental houses will guarantee school fees for her children. Elizabeth wants a loan of KShs. 10,000 that she will use to purchase more stock.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhoeun L. lives in Khloung Thvea village in Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder in the local village. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it and is asking for a loan to buy more chicken and food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Tum Chanthy, is a garment factory worker. Mrs. Sokhoeun L. is a mother of three children who all stay at home. Her husband is pictured on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and food for breeding.

loans.name: Bekmurot

texts.en: A. Bekmurot is married, has eight children, and is a farmer. Not fortunate enough to attend school, he very early on embraced working in the fields. Due to this work, he is somehow meeting the needs of his large family. His wife and elder sons also help to support their household with his business. Today, exhausted from crude farming methods, Bekmurot brings in less and less income, which has a negative impact on his household. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to augment his crop yields. All of this will then allow him to increase his income and improve his family’s standard of living, especially his dearest children for the sake of whom he is working hard. The well being of Bekmurot’s family and his business are in your hands. Bekmurot and his family are sincerely grateful for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and increase the amount of arable land she has

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B., from the village of Pandan, Mambajao Camiguin Province, is 47 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marina sells eggs and sometimes longganiza (sausage) in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is now requesting a new loan, her second, of 6000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Marina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech S., 31 years old, has been married for a long time to Mr. Bunthoeun, who is with her in the photo and is a generator repairman in the garment factory. This couple has a young child who attends school and is dependent on them.

To earn a living, Pech S. always leaves home to work sewing clothes in the garment industry and normally makes a salary of $100 each month which she uses to serve her family’s daily food needs.

Pech S. faces difficulty traveling to her work location and she usually takes a taxi or walks to work. Because of that, she is applying for a loan in order to purchase a used motorcycle which will enable her to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to ride to work

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mr. Eang P. is a villager in Angk village in Kandal province. He is 36 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Saram Sarun, are farmers who own two hectares of land where they grow rice for their family income. On this land, they face some problems because the field has infertile soil. Also, it is far from an irrigation system, so there is never enough water to support their crop. They do not have enough money to solve these problems. 

Thus, Mr. Eang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and fuel to help their field increase its rice production. He is the father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local primary school while the other is too young to study or work. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel to help increase rice production.

loans.name: Brillantes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Brillantes, inicia su octavo ciclo con 19 socias. Las socias son de la comunidad de Mollepata.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes en general, cereales, leña, helados, comidas, cosméticos, artículos de ferretería.

Como es el caso de la señora Edith que es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Edith tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, Edith necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.

Mientras que Delia es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Delia se dedica a la compra y venta de leña en su casa y también reparte a los negocios, Delia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 14,350 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leña, aceite, verduras, cereales, helados, cosméticos.

Los sueños de las socias son construir sus viviendas con material noble, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Brillantes Communal Bank is starting its eighth loan cycle with 19 members who are from the community of Mollepata. They are involved in different businesses selling groceries, grain, firewood, ice cream, prepared food, cosmetics, and hardware.

Such is the case of Sra. Edith. She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Edith has a grocery store in her home that she manages every day. She needs a loan of 600 soles in order to buy rice and sugar.

Delia is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She buys and sells firewood from her home and also delivers her product to businesses. Delia needs a loan of 900 soles in order to acquire more firewood.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles, with a grand total of 14,350 soles for the entire Communal Bank. Their loans will be used to buy products such as rice, sugar, firewood, oil, vegetables, grain, ice cream, and cosmetics. They dream of building homes of solid materials, expanding their businesses, and helping their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Bukky

texts.en:
Bukky is a beautiful and hardworking woman. She sells sarongs and clothes at retail prices to her customers, selling daily to make her business sustainable. Her customers are usually friends and residents. She hopes to own an African boutique in the future where she will sell only African fabrics.

Bukky hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and clothes to sell. She is itching for business expansion.

Bukky is 32 years old and married with two children. Her husband sells building materials to also support their home. Her eldest child is 9 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. She duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel C. es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos pequeños bajo su responsabilidad y a quines les quiere dar lo mejor.
A su vivienda le está haciendo falta un cuarto mas pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para empezar la construcción de la recamara que será para sus hijos. 
Doña Isabel trabaja de limpieza en una casa particular, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Isabel C. is a single mother with two small children in her care, and she wants to provide them with the best she can. Her house needs one more room, but she does not have the necessary funds to begin constructing this space, which will be for her children. Isabel works as a cleaner in a private home, and she plans to repay the loan with this income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding on to the front of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a car to provide taxi services

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people from Sleng Kong village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan. Mrs. Phally C. was selected as village bank president by all the group members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her children and husband, Mr. Sok C. Lai. He is a construction worker earning a small salary for supporting his family. Now they are having difficult living circumstances because their house does not have a lavatory to use. So, Mrs. Phally C. has decided to request a loan to construct a lavatory to use. She is mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To construct a lavatory to use.

loans.name: Judylee

texts.en: Judylee owns a ½ hectare rice field, three pigs and also a small sari-sari store. She also raises some chickens. Having three children who go to school, Judylee does her best to help her husband provide for their family’s needs and send their children to school. She joined CEVI in 2008 to gain financial support for her businesses. She says that CEVI's program is really helpful to entrepreneurs like her. She also likes its insurance program. She recently applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). If granted, she will use it to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. She will also buy feed for the pigs and chickens and also add merchandise to the sari-sari store.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies, feed and additional merchandise

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is widowed. She owns a retail business selling various agricultural products like seeds, fertilizers, bug killers, etc. Tatyana has a large assortment of products, affordable prices and a good reputation at the market. She has many repeat clients who buy items from her to use on their gardens.

Tatyana has been in this business for 17 years. The business is seasonal and items sell mostly in spring and summer. In this particular area, many people grow a lot of vegetables, so Tatyana's business is very useful to them.

Tatyana would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories like seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to develop her business even more and have more clients who would use her services.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane B. is from the village of Parabba, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 5 young children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22000 PHP from ASKI. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Javzansuren

texts.en: Javzansuren D. is 48 years old and lives with her four children in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Javzansuren operates a clothes making business in her town where she not only sews the traditional Mongolian style clothing, but she also sews European style clothing. She started her own business in 2006 with working capital of 3000,000 MNT and now it has reached 2,000,000 MNT.  Because she has gained a lot of experience, she knows what her customers want and how much they are willing to pay for her quality clothing. Janzansuren is a friendly, generous and hardworking woman who wants to enlarge her business. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics

loans.name: Liezl Vannesa

texts.en:
Liezl Vannesa L. is from the village of Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 24 years old. Liezl Vannesa is single. To make a living, Liezl Vannesa owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothes, shoes and stuffed toys in the local community. Liezl Vannesa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Liezl Vannesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezl Vannesa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Liezl Vannesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr:
-Madame Marieme N.  est une  dame qui habite dans la localité  de  Ouakam. Elle est âgée de  34 ans  et  est mère  de 4 enfants. Madame N.  pratique l’activité  de commerce depuis 1996. Et depuis 10 ans elle s’adonne à la vente de fruits, biscuits, jus, crème  et divers  autres produits alimentaires. 
Elle est membre de la caisse de  Ouakam depuis 7 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs dans le but d’acheter un réfrigérateur  pour le démarrage  d’une nouvelle activité  de vente de poulets de chair. Dans l’optique d’une diversification de ses activités  et d’un  accroissement de ses revenus  madame Marieme N.  souhaite mieux développer  son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marieme N. is a woman who lives in the town of Ouakam. She is 34 years old and the mother of 4 children. Mrs. N. has run her business since 1996. For 10 years she has devoted herself to the sale of fruits, biscuits, juice, cream and various other food products. She has been a member of the Ouakam fund for 7 years. She is asking for a loan of 200,000 frs in order to buy a refrigerator to start up a new business selling chicken meat. In view of the diversification of her business and a growth of her profits, Mrs. Mariem N. wishes to better develop her store.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fund Increase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home, such as: cement, sand, gravel, stones, etc.

loans.name: Harm

texts.en:
To earn a good living for her family, Harm B. started a job selling cakes from her home. Normally, she goes to the market where she buys essential ingredients, mixes them together, and fries them in oil to sell to her nearby neighbors. 

Harm B. is a single mother who has given birth to three children, all three of whom are employed at different occupations. Harm B. dreams of having a place to distill wine for additional revenue, but her dreams have not come true because of lack of funds. To achieve her goal, Harm B. has requested a loan in order to build a wine-distilling set-up.

loans.use: To build a wine-distilling set-up

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 14 años y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Catalina es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos que estudia, Catalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su hija.
Catalina solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo y leche.
Los sueños de Catalina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Catalina has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, for 14 years. What she enjoys most are the training workshops and the savings incentives. Catalina lives with her life partner and she has three children in school. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells vegetables, fruits and assorted groceries every day with occasional help from her daughter. Catalina is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy sugar, rice, pasta and milk. Her dreams are that her children become professional and to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta and milk.

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Mrs. Choem V. lives in Srae Kaes village in Takeo province and she was born in 1954. She and her husband, Mr. Kim Leng Nhorn, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. She is also a farm laborer while her husband owns a pump. Her problem is that her field is far away from the irrigation system. So, to improve her rice production, Mrs. Choem V. is seeking a loan to buy gasoline. She is a mother of four children who are all are students in a local school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel M. lives with his father, two brothers, sister-in-law and one child in the village Arteni in the Aragatsotn region of Armenia. While one of the brothers is working on construction in Russia to be able to support himself, the other brother helps Samvel look after the cattle and cultivate the land. And although the family works very hard to makes ends meet, there is still much required. 

Samvel is planning for winter and he has applied for this loan to buy fodder for the cattle.

loans.use: Buying fodder for the cattle

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa S. is 54 years old.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 40, 38 and 28.  In 2000, she established a tea shop.  She works 6 days a week, 5 hours a day, to support her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy ingredients for her business.  In the future, Champa plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called chiya pasals, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (Patan BPW).  In 2007, Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW or to join our lending team, visit our partner page on Kiva (Nepal > Patan Business and Professional Women), and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for a tea shop

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Lilian tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio familiar junto con su esposo que consiste en la fabricación de muebles de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Lilian desprende una imagen de una madre trabajadora y responsable. Con su próximo préstamo, Lilian que espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar más materiales como por ejemplo madera, clavos, goma de carpintero, etc.  

Lilian se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Lilian belongs to Asociación Arariwa's “Mosoc Killa” community bank in the city of Cusco.  She lives in the same city.  Cusco is a charming city which dates back to Inca times.  It was built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Lilian is 39 years old.  She is married with two children and has a small family business together with her husband where they make wooden furniture.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well thanks to the great effort which she puts into her work.  Lilian is the very image of a hard-working and responsible mother.  With her loan for 800 nuevos soles, Lilian would like to increase her business and buy more materials such as wood, nails, carpenter's glue, etc.

Lilian is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business and buy more materials such as wood, nails, carpenter's glue, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Paola

texts.es:
Mercedes Paola B. F. tiene 22 años. Es casada  vive con el esposo y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Unidos Somos Mas  se dedican a la agricultura esta ventanilla se encuentra a 45 minutos de San Miguel en el Ríos a la Costa, todos los miembros viven en el mismo recinto, la mayoría de los socios trabajan en la siembra de maíz, trigo, papas en esta ventanilla son aproximadamente 10 miembros.

Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, trigo y papas, realiza las compras en La Parroquia San Pablo y vente en el mercado San Pablo.
  
Solicita el crédito para la comprar se suministros y fertilizantes para sus cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar terrenos y dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia y leer la prensa.
texts.en:
Mercedes Paola B. F., 22, is married and lives with her husband and son in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province.  She has one son.

The members of the “Unidos Somos Mas” (United We Are More) communal bank are farmers.  It is located forty five minutes from San Miguel in Ríos a la Costa.  All the members live in the same area and most farm corn, wheat and potatoes.  This communal bank has approximately 10 members.

Mercedes farms corn, broad bean, wheat and potatoes.  She makes her purchases in San Pablo parish and her sales in the San Pablo Market.

She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers.  Support from the loan will help her meet her economic needs.  They face challenges like pest infestations and illnesses.  Her dream is to buy land and provide education for her children.

She enjoys going on family outings and reading the newspaper.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en: Hamzeh is a 56 old married man and father of three children. Hamzeh has owned a coffee shop since 2000, with 20 years of experience in such a field. Hamzeh is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy a fridge, an air conditioner and the necessary materials for such a business. Hamzeh’s clients like visiting him and sitting with their old friends in his small express cafe (coffee shop), because he’s hard worker, clean and friendly. He also provides Arguileh (Hooka), and that’s what improves his business these days. His clients are of different ages. His dream was to own a big coffee shop and hopes to achieve it one day.

loans.use: To buy a fridge, an air conditioner and the necessary materials for such a business

loans.name: Mujeres Activas De Candia Loma Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Cía. Candía Loma de la ciudad de Caacupé.
 La Presidenta, la Sra. Petrona G. de Correa, vive con una hija y nietos, posee una despensa que es el sustento de su hogar, también ahora empieza con la venta de anteojos para lectura de venta libre, que le facilita la Fundación con otros de los programas con que trabaja, es una mujer muy trabajadora, y sacrificada, el crédito y las constantes capacitaciones son para ella un incentivo, un apoyo muy grande para salir adelante.
 Está muy agradecida con la fundación y por su intermedio con kiva por la confianza que depositaron en ella, y sus compañeras.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías ya que quiere estar bien surtida en su negocio para las fiestas, especialmente bebidas de consumo masivo, enlatados, dulces y otros.
texts.en:
The women of this group are from the city of Candia Loma in the Caacupe. The leader of the group is Petrona G. de Correa. She lives with one of her daughters and her grandchildren. She has a convenience store in her home. She has recently started selling reading glasses to the general public, which helps her with the other programs in which she participates. She is a very hard working woman who has sacrificed a great deal in her live. These loans and the constant support are an incentive for her and it is a great push for her to come out ahead. 

She is very grateful to the organization and to Kiva for the trust that they have imparted upon her and her colleagues. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise in order to stock her business in time for the holidays, especially drinks in large quantities, canned foods, sweets etc.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Dolores Aurora

texts.es:
La profesora  Dolores de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 13 añitos de edad la que estudia su primaria, a pesar que no recibe la ayuda del papà de su  hija, dolores ha luchado para que no le falte nada a su pequeña, labora como docente de primaria desde hace 11 años desempeñandose con gran dedicaciòn y esmero. 

Està solicitando su sexto crèdito a AFODENIC con la ayuda de Kiva a quien agradece por el financiamiento anterior el que ocupo para construir su habitacion.  Requiere nuevo credito para construir una habitaciòn para la niña y asi gozar de mejores condiciones. 

Su sueño en la vida es que su hija siga estudiando para que sea una persona de bien y mejorar poco a poco su vivienda, al igual que no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Dolores is 37 years old and a teacher.  She is a single mother and has a 13 year-old daughter who is in school.  In spite of the fact that she doesn't receive any money from her daughter's father, Dolores has worked hard so that her little one hasn't wanted for anything.  She has been working as an elementary school teacher for 11 years.  She does her job with a great deal of commitment and care.

Dolores is requesting her sixth loan from AFODENIC, with Kiva's help.  She is grateful to Kiva for her previous loan which she used to build a room in her house.  She requires a new loan to build a room for her daughter so that she can live in better conditions.

Dolores' dream in life is for her daughter to continue studying so that she can grow up to be a good person.  She would also like to gradually improve her home and make sure that she and her daughter don't want for anything.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Maximiana

texts.en:
Maximiana, 39 years old, is a married woman from the town of Trinidad. She is engaged in fishing. She helps her husband operate their fishing boat to catch assorted fish. Maximiana then sells her husband's catch at the market. Maximiana's husband also uses their motorcycle for business. He transports people around their community and this gives them daily income. 

Maximiana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maximiana is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be the first loan taken out by Maximiana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly K. is a mother of 13 children who are all adults. She is a dairy farmer in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya, where she has been farming for 20 years now. She sells her milk through Brookside Company in Litein town. She also earns income from the sale of tea and vegetables to the local market.

Her biggest challenge in this business has been lack of enough funds to expand her farming.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. Selly is a hardworking farmer and would like to improve her dairy farming in the future by acquiring high-yielding dairy cows and building a modern dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sea

texts.en: Sea L., 42, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. L. and her husband sell rice and raise pigs, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 98 USD on food and 23 USD on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase more rice and pigs to expand the current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more rice and pigs to expand the current business

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: El Sr M. labora como agente de seguridad   es  acompañado, tiene tres hijos  a su cargo,   es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para  comprar  cerámica, porcelana, boom y mano de obra, para  su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. M. works as a security guard.  He has a partner and has 3 dependent children.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, and he appreciates the support that they are providing him.  With this loan he will buy ceramic tiles, Boom (fast curing expanding foam used in construction), and labor to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Teolith

texts.es:
La Sra. Teolith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto y Provincia de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 57 años y cuenta con estudios superiores en Costura, Corte y Confección.
Es madre de 02 hijos, ambos independientes.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante, Teolith emprendió su negocio de Costura,  poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida y ahora cuenta con  clientela que a diario acuden a su casa a pedirle sus servicio, nos cuenta que tiene bastante trabajo por la etapa escolar, también cose vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños, pantalones de vestir y mucho más, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser, alfileres, y botones; así como también, invertirá en la compra de repuesto y mantenimiento de sus máquinas.
Teolith sueña con tener un local propio para su negocio, se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad que siempre esperaba, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Teolith is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas II” (Courageous Women II) in the District of Tarapoto in San Martín Province. She is 57 years old, married, and has received higher education in sewing and dressmaking. Teolith is the mother of two children, both of whom are independent.

Due to her efforts and desire to succeed, Teolith started a sewing business. She gradually became well-known and now has customers who come by her house to request her services. Teolith says she receives enough work during the school year, but she also produces suits for women, men, and children, trousers, and other types of garments. Her business is located in her home.

With this loan of 2500 PEN, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, sewing implements such as scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, needles, pins, and buttons. Teolith will also invest in the repair and maintenance of her machines. She dreams of having her own shop for her business.

Teolith feels like she is an accomplished woman and has great desire to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity she always wanted and helping other women who want to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies and pay for repair and maintenance of her machines.

loans.name: Jhimmy Francisco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jhimmy; él tiene 34 años de edad y es separado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de fotocopiadora, su negocio se encuentra ubicado al frente de la Universidad Nacional de San Antonio abad del Cusco, el cual lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio él trabaja de lunes a sábado por las mañanas, a la vez el socio es profesor de música el cual trabaja en las fiestas patronales, cargos y compromisos , el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

El socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su fotocopiadora y para comprar algunos accesorios que le faltan.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Jhimmy, 34, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

He is separated and has a son.  He alternates his daily activities with a photocopy services business.  His business is located across from the San Antonio Abad del Cusco National University.  He’s been in business for quite some time now and is open mornings from Monday through Saturday.  At the same time, he’s a music teacher and works during patron saint festival days or on commission.  He is a cheerful and responsible person.

He needs the loan to service his photocopier and to buy some accessories he needs.  He’s happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to service his photocopier and to buy some accessories he needs.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 56 years old, married and with four children. He sells cereals to earn a living. Besides that, he sells doughnuts so as to boost his income. He also earns more income from employment. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has witnessed a lot of business growth. He sees himself expanding his business into wholesale in the future. He hopes to own rental houses in the future. He wants 50, 000 Kes to buy maize, beans and peas.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and peas

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp, Ghada is a mother of one daughter, Ghada's husband Suhail is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns $330 per month. Ghada and her husband have very simple furniture, as their resources do not allow them to buy all the items they need, but since they have a daughter who is growing up, Ghada took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for her daughter and fix the room they have by painting and installing windows in the room.

Ghada's husband Suhail appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman as are most of the Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture and fix one of the rooms in the house

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 9 years. She is 50 years old, married to Peter Nganga and they have three children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to pay school fees for her daughters.

In the future, Eunice hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to pay her daughters' school fees.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha a single woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 5 years, she has had a café business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. In addition she also has a real estate house which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanaisha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business. 

With the KES 80,000, she wants to purchase and build a rental house, purchase 3 sacks of cement, 5 sacks of sand and stones. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase build rental house, purchase 3 sacks of cement, 5 sacks of sand and stones.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 35 years old and married, with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. Suzette has been running a general store in the Philippines for 8 years. She also earns an income from pig fattening, buying and selling frozen products and farming rice.

Suzette has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. Suzette hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Otelia

texts.en:
Otelia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and candies, which she has run for five years. 

Otelia has requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more products to sell in her store.

Otelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Otelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, candies and beverages.

loans.name: Bety

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a fisherman. She has eight children and seven go to school, 

She is currently in the business of selling dried fish. Now she wants to purchase more fish to sell.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Pelegrin, who is in his early 60s, is married with 10 children and 8 grandchildren. Some of them go to school. He has a musical instruments studio, which he rents during celebrations e.g. weddings, send-off parties, etc. He has had this business for seven years now.  He normA. works at night from 8 p.m. up to the end of the function.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to service his music system for household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy new CDs, pins and cables to maintain the system for better performance. His dream is to have a very big and international studio.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Royal", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy new CDs, pins and cables

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Wenceslao; el tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, el socio junto con su esposa tienen el negocio de venta de ropa donde venden blusas, polos y pantalones y el socio también se dedica al negocio de transporte, el realiza servicio de taxi desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo de transporte y negocio de venta de ropa el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte y también mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos y también para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos para el carro.
                                               
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MANOS JUNTAS” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and department.

This member is Sr. Wenceslao, who is 32 years old.  He lives with his partner and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities between his business buying and selling clothes, which he runs with his wife and where they sell blouses, polo shirts and pants, and his transportation business: he offers taxi services from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. Through his work as a taxi driver and his business selling clothes, Sr. Wenceslao is helping his children get ahead. He wants to expand his taxi service and also his business buying and selling clothes. He requests a loan to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts and also to maintain his car through the purchase of needed spare parts.

Sr. Wenceslao is happy about the loan and is committed to making his loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts and also to maintain his car through the purchase of needed spare parts..

loans.name: Melinda Talisic Group

texts.en:
Melinda sells soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc., to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. She is married with three children. Melinda is 39 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Each month, she earns 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase more soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.  In the future, Melinda hopes to have a bigger store with more sales. 

Melinda has been a member of PMPC for five months.She is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “FUENTE DE VIDA” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia María; tiene 32 años de edad,  la socia es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 14, 10, 9, 5 años de edad: la socia compra y vende productos ardiss los cuales compra de las mismas tiendas de venta permitida y los entrega a sus respectivos clientes, la socia vende estos productos naturales  para la salud y también se dedica  a la venta de  prendas de vestir, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de productos y ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios ella comprara productos de salud natural y prendas de vestir para damas, a caballeros y niños los cuales los vende de forma independiente a sus amistades.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Fuente de Vida" communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Maria is 32, single, and has 4 children ages 14, 10, 9 and 5. She buys and sells Ardiss products from authorized distributors and provides them to her customers. She sells these natural health products and also sells clothing. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of products and clothing. She is requesting this loan to invest in her businesses. She will purchase natural health products and items of clothing for women, men and children, which she sells independently to her friends.

She is grateful for the support that you are offering and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in her businesses. She will purchase natural health products and items of clothing for women, men and children to sell independently to her friends.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is 44 years old, married and has seven children aged between 3 and 18 living in his own semi-permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. He owns a business of hides and skin and also trades in produce. He has been doing these businesses for 20 years and this has enabled him to buy land and a motorcycle. He hopes his business will improve in the future and will be able to generate more income. Rashid needs a loan to buy maize, hides and skin for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, hides and skin for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Marites has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Arturo es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo que tiene desde hace 1 año, en una maquiladora desempeñando el oficio de operador. Hace ya mas de 3 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, la cual necesita construir una barda al frente para que esta mejor protegida; de algún delincuente que quiera robar alguna pertenencia de Carlos que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido comprando. Para poder realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material para iniciar la construcción y pagarle a la persona  mano de obra, todo para que el tenga mas tranquilidad al irse a su trabajo y dejar a su madre sin cuidado de que le pase algo.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos Arturo is a very responsible person who has been working for a year as a factory operator.  More than three years ago he acquired his subsidized house which is in need of a fence for greater protection against theft on the property that Carlos has worked hard to obtain.  In order to carry out his project he needs to buy material be begin construction and hire workers.  All of this is so he can go off to work and not have to worry about anything happening to his mother.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and rods, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Concepter

texts.en:
Concepter is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 28 and married, with 2 children between the ages of  6 and 2.  She has 5 years experience in farming and currently employs one farmhand.  Her farm produces milk, maize and beans for the local markets.
 
Concepter has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow and expand her dairy farm business.This is her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo.  She aspires to have five dairy cows and give her family better living standards.

She sees high costs of animal diseases during dry seasons as the major challenge

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes sells fried fish in Takoradi. She has five children. Her husband is a security man. She has been frying fish for sale for ten years now. As part of her responsibilities she pays utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to fry for sale. She hopes to reinvest the additional income she will earn as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
This is Simeona; she is 61 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to five children. All of her children already have their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Simeona operates an ornamental plant business. She grows ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and orchids. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the community. She's been in this business for five years, earning a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of 18,000 PHP. She will be use the money to buy things needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings, plastics, and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Simeona hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Judit

texts.es:
Judit se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora en y tambien esta vendiendo pasamaneria como escobillas,espejos,botones,agujas entre otros productos junto a su hija,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de pasamaneria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar botones,agujas,hilos y espejos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Judit is still working as a teacher and still selling notions like brushes, mirrors, buttons and needles among other items with her daughter.  She supports her children through these businesses and she wants to expand the business so is asking for a loan to buy buttons, needles, thread and mirrors at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy buttons, needles, thread and mirrors at wholesale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35 year old business man, who lives in Juba.  He is married and has three children between the ages of 17 and 10.  All of them go to school. 

Joseph runs a bar business, and he has been in the business for 5 years.  He has one employee.
Peter heard about Finance Sudan through the promotion and marketing done by the loans officers.  He is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to purchase items like beer, soda, and many other different types of drinks.  Joseph has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Joseph would like to increase the size of the business.

His major challenges include home expenses and a low income rate.

Joseph says that he is happy to see MFI's operating in South Sudan and helping them with loans, which means the country is developing.

loans.use: to purchase items like beer, soda, and many other different types of drinks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria, tiene un puesto de ventas de artículos de cristal, como ser vasos, jarras, jarrones. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital, comprar más mercadería y aprovechar las ventas de navidad. Maria  es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa de sus suegros la misma queda ubicada en la zona 16  de Julio  de la Ciudad de El Alto. La cliente se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente, que llegan a cinco, completamente pagados, ya que le ayudo a incrementar su capital y así tener mayores ingresos para la sustento de su familia . Es la tercera vez que su solicitud se canaliza hacia  Kiva.
texts.en: María has a stand where she sells crystal items like glasses, jars and jugs.  She needs the loan to increase capital and to buy more merchandise to take advantage of Christmas sales.  María is married and has four children.  She lives in her in-laws’ house which is located in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio zone.  She is very satisfied with the loans she’s gotten previously, which number five, completely repaid and which helped her increase capital to earn higher income for her family’s support.  This is the third time her request has been channeled toward Kiva.

loans.use: to buy glassware to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL PARAISO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Teodora. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida rápida, ferretería de herramientas, tejidos de mantas, hilado de lana de vicuña, tejido de mantas, venta de coca, comercio de ají y otros.

La señora Agustina,  indica que hace un año trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de vent5a de ají y otros que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de ají) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The El Paraiso Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. There are eight members in the group led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Teodora. The members have a variety of businesses such as selling fast food, running a hardware store, weaving blankets, spinning yarn from vicuna wool, selling coca leaves, and selling chili peppers.

Sra. Agustina began working with Pro Mujer a year ago. She joined the institution at the invitation of another member. Currently she runs a business selling chili peppers as well as other businesses she has had for several years. 

The loan she is seeking is for working capital so that she can buy more chilis from la Ceja which she will then sell in various markets. The income from her business enables her to support her family; she lives with her partner and their two children. Agustina tells us that she most enjoys the service provided by and the meetings organised by Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy chilis

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 31 years old and married with two children who are three and nine years old. He owns a butchery. He has been in the business for 10 years and has employed four people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy his own cows. He hopes to buy a plot and expand his butchery shop in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Heisell Maria

texts.es: Heisell de 25 años de edad es casada, trabaja como responsable de sucursal de la Cruz Lorena. Solicita su 4to   crèdito para comprar material didactico y para pagar mensualidad de ella y de su esposo en la Universidad URACCAN, ademas desea ayudar a su hermana con los gastos de bachillerato. Esta joven pareja  ha sido muy responsable y bien trabajadores,han luchado juntos para obtener su propia vivienda. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su esposo encuentre trabajo ya que ha quedado desempleado, culminar sus estudios universitarios y gozar de salud y que su familia permanezca unida.
texts.en:
Heisell, 25, is married and manages a Cruz Lorena branch office.  She’s asking for her 4th loan to buy school supplies and to pay her and her husband’s tuition at URACCAN University; she also wants to help with her sister’s high school costs.

This young couple has been very responsible and hardworking; they have striven together to obtain their own house.  Her greatest dream in life is that her husband finds employment since he is currently unemployed, to finish her university training, to enjoy good health and that her family stays together.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Yomar Alonso

texts.es:
Yomar es un joven de 24 años que aprendió la actividad de la venta de CD desde los 14 años de edad. Debido a que no proviene de una familia con grandes recursos económicos, Yomar ha tenido que trabajar para poder aportar a los ingresos del hogar y últimamente lo ha hecho con el ánimo de poder pagar sus estudios universitarios. Yomar ha trabajado en la calle durante todo este tiempo y ha tenido que atravesar por muchas adversidades en su vida, pues ha visto en varias ocasiones como su mercancía se le han decomisado por estar situado en lugares donde no es permitido comercializar. Yomar espera que estos problemas se resuelvan y espera seguir trabajando para pagar sus estudios universitarios. Yomar, con el ánimo de aumentar la variedad de CD’s que ofrece a sus clientes, espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de CD’s para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de sus productos.

Yomar espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá ofrecer productos que antes no tenía. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos pueda pagar su universidad y aportar a su hogar para contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yomar is a young 24-year-old who learned the CD retail business from the age of 14. Since he doesn't come from a family with a lot of financial resources, Yomar has had to work in order to be able to support his household with income, and lately he has worked in hopes of being able to pay his university studies. Yomar has worked on the street this entire time, and has had to face much adversity in his life, since he has had his merchandise confiscated several times for being situated in places where selling is not permitted. Yomar hopes that these problems may be resolved and hopes to continue working in order to pay for his university-level studies. Yomar, in order to increase the variety of CDs he has to offer his customers, hopes that a loan will give him the ability to purchase a greater variety of CDs to sell to his customers. 

Yomar hopes that in this way his income will grow considerably, since he will be able to offer products he previously did not have. Furthermore, he hopes that with greater income he will be able to pay for his studies at the university and support his household in order to contribute to a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase CDs so he can offer his customers a greater variety of products.

loans.name: Fenie

texts.en:
Fenie is 32 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Unidos, Plaridel. Fenie has a services business and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

Fenie is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase equipment for a sound system and bulbs used for services.  Fenie has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for a sound system and bulbs used for services

loans.name: Dieu Est Roi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST ROI est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans la même association. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Silikatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Silikatou n’a pas fréquentée l’école, mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu'elle exerce depuis treize ans dans son quartier. Colette est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Colette est mariée à un dépanneur du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Colette vend depuis treize ans des produits pharmaceutiques et cosmétiques. Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Colette ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST ROI, sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et pharmacetiques.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: A university student living in Phnom Penh city, Sophal is 19 years old. Nowadays, he is involved in his parent's business as a grocery seller and he add up time as a security guard to get salary to support on his study life. This is his first loan with VisionFund and he will use his loan portion to pay on tuition fee and prepare some needed document to study Marketing skill at abroad. Sophal hopes that this loan can help him to finish his education successfully and can help him to get a good job to support on his family’s living in the future time.

loans.use: To pay on tuition fee and prepare some needed document to study Marketing skill at abroad.
